column6: No comment
Good wings even better beer. The servers were really friendly and attentive. Nice place to hang back with friends. Will be back
COULD NOT BE BETTER. kind employees, cute seating area, and FANTASTIC food. the chicken and shrimp are my favorites but all are amazing. go at least once a week. LOVE
No comment

This place is a hidden gem in seaport. It's the perfect stop for Mexican food - tacos, bowls and burritos. So flavorful and much better than the other Mexican fast food options around the neighborhood. Try it, you'll love it!
No comment
Good and quick taco option in FiDi/Seaport. I think there are better tacos in the city, but the vibe here is very fun and it's a good spot to grab a quick snack.
No comment
No comment

We were looking for a quick and affordable restaurant to grab a bite to eat before a concert down at the pier and were lucky enough to stumble upon Luchadores. There was a bit of a line, however the food was worth our wait as everything was made to order and served steaming hot. They offer a decent amount of outdoor seating and we were able to grab a table without a problem. Our food was thoughtfully packaged to go and we could have easily brought it anywhere in the Seaport to enjoy. The guacamole and chips and corn pop were delicious appetizers. We absolutely loved our burrito and burrito bowl. We definitely recommend Luchadores to anyone passing through the Seaport area.

First time here after running past it several times. Cajun shrimp burrito was nice and filling and tasty. It also ate easy if that makes any sense - it was done in a moment despite looking like a hardy meal. The fish had a nice crispy outer which is what I prefer in a fish taco (you can keep the grilled ones away from me). The green sauce made me sweat - i like spicy but that's what it does to me. The luchador and the Sriracha Mayo were also good (I'm a condiment lover).
No comment

Great spot to grab quick meal and enjoy the after work happy hours!!! Fast turn around and right next to the pier/Hudson River. What could be better than this!!! I gotta try the Burritos next time. The Cajun shrimp, stark and fish tacos are so good!
No comment

Passed by this place so many times and noticed it's always packed. On a chilly Monday afternoon, my friend and I ventured to this place as it was not busy at all. To the point, it looked closed. Â I'm glad they weren't because we would not have enjoyed their food. The guy behind the counter is quite friendly. We asked for a taste of the chicken tortilla soup. It was very flavorful and the chicken was very tender. We got two orders of it! We also shared a healthy portion of nachos which was decadent. It was very good! Next time, we will try the tacos. Definitely we'll be coming back!

The nachos, chicken taco, and carnitas taco were all prepared fresh as we ordered and fantastic. My friend got the tortilla soup which was also said to be equally as good. Staff were very friendly and happy to help.
No comment

Small but chill joint with nice outdoor seating. Maybe not the most authentic Mexican food, but the chicken burrito bowl is really good for what it is! It's like chipotle but 100x better, as each ingredient is fresher and more flavorful. Friendly and efficient staff too.

Small little taco spot with bold flavors! This gem is right across from the seaport! I ordered a chicken taco with all the toppings available, plus a drizzle of the spicy mayo sauce--tortillas were very fresh too! Will be back again to try their Cajun shrimp taco (they ran out of it when I was there).

The food, the service, the portions, the happiness and aesthetics makes this place a gem! It's quality food, full servings, and really really good. I always pass this place and decided to stop in. The woman who allowed me to use Venmo, you're the best :). I will put all my co workers on to here and stop in again for my Carne Asada burrito!
No comment

Just happened to be passing this taco place and decided to give it a try. I had the grilled chicken nachos with red beans, pico de Gallo, cheese and spicy sauce. It was fresh, delicious and tasty. It very fulfilling and worth every penny. My friend had the chicken and corn. She said both we delectable.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
This place has the best burritos with homemade sauces. I am so glad they are open in the weekend and the staff is very friendly.

Luchadores is a small no-frills stall on the outskirts of South Seaport - basically the kind of store you come across as you're heading home from a nice walk. The line was pretty long and moved quite slow, there were 2 parties in front of us and it took around 15 minutes. There were only 2 guys working back there in a small space, so I understood. Everyone in line was patient and seemed like a good time to talk on date night. The burrito was massive and the fish taco was good, but the ingredients didn't taste as fresh as Tacombi down the street or others in the area. You get what you pay for. They also ran out of lettuce when we got there so he put cabbage instead (which I actually prefer) but running out of lettuce at peak dinner time is a big no-no. I think that was part of the slow down too because one of them had to keep running back to the fridge to check for ingredients and refill stuff. I appreciate the large portion sizes, but did note that neither of the servers were wearing masks while making the food. At least they changed their gloves in between, but while ringing us up he touched the cash register with his gloved hand, then used the same hand to sprinkle cheese on our burrito, only to swipe our card with the same gloved hand O_O
Panko fish burrito is best in class, highly recommend. Service is great, very efficient and an awesome looking store front.
No comment
Delicious, quick and reasonably priced. Enjoy a yummy burrito and a great view down at the Seaport!
Definition of a hole in the wall gem. Tacos are perfectly seasoned the CORN POP is a MUST. Cheap & good, what more could you ask for?
A really good taco spot! Very well priced. Chicken tacos were great and so was guac. Perfect for a quick lunch or casual dinner.
No comment

One of the best Mexican American restaurants in New York City for the price you can't go wrong you can get some of the greatest food cooked by somewhere of best Spanish folks around from all different parts of South America to Caribbean islands. Four workers are great the owners are awesome. The only drawback is it's in the winter there's no seating inside but besides that you can get a great meal for under $20 and before for the rest of the day. Also well known for the turnup prep dinner

if it's possible for hidden gems to still exist in manhattan, than this is the place. don't let the chipotle-style, order-at-the-counter setup deter you - this place has surprisingly fresh, affordable and delicious mexican food. if you're looking to pregame your pier 17 concert with nachos and tacos, or simply want a quick, delicious meal without fuss, than this is your spot. i personally love the chicken nachos. beer selection is also great. since this place has outside seating only, i recommend going asap while the weather is still warm!
No comment
No comment
This place is lit Â I swear with the prices they have ohh u get more of what you paid for! Must try the taco's and chips & guacamole
No comment

Solid pollo burritos that are so large, you're basically buying two meals in one (hooray for leftovers!), and excellent chips and guac. We did takeout, so can't give any feedback on their outdoor dining services. I'd say good spot if you live in the area!

Shrimp tacos had nice big shrimp but they were overcooked. Tasty and well seasoned, but still. Their carnitas taco was soaked in liquid. Not meaty liquid, like someone accidentally spilled water all over the taco. It was leaking onto the other ones in the container and breaking through the double tortilla. It also tasted like nothing, and the meat was shredded so fine it was stringy, becoming a watery lump in your mouth before disintegrating, like it came out of a pressure cooker. Not a fan.
Great little spot for tacos ! Had steak and Chicken tacos with a variety of topping choices. Everything was delicious. I definitely recommend the nachos !!
If you love Mexican try this spot! I walk the Pier and south to the bridge and this place is so great for amazing food before walking to Dumbo!
Shrimp tacos are phenomenal! Flavor on point. Service is efficient and courteous. Go to quick-lunch spot in the area. Can't lose.
No comment

I'm from the Bay Area where the burrito was invented, and lived in Los Angeles where it has the highest population of Hispanics, so Ive had a good amount of Mexican food, and I'll say Luchadores is the first Mexican restaurant I've liked in NYC. The burrito was good and they are always fast as well.

When the restaurants and bars starting opening back up, we ran straight to the City, straight to Seaport. Â It was a beautiful Saturday afternoon, and Luchadores was open, with outdoor places you could rest your food on to eat. Â We ordered a couple different tacos and quesadillas. Â Everything was delicious. Â There were a few of us, and the worker didn't have any issue keeping to all our different requests. Â The siracha mayo is on point too! Â My favorite might have been the fried fish, my friend, the shrimp. Â I will say they are a little pricey, but they are also delicious. Â One other big negative is, it takes FOREVER to get up to the front to order. Â There were 5 orders in front of me, I didn't get to the front for a half hour.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Omg carne Â Asada burrito and chips and guac were the perfect fit for my lunch. Amazing flavor and friendly staff.
This is a great spot in lower manhattan near New York Presbyterian Hospital, with great tacos! The scenery is great too!!

This place was a hidden gem - the corn pop was an 11/10. Everything was amazing, and served quickly. Great vibe, even better food. Not pictured was the corn pop - too good for the camera to eat first.
No comment
Good spot, fast service Â and great food. The nachos are the best and the burritos are good as well. The steak is great and fresh! I would just pay less chili on the corn.
No comment
I heard and saw this place for a long time and finally got a chance to try the taco & nachos. It was awesome! My husband said he hasn't eaten this kind of good tacos for a while.
I love this place. Simple clean food. Picnic benches outside are pleasant when it's warm. They do a great "Too Good to Go" sometimes. Not a fancy restaurant but perfect for what it is.
No comment

We were exploring the Seaport area & walking to the pier & we stumble across this little spot. They only had one customer sitting down on a hot sunny Sunday afternoon, so I told my friends sure why not let's get a burrito & some drinks. While we are reading their menu, we didn't see any employee's so we went up closer & we finally see a girl looking at us, we couldn't see her because the glass between us was kinda foggy, my boyfriend asked for a burrito & she responded with "wHicH OnE" with the most defeatist nasty attitude ever, so we literally didn't say anything & just walked away. Now we know why they only had one customer there... if you don't like your job work somewhere else.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Tacos are a little pricey but very good. Â $4.95 per taco. Â Had the chicken asada and carne asada. Â Good for a quick and fresh bite. Â Great location and good ambience.
No comment
No comment

I got a burrito bowl with chicken and ended up with the most violent food poisoning of my life. 24 hours later and I'm still sick. I've eaten here before no problems - but this put me off for good. Make sure your food is properly heated and cooled guys,
Nice, quick and more importantly safe. While the outdoor seating was limited we just crossed the street and ate by the waterfront. Food was delicious :)
No comment

OMG, Luchadores was certainly phenomenal. I also love the location. I am really happy that I went for their Short Rib Taco, it had great taste and now is my favorite. Team is really polite and definitely will help you with everything. Going back to Luchadores.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Once again saw a Mexican restaurant had to stop in and see what it was about! Let me start off by saying this is a small shareable table restaurant right outside the Seaport. The service is fast. I had the carne asado taco, and the Elote corn Amazing! Absolutely not cheap with the filling. I definitely would recommend this place. I didn't rate this a four stars because of its limited seating space especially during these beautiful summer weather.
this is kind of a not so popular but delicious seafood taco spot. it's a little hole in the wall set up with great shrimp tacos!

Arrived at the hotel after dark, took a quick walk and located this great place. Tiny space for ordering and dining in. It all worked brilliantly! I ordered a steak burrito, one grilled corn and a lime flavored Jarritos. Ate it all under an inflatable bubble and watched the NY traffic. Friendly service and solid food!

I had this when they were at a different location, but I assume it will still be the same. The adobo chicken burrito was fantastic and the sauces were amazing! We just stumbled upon it, but now it is a favorite when in town.
Best fish taco in the big Apple, they were very attentive and kind and super quick as well
No comment

Had high expectations after reading the reviews but definitely overrated. I'm Mexican and KNOW tacos and this place just didn't do it for me. Basic and meh on the flavor and they took FOREVER and were out of carne asada, pork and corn around 6pm on Saturday sooooo don't know what's up with that
No comment

I genuinely really like this place! The guacamole is good, and tacos are good as well! My friend did have cold chicken in her taco which was unfortunate. I always get the Panko fish taco and it has never failed me. The best fish taco I've had so far in the city. They are quick with making it, a tad over priced but definitely a good spot to have in the neighborhood.

If I'm craving a tasty taco in my neighborhood, I'll head over to Luchadores. During winter time, you can't miss the large igloo like dome outside for those who want to dine "out." During the warm summer months, grab a seat outside or sit inside the retro camper van that is parked out. The van's interior has been converted to accommodate (limited) seating. My favorite is the braised short rib taco. Always double up the tortilla. The short rib often sells out by late afternoon. When this happens, I'll order the fish taco (brings me back to my childhood in Los Angeles). Don't forget to add the hot sauce which ranges from mild to spicy. Love the spicy chipotle mayo sauce. You're also a stone's throw away from south street seaport's iconic sailing ship and the outdoor seating offers a great view of the ship.
No comment

In the winter they have a big inflatable igloo with a very strong heater. Overall, I love this place. The food was impeccable. Tasted pretty authentic (for NYC at least), didn't break the bank, and overall a pretty swanky experience. Thanks Luchadores, I'll definitely be coming back

The Cajun shrimp burrito is the best in Manhattan. I know it's a bold statement but damn it's good. Tacos are on point as well, this place is a true sleeper on the quick service Mexican scene. It's not going to be as quick as chipotle and if busy, food could take a while as the place is quite small, but if you head there at night, it's pretty empty. Incredibly cool location and ambiance, this is without a doubt a 5 star place.

I had a burrito...the good news is that it's a very large portion. Â The bad news is that it was dreadfully boring. Â I would prefer they make the portion smaller and increase the quality of ingredients. Â It's not that it tasted bad, I just felt like I was consuming calories for the sake of fueling up. Â There was no pleasure in this meal.

Great tacos, the nachos are not that good, they didn't have black beans or enough toppings. I thought it would be loaded nachos but if only had tomatoes and beans... the igloo is nice and warm and cute. I got the fish tacos and it was really good. The corn was not bad but it was kind of cold.

PRICES ARE RIDICULOUS! Watch out when you add the Guac to anything...it's $2 per Taco (tiny little taco! Probably less than a teaspoon...insane!) Chipotle charges less and gives you a shovel-full. I said no to the guac topping and no to any guac topping when my bf was adding his toppings. Clerk didn't tell him about the extra cost and just added to the bill when I was handing her cash. Like wow! That's another way of stealing your money! Otherwise, tacos and burritos are delicious and very fresh. Only reason I gave 2 instead of 1 star.

So so good every time I go! I don't think it's on the menu at the restaurant, but online they show they have short ribs you can add to any meal. I always get the short rib quesadilla and it's amazing. I always look forward to enjoying their food.

Stumbled upon this. It's right in front of the Hornblower cruise so it's a perfect Â location for a quick bite Â while waiting for your check-in time. The chicharrÃ³n was a bit salty for me but they provide lime which helps balance the flavor. The carne asase was my favorite. It was filling and Â very tasteful. They had a friendly service and provide different options for toppings and sauces for the burrito and taco
Outdoor space good for Covid and the lights/atmosphere have a lovely rustic vibe. Had a pollo burrito that was very good. Similar ingredients to Chipotle with more home cooked feel.
Doesn't taste like authentic Mexican food. But it's good. Line is too long for a lunch break.

We have walked passed here a couple of times and read good reviews so we decided to grab an early dinner and sit by the water. Â We were very disappointed. Â The cute little camper was gone and the food was mediocre and cold. Â So we can say we tried it but will probably not be back.
No comment

My go to burrito spot. As a student that lives a few blocks away form the store I personally love Luchadores. Not the best burrito I've had, but great for a college student budget. Fish tacos are also very good. They have a $15 card minimum.
Service was a bit off the couple times I went, but the food was high quality. Pop a squat in the van to Chow down and then take a walk by the water on a warm spring or summer day.

I came here the other day and just WOW. Exceptional service from Dave and Patrick! The fish tacos blew my mind! Carne asada is also a must have! Also super COVID safe! Will come back again with friends for sure

I really wanted to like this place but the food did not taste good at all. The carne asada in the burritos was quite bitter, and the corn pop was served cold, had too much cheese on it, and had an insane amount of seasoning on it that made it too smokey and bitter. Having grown up in Texas with access to great Mexican food, this did not meet the mark for me. Sadly, I will not be coming back. Loved the theme of the restaurant though!

No. If you're looking for tacos, this isn't the place. They aren't even trying to make good tacos. The tortillas seem like they came out of a bag and weren't even warmed. The tacos come with no unique or individualized ingredients specific to each type of taco. They just ask what toppings you want on your tacos. The choices were a basic pico, boring shredded lettuce, cold cheese, and super expensive guacamole. They have multiple types of sauces you can choose from, so that's ok. It's basically an expensive Taco Bell. To top it off, the people working there seems like they would rather be anywhere else in the world; as if we were a nuisance for being there ordering food. Tough to find anything redeeming about this place.

A great location and trendy VW bus can't save this place from poor service, high prices, and lack-luster food. Excited to try this cute spot after walking past it for months, I dropped in around 2pm last Friday with a friend to grab a quick bite only to be greeted by an unhelpful staff and a confusing ordering system. My friend went for the fish taco (ringing up at nearly $6 for a single taco) and I opted for the cajun shrimp burrito, tempted by the potential for interesting flavor combinations. Now, as a Bay Area native maybe I've just been spoiled by mission-style burritos, but I'd easily have taken Chipotle, at half the price, over what I was served at Luchadores. I've never been a fan of Chipotle. The tortilla was cold, the burrito was small, and the only discernible flavor was salt. I wasn't too impressed and will have a hard time finding a reason to go back.
Rude workers, they get upset when they mess up your order. Dry tacos and no lime when I placed my order
Overall the Food is good. I ordered steak and fish tacos and the corn pop. The only reason I did not give this place 5 stars is because the chips they served were a little stale.
This place is the prime example of a better version of chipotle. The food is always on point and it's also in a great location. Has to be my go to spot to bring friends to for lunch.

Keep it simple. Great tacos & burritos. Good service even when the line is long. If the weather is nice and seats available, sit outside. If ya go for the guacamole/salsa and chips double up on the chips. If your in the seaport area, this is the place to go for Mexican goodness!

This place is the best-kept secret @ Â Fulton street mall..The food is amazing with taste to match. Thumbs up to the Beef & Chicken Rice bowl with all the fixings and the combination of the hot & mild sauce is the absolute truth.

Luchadores is a great place if you want good Mexican food that is intimate location that can be easily overlooked if your not paying attention. Â  My wife and I are local to the area and this is the first time we came across it! Â We both had the Carne asada burrito that comes stacked with meat, rice beans, lettuce and shredded cheese (Guac is extra). Â Its a great break from the South Street Seaport! Â It a must go for locals and vacationers!
Excellent lunch spot. Fish tacos are incredible. Chicken tacos taste as well. Get it with the hot green sauce

This restaurant is so overpriced it's crazy. Â Three tacos with guacamole on top is over $21 and the food isn't even good. Â The staff is also so rude. Â Don't go here there's so many better taco places in Manhattan.

Luchadores charged me 6 dollars (2 each) for guacamole on my tacos. I was confused after I saw receipt and added it up and realized it was around 6-7 bucks off so I went back to ask for a receipt. They give me the receipt and tell me this, and I walk away saying that's crazy. The cashier then says Whats up? And then starts acting as if he wants to fight me, and starts degrading my girlfriend, calling her sweetheart. His boss had to hold him back and tell him to stop multiple times. I came in respectfully just asking for a receipt, and turned into the cashier literally degrading my girlfriend. 5 dollars a taco anyways is ridiculous, don't ever go here.
Location, location, location. Cute little place and a great spot to grab some food and see some sights. Food was good and a friendly staff. Limited seating.

Went here after strolling along Wall Street during lunch and it was great! The restaurant itself has limited seating but it's pretty cute because you sit in an igloo. We grabbed takeout and took it across the street to eat by the Pier. We each ordered the burrito which was huge and very flavourful. We were very happy with our visit and would return if in the area again.
Love it. They put up an adorable little bubble for the winter time so you can enjoy their outside seating. The food is amazing, end of story.
Chilled at the Seaport and stumbled across this lil gem. The carne asada burrito is seriously good. It comes jammed pack for 10 bucks. Lunch with Hubs aka Boss was a success. We will be back.
Ordered the carne asada burrito over grubhub and was really pleasantly surprised. Definitely will be ordering from here again!
Great Burritos! Fish burrito is fresh. Chicken burrito on point. Sriracha Mayo delicious.

A great local spot, similar to main stream burrito restaurants where you pick your own toppings. The steak had a nice char-grilled flavor. Good topping selections, including cilantro and a few different sauces to choose from. Very quick service, not much seating area.

This place is SO GOOD. A friend recently moved into the area and she and I stumbled on it, and I am so so happy we did. It was delicious. Very quick service. Cute outdoor seating area. It's got a great aesthetic going on and really solid food to support it. The best tacos I've had in NY.

I just cannot understand the good reviews. The price is ridiculous!! I've had much better tacos for less than half the price. This place is a rip off. The taste of the tacos does not justify the price I'm sorry

I had high hopes for this place, walked past this place on a late Sunday afternoon and saw that it was packed. So I decided to go on yelp and read reviews of this place before I ate here. I ordered the Carne Asada taco along with a Pollo taco. Unfortunately, both meats were cold, and there was way too much sauce and guacamole pilled on the taco for me to really taste the flavors of the meats. Prices are a little pricey but I guess it's because of the location.

Crappy customer service (terrible attitude & they didn't even offer napkins and I had to wipe my face with the paper bag!!), they wouldn't accept my credit card because I was buying $11 of food instead of $15 and I had to borrow cash from a coworker, tacos were bad & didn't taste fresh, plus they let a homeless person just go through their trash while customers were eating outside. Awful! Don't come here!

Loved it! If you are looking for a yummy taco or burrito, this is it. Fast and friendly service and yummy food, what else do you want? Seating is at shared picnic tables which is great or take your food over to the seaport and find yourself a spot. Either way you can't go wrong. If you are looking for stuffy and fancy, keep moving along. If you want tasty and casual, Â you found the spot!!!!

There are tons of taco joints in NYC. As I've said before, pick up a rock throw it in any direction, and you'll hit a taco joint. Well I threw another one and I hit Luchadores. I was tended to by a nice young lady named Paola. Since it was my first time, I only ordered a Carne Asada taco, a Chicharron taco and a side of rice and beans (black). The tacos are on the small side, but they are worth the price. The rice was on point. The beans even more so. The Carne asada was seasoned just right. The chicharron taco was pulled pork that was just devine. It comes with cracklings on top. The crackling alone is good enough to eat on a slipper. This just puts the chicharron taco over the edge for me. Love at first bite. I enjoyed this dish so much, I went right back a half hour later. This time I ordered a pollo asado taco AND ANOTHER Chicharron taco with the cracklings on top. This is a joint I would drive out of my way to. Can't wait to go back.

They said their soft taco tortillas were gluten free just to make a sale, causing me serious side effects! Chicken was greasy. Chips were greasy. Their "mild" sauce was practically a tacky spicy mayo. Mexican food is my favorite and I've tried many places, always going back to my favorite spots, but always willing to try a new place. This one disappointed!!!!!!

I had the carne asada burrito and other then it being salty there's no other flavor. You have to add any of the many sauces they provide in the squeeze bottles. The beef was also tough to chew. Beans and rice were bland. Chipotle is better and slightly cheaper.

My friends and I come to Luchadores about once a week. Their burritos are delicious, and the customer service provided is top notch. We love sitting in the bubble as we call it. It can get a little cold in the winter, but the food makes up for it. I love the sauces that Luchadores offers, I can't seem to find them anywhere else. Makes me wish I had access to this establishment all the time. Nonetheless, I love this place. My best friend swears on their fish tacos!

I used to love this place but upon bringing my mother who was visiting from DC to try them the manager was rude and didn't acknowledge us until 15 minutes AFTER they opened and another young Asian girl working rolled her eyes and shook her head at my mom when she decided to change her order. Rude!
Ordered delivery from here - yum! Just what I needed...really didn't feel like cooking tonight.
Amazingl!!! I can eat all day. My favorite spot in Chinatown. But just a heads up the the rice has a beef sauce on top of it. Very good but not for my friend who doesn't eat red meat
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

An affordable and filling gem in Chinatown! Located on the iconic Doyers St, Taiwan Pork Chop House is a one-stop shop for all your classic Taiwanese favourites! I got thier famous Pork Chop over rice, which was only $7.75 - and look at that HUGE pork chop! The meat was both crispy and tender, and it paired perfectly with the pickled veggies and fluffy rice underneath You can get the meal for takeout, but you can also dine in at one of their many tables! The service was quick and efficient, and while I was dining in they even brought be a cup of hot tea on an especially cold day Â An amazing local business that I will definitely visit again

We're regulars at this restaurant because the food always brings comfort; the flavor of each dish is amazing and hits the spot every time. Ordered the usual chicken over rice and chili wonton along with the hot & sour soup, which was the best I've ever had. It wasn't overly starchy and it wasn't the usual fluff, it was better! Wish they had larger size. They're often packed, but they managed to accommodate us on a small table right by their counter (a bit strange, but was fine). They only take cash, so be prepared.

LOVE this place! Â Definitely a hole in the wall BUT the food is so good. Â My go to is the pork chop over rice. Â The service is fast, the food is consistent and you can't beat the price. Â My favorite item is the pork chop over rice. Â The fried pork chop is always very well seasoned and fried just right...moist. Â They always top the rice with some vegetables which make it a complete meal, right?
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cutting to the chase, everything we ordered was served in the to-go containers. I guess that's what you get when you sneak in right before closing. My eating partner was doing the "back in Taiwan" comparison and didn't really like anything - but finished everything to not waste food (so not terrible). The oyster cake was a floppy omelet, and the herbal jelly ran sweet according to my partner, but to me, who doesn't know any better, thought it was no sweeter than some of the desserts we get anywhere else. Anyway, good cheap eats place, and worth another visit for me to get the other stuff.
No comment
The pork chop and chicken leg is delicious especially with the suancai on rice. Taro ball with herbal jelly is also good. Service is quick and prices are economical.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Affordable Taiwanese eats - not a huge stand out for me, but there are many options that are fairly priced. I got the fish ball noodle soup, fried chicken, and seafood/tofu mix and my husband got the pork over noodle soup. There aren't many authentic classic Taiwanese restaurants in Manhattan, so we decided to give it a try.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had no expectations for this place but I really liked it! I had the salt and pepper chicken over rice. The chicken was well fried and the pickled vegetables that accompanied it helped to cut into the heaviness of the deep frying. I ate the entire thing without even meaning to. Egg was pretty good but I would order again without as it didn't add much to the meal.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Great place for Taiwanese food. I got a basic pork chop over rice. Pork chop was cooked perfectly and paired with a soy egg, cabbage, pickled ingredients, and mixed with some more ground pork. Taiwan pork chop house has the best pork chops! I prefer the noodle soup on a cold day. It comes with comforting broth and bean sprouts. The pork chop over rice comes with the pickled cabbage. Â I have only ordered take out, but the service is fast. The pork chop is so flavorful and delicious. Would highly recommend! Will have to try to ices once it gets warmer.

Wow I'm so happy to find a really good Taiwanese restaurant in Manhattan ^^ As a Taiwanese American I'm happy to say that the dishes here are very authentic! I was pleasantly surprised by the pork chop and hong you chao shou (wonton in red oil). My friend ordered the fried oyster and the chicken leg over rice and honestly, every single dish was delicious and appropriately seasoned. The pork chop, which is part of their restaurant name, was very good and evenly seasoned/lightly roasted, plus because I got it a la carte it only cost me $3! It has a good amount of fatty vs lean meat and is cut into nice edible strips for you. The chicken leg and braised sauce over rice was also good, with a very thin fried film on the chicken so it's not too greasy or fried but still has a bit of smoky flavor. The real surprise to me was the wonton in chili oil. The first time I had it ten years ago, my friend took me to a local famous one in Taipei somewhere near Da An and I have been trying to find a comparable place in the US since, and I think I finally found one! The red chili oil is very fragrant and has plenty of minced garlic and cilantro so it is very flavorful. They also did a good job with the fried oyster.

I enjoyed their pork chop here. They take venmo which is great. Many places in Chinatown are cash only so this is very helpful. The Taiwanese ice dessert was just okay, I think I have to acquire a taste for it because it seems very popular!

Came back on this Sunday to try their pork chop. Ordered the pork chop rice and the pork chop noodle soup. The pork chop was nicely fried; not too dry. It was tasty with a hint of five spice seasoning which made this unique from the pork chop that I usually get from Vietnamese and Korean restaurants. The rice was also seasoned with five spice seasoning as well. Both dishes came with chopped pickled mustard green. I also decided to try the salt and pepper chicken. Crispy piece of dark meat chicken fried with a breading and also seasoned with five spice powder which made it very flavorful. Didn't taste the pepper; should have name it Five Spice Chicken instead. Overall, a nice dining experience for only less than $17.

So many amazing dishes here but you can't beat their signature pork over rice. For $5, you can get a HUGE meal here. It comes with a fried pork chop and pickled veggies over white rice. The pork chop is cooked perfectly, meat is super tender and juicy. The pickled veggies are great as well, sweet and tangy. They balance out the fat from the pork chop well. I've also tried their chicken over rice and wontons. Their wontons are served in chili oil and are among the best I've had in NYC. Don't expect friendly service or a nice atmosphere, but come here to pick up great food and take it to the park to eat.

Cheap prices, delicious foods, quick service... what else could you want? I've had their namesake dish, the pork chop, which was flavorful and chewy without being too tough, and perfectly paired with pickled vegetables and juicy pork over rice. I also ordered the hot and spicy wontons, which although not my favorite (the skin felt too thick), satisfied my craving for a spice kick. The soup noodles are generous and nicely textured as well. I'm a sucker for rice cake, so when I saw they had it on their menu, I knew I needed to order it. It was sticky and juicy, with generous bits of shredded pork and vegetables, including peas, which was a first for me. And finally, their shaved ice is SO GOOD! I was craving Taiwanese desserts and for $6, you get a generous portion of taro balls, red bean, and other yummy goodies that took me back to Asia. And yes I ordered all of this for myself... no shame! Packaged up the leftovers which will last me for a couple of days. I'll probably get 5-6 meals out of the dishes I ordered (and I can eat a lot!!), and since the total was ~$30, each meal averages to about $5! Not too shabby. They are cash only though so come prepared! And sadly when I tried to claim my free appetizer on Yelp, they didn't accept the deal. All in all, though, this place is worth every penny.

I was most looking forward to the oyster pancakes but was strongly disappointed by them. They don't have the right consistency or taste as good oyster pancakes. It was definitely more like korean pancakes, which would have been fine if that was what I had actually wanted. The salt and pepper chicken was good and crispy. The fish ball soup was also decent and had a nice broth. I didn't like the shanghai rice which was just a mess and seemed like it was made out of whatever was leftover in the kitchen. The pork and vegetable wontons in spicy oil was huge but in a bad way. These should be made smaller so it's not overpowered with filling. The sauce was also lacking and would have been a lot better if it was spicier and more flavorful. Good cheap prices but would rather spend more on better tasting food.
I went there order 2 pork chop on rice to go. I wasn't impressed at all. The pork chop was reheat and the rice wasn't hot at all. I wouldn't go back there again!

Bleh. Only came here because everything else nearby was super crowded on Christmas Day. It was getting packed, so they sat my family at a communal round table with 2 other couples.. kinda weird, but I guess it's better than waiting forever. Anyways, the food was insanely disappointing. Of everything we ordered, the pork chop was the best. The pork chop itself isn't breaded, so don't come here if you want a typical fried pork cutlet. We also tried the popcorn chicken and wontons. The popcorn chicken was not great -- flavor was off and it was not particularly crispy. My mom noticed that they used cilantro instead of the traditional basil. The wontons were a joke. They were humongous but flavorless even with all of the chili oil and stuff. I was pretty embarrassed to have brought my parents all the way to Chinatown to have crappy Taiwanese food. Not sure how this place has good reviews.
Must go in NYC. As a small eatery it offers you a mind and soul satisfaction with simple foods.
My favorite Taiwanese poke chop, the chicken is delicious too, real Taiwanese favor~ price is cheap too! But the dessert and the oyster pancakes is not the same as Taiwan. Don't order those.

It's not worth to spend a single second here. The salt and pepper chicken, pork chop and chicken leg are mediocre, especially the chicken leg out shell is hard and dry inside, garbage at all. As a a&p chicken lover and have had million times both in Taiwan and my Canada city, I'd say this place is totally not authentic, is way much worse than the night market in Taiwan and food court Taiwanese small rest in Toronto. How can this place to get that such high score??? I would become wealthy if gonna open a "Taiwan authentic restaurant" in NYC. OMG

The outside is unkept but that's how smart eaters know the food's going to be great & boy is it true as ever. The food is very impressive as many friends told me & being Taiwanese, I had to go & agree, it's so authentic, tasty, fast & fresh. I ordered the pork belly over rice which is unforgettably tasty. I also had a pork bone noodle soup which is so great on a winter day. The interior design is so-so but the snappy waitstaff make up for any such lacking. The portions are spot-on. The side dishes are very many which helps frequent eaters to have variety but the entrees are very many. A not shabby flow of non-locals (i.e. tourists) suggests it's hit some word-of-mouth or guidebook which is great news. Prices are unbeatable, I'm surprised they don't raise them.

I would give this cash-only place four stars for their chicken wing and rice dish and their egg drop soup. I liked how both had veggies and extras. HOWEVER there was a green and black beatle type of bug in the soup...

are you into cheap and filling eats? if yes, check this place out. the pork chop over rice has a five-spice esque taste to it and while I don't usually like picked vegetables, this was perfectly acceptable in this rice dish. it looks like they get quite a few customers during the lunch hours. looking forward to trying their rice cakes on another visit.

Famed for its pork chops, I didn't realize until last Friday that this spot also serves delectable desserts in the form of taro / grass jelly / mango bowls. The desserts come both hot or cold depending on your preference and are fairly solid by Manhattan standards. Should you ever have a craving for Taiwanese desserts (the full gamut of which this place only serves a sliver of), I'd say this place is a good bet.

Huge disappointment, perhaps I ordered the wrong items...pork & veg wonton in chili oil, bean curd/seaweed and minced pork over rice. The flavors were not authentic enough...seaweed under stewed and too hard to eat...wontons were enormous (more like dumplings) and the chili sauce lacked flavor...the bean curd dish seemed like it came straight out of a store bought package not slice thin. I'd have to say it's one of a handful of bad foodie experiences I've had in NY. Positives...price & quantity; definitely not flavor nor finesse. This is where looks (picture) can be deceiving!
This is a great place, their service is fast and good. The food is exactly the same as i tasted in Taiwan. I will definitely come for the second time. Great place, great people, great food
I just ordered a Taro ball herbal jelly, I eat it already after I saw a bug inside. It was so stomach-churning!!!

I got their ramen noodle soup with minced pork and veggies. This dish was fairly cheap and filling, but not the tastiest. The soup base was bland, but the veggies were fairly fresh. The meat level was below normal as there were about eight super small pieces throughout the entire bowl...the wonton noodle soup was good, though, although it needed a bit more seasoning just like the ramen noodle soup; pepper and soy sauce are great flavor savors!
Born and raised in Fujian province (close to Taiwan), I'm amazed by the quality of the food. Authentic Taiwan style! My favorite Chinese restaurant in NYC.

We ordered the pork chop over rice, marinated bean curd and seaweed and the oyster omelet. The pork chop was just slightly too overdone - but the flavoring was SO good! I also just loved the sour pickled vegetables that came in the rice dish. The oyster omelet looks nothing like the famous LuKang oyster omelet but it was also very good. The right flavors, very fluffy eggs, just enough oyster and crunch of veg and excellent crispy edge.

Always a valuable place to get authentic Taiwanese rice dishes, noodle dishes, and appetizers. This place hasn't changed in years...prices are still VERY reasonable (inexpensive), food is still good, portion is large as well.
No comment

Curry chicken noodle is a very poor rendition of curry chicken noodle soup. Â Service was friendly and everyone was nice, but the noodle dish was so bad. Â I'm so sorry for leaving a bad review for really friendly people, but curry chicken noodle soup was basically regular, standard broth with some curry powder mixed in. Â The chicken comprised of mostly chunks of legs so lots of free pieces of bones in there, but I still can sort through bone and meat so not a huge deal. Â Didn't eat the carrots or potatoes in there. Perhaps the pork chop is better here since the name of the place has pork chop, but avoid the curry chicken noodle soup, ya'll.
Good food at a very reasonable price. Tried the fish ball noodles. Would like to try the desert next time

I wish I can move up NYC, so I would love to have taro ball herbal jelly every day. Their dessert is super good: chewy taro ball, not too sweet, and refreshing. The chicken and duck are great, too. I definitely come back when I have a chance.

I am Taiwanese and I can tell you it's so not Taiwanese food. And if it was made by Taiwanese....they didn't get it right. My friend and I had the pork chop rice and beef noodle. They were both terrible. If you want authentic or close to authentic Taiwanese food, go to Flushing. Also the shaved ice with grass jelly, taro balls were so disappointing we didnt even finish it. Want authentic? Go to Meet Fresh.
Oh wow, does anyone else think of the Taiwanese chain YiDianWei when indulging in the pork chop rice bowl or is it just me? Cleaned the bowl to every last bit of rice and grease, so proud of myself
No comment

No comment

Great place for traditional Taiwanese food. Affordable and family-type restaurant. Definitely will come back. The only down side is there were few flies.

I ordered a Salt and Pepper Chicken over Rice and a Taiwanese Marinated Duck over Rice. Both dishes tasted like there's no salt added to them. The duck dish actually tasted more like chicken than duck.
No comment
No comment

This no frills Chinatown eatery is basic. Don't expect fancy. The service is polite but minimal English. Just point at the pictures. The food is satisfyingly good at a small price point. The pork chops are delicious. I'd like the oyster pancake but could do without the sweet Thai chili sauce that just didn't work it. The vegetable noodles are plenty to share. It was thick Udon like noodles in a light broth. The rice with pork and sour cabbage I'd come back for again.

It was my first time to be there yesterday with a journalist friend. He said this place is almost the favorite lunch place for their company. I tried Park Chop over rice which is very nice. The price is so cheap.
No comment
No comment

Tucked in the famous winding street of Doyers is where you'll find this restaurant. I am unfortunately a big fan of pork, live close by and decided to visit here with my niece for dinner yesterday. We got there around 6pm and found the place pretty full. We asked to sit and were directed to a large round table where 2 separate other guests were sitting. Alright. There was enough room for us though. I ALWAYS do my research before attending a restaurant and as you may have guessed, they have pork chops. We ordered one as well as the wonton with spicy oil and the salt and pepper chicken over white rice. The pork chop was okay. It was a descent size. The wontons were boiled and were surrounded by an oil that was just right in spice -- as I am a punk when it comes to anything spicy. I don't remember however the wontons having any meat in them. It was more noodle than anything and if there was any meat contained, it was at a bare minimal. The dish was garnished with a teaspoon of garlic and cilantro. The salt and pepper chicken was the most pleasurable for me. Just enough chicken (the size of popcorn chicken) for us. There was flavor there. Also served on a mountain of white rice and a ladle-filled portion of greens, which I could have done without. There was a fragrant note to them that was offsetting. There was also some cabbage in the mix and I was okay with that. A can of Coke and a Snapple Lemon IT to seal the deal. The ladies serving were stoic and will give you hot tea if you ask. All this for $15. Wow!!! They have take out here as well. I might visit again because they do have an extensive menu. Not a priority though.

I ordered wanton, duck over rice, marinade seaweed, egg, dried tofu. Wanton was really good, but too much skin and oil. Duck over rice and marinated food was way too different in Taiwanese food!! Why?? It's really disappointed me. I gave them three star because wanton was good! Also I didn't try pork chop here. I didn't want to eat fried stuff that day tho. I will come back here for try pork chop! Hopefully good!
Ordered pick-up for lunch today, chicken leg over rice for $5.75. Â Cheap, quick, and delicious. Â Will order something else and upload the picture next time...
Really really like taro balls!!!! Not too sweet. Also like the pork over rice! Price is sooooo good!
No comment
No comment
I love this place! I go there every time when I am in china town! The price is super friendly and the food is way beyond expectation!
No comment

We got the salt & pepper chicken and wonton with spicy oil. The chicken was more on the soft side and a bit salty. The portion of the wonton is smaller than i thought - it had 5 wontons but still worth the money.
Very Bad food!!! So disappointed . I can't even give any point. Appetizers are bad. Beef rice are so much gravy sauces!!!
It's like moms cooking nothing fancy but tasty. Prices are cheap as well, I would go back for some quick bites~

I used to like this place but the amount of MSG they use in every single dish is just very shocking also it means they probably don't use good ingredients to guarantee the flavor. I don't have any other problems with this place besides the MSG situation. It's kind of sad
No comment
No comment

Hole in the wall authentic Chinese place. Â We were touring NYC w my family and my cousin took us here insisting their pork chop rice is the best. Â We got four chop rice, my daughter wanted the wonton noodle soup, oyster pancake, hot oil wonton, marinades tofu, and lotus root a sweet rice. Â Pork chop rice was pretty good but my pork chop was tough at certain area, I didn't care about the lotus w sweet rice and the wonton noodle soup looked just ok. Â The oyster pancake was pretty good.
From the look, this place may seem really bad. However, their food is just amazing. I have been going here for 3 years and I never get tired of their pork chops with noodles...
This will be my canteen during the summer. Highly recommend their taro ball herbal jelly and Taiwanese Marinated Duck!

Wanted a quick bite- mainly to avoid the cold and was looking for something a little cheaper (as I've been spending way out of my budget). After scoping around on Yelp, I decided to put in a pick up order here. There seemed to be a lot of rave reviews about the fried chicken bento box so that's what I decided to order. This spot is small, snuggled in the middle of a lot of other Chinatown shops but easy to find. The cashier wasn't too attentive (maybe because the store was empty)? The bubble tea that I ordered was probably the worst one I've had and most definitely not something I would ever order here again. It was extremely watered down and quite expensive given the plethora of bubble tea establishments in its near proximity. The bento box was quite small-town a lot smaller than I expected it to be. The fried chicken however was delicious- packed with a lot of savory seasoning with each bite. Usually, when you order a bento box, you're expecting a pretty light on the stomach but satisfying meal. All in all, I'm not sure if I will end up finding myself wanting to eat here again because it wasn't for me, but maybe it might be for you.

My wife and I popped in 1st time for dinner Friday night. Â The food was so good! We had the pork chop over rice, chicken legs and hot and sour soup. Â Everything was really delicious, portions were generous and affordable. Â Even though it was a busy night, the service was overall very nice and quick. Â Definitely recommend.

Great prices, no frills, authentic Taiwanese food. Favorite dish is the ground pork sauce over rice that I add a few tea eggs to. If you're in the neighborhood, definitely recommend even for a quick snack!

Truly amazing beyond amazing extremely inexpensive Chinese food. More bang bang for your buck! Plus the sauce is really thick and not water down b. S. Very fragrant. Order the pork chops, or if you love hurry I. A curry. Order the chicken curry. They have it done in like 3-5 mins! SERIOUSLY!

We went there early in the morning in hope Â of beating the crowd. It turned out the crowd beat us:) when we finally sit down, I ordered everything that I wanted to try. The pork chop over rice is to die for. Chicken popcorn makes my mouth watering. Of course you can not have Taiwan mean without pairing a cup of bubble tea. I would definitely go there again and again
Very traditional Taiwan snacks and quick lunch place. My favorite so far is the shaved ice with taro and taro ball.
Traditional hole in the wall Taiwan local delicacy. Good to try n pretty low cost. It is an interesting combination of menu variety for most non-Asian foodies.

I always liked this place. Its really homestyle Taiwanese food. Depending on what you order it can be on the greasy/salty side but is always a good deal. I really like their pork chop over rice. The rice is sprinkled with shredded pork and picked cabbage. They then lay the pork chop right on the top. I also tried many of their appetizers. The wontons and the Jellyfish are great. Nothing on the menu exceeds $7.

My trips to Chinatown almost always include a stop by Taiwan Pork Chop House. This place has huge portions for the price you pay. A good example of this is are the Wontons with Spicy Oil. They call it a 'side dish' but seriously, this is entree-size. The wontons are HUGE and filled with mostly meat. I always have to force myself to stuff the last wonton in my mouth at the end of the meal...I'm 100% unable to limit my ordering at Taiwan Pork Chop House. It's just so cheap!! I also always try to order a dish I haven't tried yet each time I visit, and I haven't been disappointed yet (the price makes it hard to do that).
A mainstay of authentic Taiwanese food in Chinatown. Cheap and delicious.

My family and I love this place! We usually get the pork chop over rice as well as the noodle soup with chicken. The chicken is crispy, juicy and full of flavor, and the meat dishes usually come with a scoop or so of pickled cabbage(?). We also get the sub gum, which is flat rice cakes with meat and vegetables, and an order of tea eggs which come drizzled with oyster sauce. Sooo good!

Ordered the minced pork - it was only 4.50 so I am not complaining but there was a SPRINKLING of ground pork on top (maybe a table spoonful). It tasted good though and I would come back to try something else!

I gave it a 3 star because it's just not as good as May Wah. Â  The chicken leg over rice isn't bad but it's not as flavorful and a bit oily compared to maywah. Â  I do like that the seating is more comfortable and there are other food on the menu. Â  It's decently priced.
No comment
I'm Taiwanese, and I love they're food. It just so tastily^^
No comment

Came here with my friend on a lunch break. Ordered their porkchop rice, spicy oil wonton, beef with rice, and oyster pancake. It came out pretty quick. The flavors were not that spectacular. The wonton didn't have any flavors or Â any meat in it. I literally felt like I bit in mesh of wonton skins. As for the chili oil, they were not even that spicy or flavorful as well. As for the pancake, there were maybe only six pieces of oyster cut in small pieces. The pancake batter that they used were too watery. They ruin this dish completely. It tasted disgusting. The only good thing was the beef over rice and the porkchop over rice. This saved the place from getting a 1 or below stars. Will give this place another chance next time. If it gets worse, I'm bring my money somewhere else.

The warm grass jelly is so great! Others are just normal, the environment is also normal, but the price is great, 4 people just about $50 and everyone got sooo stuffed~ would still like to come back in the future, also they can deliver, definitely good choice for people around~

I really love the food here. I've tried many different Taiwanese style fried pork/chicken rice and none of them really matches what they have here. One thing to note is what really astonishes me is their meat sauce that comes with most if not all rice dishes. It is the best tasting meat sauce of its kind. I mostly order for delivery and they are quite fast. Â Sure, by the time it gets here, the carry over heating will cause it to over cook, but its still very tasty. Their soups are also one of the best tasting in Chinatown. The herbal one is great. The only negative I have for them is their beef noodle soup. it wasn't really good. Everything else is great. This house will always be my most favorite quick eats in Chinatown.

Totally affordable cheap taiwanese food. Â Where else can you go to get a huge porkchop bowl for $5.25? Â for the same price you can get the chicken leg rice bowl. Â have many taiwanese traditional dishes like oyster pancake and for dessert- you can even get the slushy ice with all the the usual toppings (mochi, red bean, kidney bean, rice balls, etc). YUMMY!

This place is so overrated! If you come here during dinner time, you have to wait to get seated and probably have to share a table with others. The food is definitely below average. We ordered the taro dessert and we found a staple in it. When we told the staff, they were so rude and dismissive. Definitely won't recommend anyone to come here.
Amazing food good staff and NO WAIT TIME!!! I will come back :-) Love the authentic Chinese vibe and the Taiwanese dessert :-) I'm in love!!!
Eew. Why did we come here? There is nothing Taiwanese about their food and I question the cleanliness of the place.
No comment
No comment

People really have to understand what type of place this is. Â It's a hole in the wall that serves Taiwanese comfort food in a back alley of Chinatown. Â Don't expect amazing service but do expect great pork chop over rice and excellent chicken leg over rice; it's also cheap and cash only.
Love this place. Very authentic, price is very reasonable. Most importantly everything they offer taste amazing. I've been their customer for years!!!

I can't really complaint anything about this place. The place says selling Taiwanese pork chop, and it does sell good pork chop and other hearty Taiwanese dishes. I order a pork chop over rice with pickled cabbage and salt n pepper chicken. Both are great for their price. The pork chop is tender and the seasoning is right. Worth a try.

I have no problem with service nor atmosphere. My rating is only based on how bad the food taste. I walked into the restaurant expecting for Taiwanese food as it appeared on their name. The reality is that this restaurant has no idea what Taiwanese food is. The beef noodle soup was so bad that I can't bear to take more than few sip. It was water mixed with msg at its very best, an instant noodle from a market will taste better than that. The oyster pancake looks more Korean than Taiwanese with very few oyster. It is quite a disappointment.

I honestly do not understand these great reviews. Ppl either have not tried Taiwanese food before or have not tried good Taiwanese food. While "good" is relatively subjective, there are standards that most cuisines usually adhere to. The meat wontons here simply do not have any meat in it. If you are lucky, you may see minimally visible pieces of ground meat. The pork chops that it's known for were also lackluster. They did not marinate the meat at all and there is an unpleasant 'raw' taste to it. The seaweed cold dish was also undercooked, making it difficult to chew and swallow. The popcorn chicken was decent, but adding basil instead of cilantro would make it more authentic. While food items here are dirt cheap, I would not mind paying a little bit more for actual authentic Taiwanese food. I had great hopes for this place, but the options in Flushing look much more promising.
Great food with really low price. And the service was really good. Highly recommend.

Ordered the marinated duck. It was not too fresh, I definitely had better duck elsewhere. I recommened the fried chicken over the duck any day of the week. The rice bowl was not too good. It contained some nasty tasting vegetables. This place is cheap, so do not expect the fanciest of bowls. I would not be coming back here.

I was surprised that it wasn't crowded at night on Columbus Day. The staffs are very nice. One of them handed the hot tea right after you sit down. AND THEIR BATHROOM WAS CLEAN!! Good place for quick pigging out. Decent price!
Very good and quick. Â  Definitely coming back for good pork chop. Thumbs up for sure .

This is exactly what a Taiwanese restaurant should be. A good selection of Taiwanese style dishes at very low prices. I stopped in one night and tried their Pork Chop over rice (æéª¨é¥­). The pork chop had a great flavor but I will say it did have some tough pieces in it here and there and some tiny pieces of bone scattered through it which were fun to pick out of my mouth. I did not really care for the flavor of the minced pork under the pork chop but the chop itself was pretty good.
No comment
Nice place for lunch. Taste great and reasonable price. Chicken over rice is my favourite. One of my alternative cafeteria during school time.
No comment

Cheap and affordable. Â The pork chop with rice is pretty good. Â Oyster pancake was okay, but not as authentic as those of other Taiwanese restaurants (mainly because of the sauce they give for it). Â However, again, the price is so cheap, and the food is tasty and acceptable given the low price.
The pork chop chop bowl is wonderful and very authentic. The wontons in spicy oil are also fantastic. Love getting the shaved ice in summer.

If I can give 0 star I would. Â This is the worse place in Chinatown. Â After reading the reviews we came here, it was nothing but disappointment. Â Oyster pancake with no oyster, and the pancake falling apart. Popcorn chicken got no basil taste. Â Never thought we walked long way for this.

Would come bakc again because of how cheap it was but was not actually good by any means. Friend and I split 5 dishes for only $26 (not including tip)--mind blown! I guess I have the same complaints about this place as I do all the other places in chinatown, but one huge plus about Taiwan Pork Chop House: GOOD SERVICE! Waitress was bad at english but was super, super patient and actually walked us through every single dish. So for that, y'all gotta come here, especially if you're new to Taiwanese food. I recommend the soups, they are really flavorful. Popcorn chicken was good. But vegetables and beef noodle soup was really eh. They are cash only!
Been going to this place for years, and still call it the Excellent Pork Chop House, as is right and proper. If you want delicious MSG-laden Chinese, come here!

Came here for a quick lunch and ordered the signature pork chop over rice. It was good comfort food, but nothing too special and a little too salty for my taste. Another gripe is that the provided teapot contained neither tea nor hot water, but cold water which was quite misleading. Hard to complain that much about a $5.50 meal though.
Didn't really taste very Taiwanese. Got the beef noodle, oyster pancake, and minced beef rice. It was just OK. Good price points tho. Doubt I'd come back

This is Taiwanese eatery indeed has the best pork chop on the rice in the city! Perfectly marinated pork chop is so tender and juicy! They also put braised pork sauce on the rice! Soooo good!!!! Yummmm!! Make sure to order wontons in red oil too!!
No comment

The pork chop noodle soup is pretty much the only really good thing to get here. Delightfully crisp outside and perfectly moist on the inside. The shaved ice is passable, though the ice crystals are too chunky.

I don't trust these 4-5-star reviews. I'm Taiwanese and I think their foods are not authentic. I had Pork Chop Over Rice and Salt&Pepper Chicken Over Rice. However, I did feel they taste awful and stale. It seems like recooked food. Although the price is reasonable and their service isn't bad, I will not visit here again.

I and my friend came here for the afternoon dessert at about 4 pm on Saturday. There were not many people at this time. We shared one taro ball herbal jelly. This was the second time I came here for eating this dessert. Last time I ordered a warm one, but I thought it would be better with a cold one because the mouthfeel of the warm black jelly didn't reach my expectation. This time we ordered a cold one and it tasted much better, even though on a winter day. It is with peanuts, raisin, big red beans, green beans, taro balls and ice. I thought it would be better without the peanut as the hard mouthfeel of it doesn't match with the soft taste of other things. When we ate almost one third of it, we felt it was not sweet enough, so we ordered some condensed milk added in it (+$0.5). When we ate more, we found it tasted more sweeter as the many sweet beans were at the bottom of the bowl. So it would be wise to agitate well before eating this dessert.

Probably one of the last bastions of cheap good authentic Taiwanese "everyday" food in Manhattan. Prices are low, food comes suspiciously fast, and everything tastes as if it was made in your Taiwanese neighbors house back in '97. Be sure to pick up a plate of those cold cucumbers!
I'm here for their pork rib soup always. Recently it added some interesting new sides. Oyster pancake was crispy and tasty.
Favorite Taiwanese restaurant in Chinatown. Very cheap and tastes just like something a person would eat at home. Their food is not greasy at all unlike a lot of other restaurants.
No comment
They have AMAZING chicken soup. Most definitely order their chicken soup (asian style), followed by their pork chop over rice.
No comment
I'm sorry, I went to this place yesterday for lunch, but it was such a disappointment. The taste changed?! I was so good few years ago, but this time..... I don't know, just different!!

I went to this place a week ago with my brother. Being born and raised in Taiwan; I had a lot of expectations with how authentic the cruising would be. We ordered fried chicken leg over rice, marinated seaweed, oyster pancake, and Taiwanese fried salty chicken. They were all really good except for the oyster pancake;I can tell the recipe is fixed to fit the Western taste. There were not / barely any oyster; however, the pancake itself tasted good with the sauce. YOU HAVE TO DIP IT IN THE SAUCE; or else it would be too blend. If you want a traditional oyster pancake, this is not it. However, the rest were pretty good!

Chicken or pork chop over noodle or rice + mince meat sauce + extra preserved cabbage + soy sauced boiled egg on side = a bowl of awesomeness. So happy this place is around my house. I can always rely on quick meal here. Other food on their menu is awesome too like their chicken broth, chili oil dumplings, jelly fish & pickled cucumbers. Summer time they have taiwanese shaved ice so get that if you have time & space after a meal.

Comes here every time for chicken leg over rice when I'm in Chinatown! Must go place it's cheap! And tasty! I always buy more than one order to bring home! Surprising thing is I went to Taiwan to try the same dish and it wasn't as tasty as this one!! So they made it better than the originals.

The porkchop, the porkchop, the porkchop is to die for. The side of preserved veg with minced meat (pork I think) was delish too. I believe we also tried the popcorn chicken and the chicken leg... all delicious and seriously cheap. Sir may I have one more?

Yeah, I've only been once, and, on its own, the meat in the pork rib soup would have been just OK, but the broth in the little bowl was inspiring: a sweetly porky delight with overtones of ginger root. And a mere $7.50. White rice was perfectly cooked Â too. Definitely will be back to try more.

This was suppose to be one of the great old spots in Chinatown NYC but after owner change this place went down the drain! Food is way off and over salty...the tea leaf egg tastes bad! I been to this place many times in the past and signature dishes is not worth the money!

How did I JUST find out about this place?? Â I could have been happily feasting on chicken and pork over rice and the brought (makes you think of winter nights at your grandma's) AND so cheap. So delicious. So Taiwanese. So in love.

Simple taiwanese pork chop rice bowls. The food is simple good tasty fast. Inexpensive And really filling. Pork chop or chicken leg with pickled veggies. Pretty good but I still like may wah better. Their shaved ice dessert was bs though. Came in a tiny bowl and had hardly any flavor.

This place used to be Excellent Pork Chop House. It's still the same place they just tweaked the name a little. Salt and pepper chicken was delicious. Wantons in chili oil are great as well, not particularly spicy either. I had Â shrimp and pork with broad noodles which was very good. I had the shanghai fried rice in the past which was very enjoyable. My friend that I brought with me loved it at at around $13 for both of us this place is a steal. It's BYOB and there's a liquor store next door. With such a huge selection of delicious dishes it's definitely worth checking out.
Loved the chopped pork rice (not really sure how it's called in English but it's the first one under the rice category)!! Very authentic and tasty, and the price is really low too!

simple and bare bones place but man is the food delicious. this is what i imagine home cooked Taiwanese meals to be! i LOVE the pork chop and/or chicken over rice bowl and the wontons with chili oil. i've also had the beef noodle soup and although it's good, it doesn't compare to some other places in the City. their dessert is also delicious but be sure to eat it fast (or first) since it'll melt on ya. i always mean to try their other dishes but once they seat me, i'm always craving the same stuff and ultimately, order them again and again.

Very disappointed. Ordered beef noodle soup, herbal soup, salt and pepper chicken over rice, and minced pork over rice. Soups were completely watered down, no flavor whatsoever. The waitress did not tell us the chicken over rice also included pork in the bowl, the same pork in the minced pork rice bowl we ordered. The minced pork was not very flavorful either. The only good thing was the chicken itself. We were so disappointed in the food that we didn't even bother to order shaved ice. Was really hoping to find a good Taiwanese spot.

This hole-in-the-wall pleasantly surprised me. The food came fast and service was attentive. The pork chop noodle was delicious though the broth can be seasoned a little better. The pork chop was so good, i ordered another side togo. Never tried Taiwanese food and will come again. As for the B rating, maybe they just had a bad day haha.

It's changed from "excellent" to "taiwan", but I don't notice any new change or renovation. It's still around $5 to $7 cash for a delicious bowl of grain and protein. Do you really need any more info?
The food is good, especially the pepper chicken. But I am not satisfied with the service, we did not call the check but they seem like want us to go quickly..
3.5 stars with consideration of their pricing. The food is ok but I really really really have no idea that why their pricing is soooooo low. Recommend th or minced marinated pork sauce on rice!
Little hidden gem, very tasty fried chicken over minced pork rice and great soup options, very authentic

My favorite Taiwanese pork chop restaurant in New York! The staffs are really friendly even though they are busy in general. The C-pop music also adds some homey atmosphere to the Taiwanese. The best thing is their food is so authentic, delicious with decent price. I usually order Pork chop rice or chicken leg rice, the soup with rice combo is also really tasty! Dont forget to try their wonton with spicy oil and the small dishes such as beancurd and seaweed and flavored egg. If you still have some room for your stomach, try their shaved ice with red beans, taros and so on it's my hubby's fav!
Always love here. I have been a loyal customer for 10 years. Every time I miss Taiwan I come here to treat my home sick
I tried their vegetable & pork wonton soup. A big wow, nothing like those wontons with greasy meat inside. Best wonton I ever had in the city.

Been coming here forever. Â  Business has gotten better through the years. Â  Food is still very good though I've noticed a little skimping on the vegetables and meat sauce on the pork chop over rice.

Very authentic taiwanese cheap eats. Place clearly and proudly displays MSG use. So be careful if you allergies to that. The pork chop and chicken leg dishes in rice or noodles are a great fix when you're craving some quick good eats.
Delicious Taiwanese food. Oyster pancake was crisp and delicious. However, it was somewhat lacking on the actual Oyster. Pork chop was good. Rice was just right.

The spicy pork and vegetable wontons were very good. I know a lot of other reviews said there was barely any meat inside, but my experience was quite the contrary. My wontons were stuffed silly with meat and veggies. What a great deal!

visited several times for Taiwanese ice, Salt pepper fired chicken and pork w. pickled cabbage stir fired noodle. Those were good. Beef stew noodle soup was not bad, but the soup tasted too much soy sauce. Â The "famous" pork chop over rice was honestly just so so. The rice was hard, pork chop was nothing impressive.

Another regular place of mines that my bf told me about! Excellent taiwan pork chop house is a close walk for me and i love eating their pork chops (greatly seasoned) over rice with minces meat and greenies on the side. and I love the salt and pepper chicken too. Food is good, wait can be long if they are busy but its not pricey and the food is good portion sizes.
I can't imagine how to get 5 dollars decent meals in other places of NYC! This place is definitely a MUST TASTE in China town.

Don't be fooled with the name "herbal soup with vegetable rice". The pig intestine really accentuates the herbal soup and the minced ground pork complements very well with the preserved vegetable. An very authentic experience!
cheap and wonderful food! taiwanese fried chicken is good, noodles are great too
This is the rebranded Excellent Pork Chop House. Service is quick, food is delicious, and still cheap as hell. Highly recommended if you love noodle soup!

My husband and I went to the Taiwan Pork Chop House for lunch not to long ago. It was our first time to dine here and were in Chinatown to visit a friend who recently had a new baby and wanted to grab lunch first. Taiwan Pork Chop House is more a no-frills establishment and if you are looking for more "ambiance" like they have in some of the newer restaurants, you will be sadly disappointed. This place looks like it's out of a scene from the 1980's. The bathroom is time warped from the 1950's. I think you get my point. Anyway, back to the food. We ordered 2-3 dishes and one of them being a seafood dish. They skimped out on the shrimp big time and loaded it up with tons of rice. Not cool. But what can you expect? The dishes aren't $$$. The service is okay but again, nowhere close to white glove service. It's just okay. Would I eat here again? Probably not. There are so many better Chinese restaurants in Chinatown that I wouldn't go back here unless there was a natural disaster of some sort (God forbid) and this was the only establishment open. Then I wouldn't have a choice.
