Really honors its name. Had just the fried pork chop as some snack (it's 2,50), and it was delicious
This place is the best. Pork chop over rice is perfectly seasoned and at $5.25 it is a total steal. I don't understand why this place never has a wait. It's my favorite place in Chinatown!
So inexpensive and delicious. My personal favorite is the oyster pancake!! The salt and pepper chicken is quite good too.

You know that One Star Michelin dim sum place in Hong Kong? Well, my rating is done in the same respect: the food is so good, that no other considerations like decor, etc. matter. Â When you walk inside, you see an extremely humble restaurant reminiscent of a small family owned restaurant in Taiwan. The large round tables are shared so be prepared to say hi to some strangers (everyone's really friendly so no big deal). Â The place would probably get a "B" in cleanliness, but once the food arrives at the table none of that matters. I'm Taiwanese American and had not eaten Taiwanese food in 3 months. After ordering the shredded pork rice (a staple of Taiwanese cuisine) and taking a monstrous bite, I began to cry. The humble flavors reminded me of Taiwan and my childhood when my mom would cook this dish for me after a day at school. I had an "Ego- Ratatoille" moment (when he ate the Ratatouille, Ego thought of his childhood) and had I had a pen to write notes, I would have also dropped it. Â The food is extremely delicious, simple, full of umami, and happiness. The staff is extremely friendly and also, did I mention the food is UBER CHEAP? Basically, a must when you're in NYC and if you live nearby, a regular place to visit indeed.

there food is very good we had pork chop over rice. it was amazing that they had pictures for all their dishes.It reminds me those lunch boxes I used to have in Taiwan; It was very Asian style! am Â American love there food.

I was disappointed with the four dishes and one dessert I ordered here. As a Taiwanese, I had hoped that this place would serve food that is at least minimally good. It's not. I wonder if the restaurant once had a Taiwanese chef but no more. I ordered well-known street food -- maybe that was a mistake. The pan fried oyster cake, a signature street food in Taiwan, was so unauthentic that they really should use another name for it. Their version is basically spring onion cake with bits of oysters; the sauce is the sweet and sour kind that's typically served with roast duck. If you've been to Taiwan, then you know the sauce should taste completely different. I also had Taiwanese marinated duck, salt+pepper chicken, Taiwanese kimchee and shaved ice (taro, red beans and condense milk). The duck and chicken are ok. The shaved ice was sad: globs of taro and red beans drenched in condense milk on top of fast-melting ice. I've never been served a worse-looking Taiwanese shaved ice. Perhaps the rice and noodle dishes are worth your time; I wouldn't know. I just wish I had a better experience eating there.

After reading all the good reviews, we decided to give this place a try. Yes, the food was cheap and the quality matched the prices. I grew up in Taiwan so I know what's good Taiwanese food. This restaurant is a cheap imposter. Nothing authentically Taiwanese. We ordered seafood stir fried noodles, pork chop rice, oyster pancake, fried oysters, and Taiwanese cabbage. The seafood was from frozen seafood packages so it's chewy and not tasty. The pork chops and minced pork sauce on the rice were not seasoned well and tasted stale. Instead of using tapioca starch in traditional Taiwanese oyster pancakes, they added wheat flour and that totally changed the texture. The sauce for oyster pancake wasn't made properly. The fried oysters were American style with thick flour coating instead of Taiwanese style with light coating. Even the cabbage was Napa cabbage instead of Taiwanese cabbage! They may be able to fool novice customers but not me!

Came back here and had a better experience. Â The night market chicken bento was fantastic this time. Â It seems they may have reformulated the recipe for the chicken. Â The batter was lighter and more heavily seasoned than it was last time.
Not quite Taiwan, but the closest you can get in NYC. So if you are missing Taiwanese food, this is where to go.

I always come here when I'm at Chinatown looking for Asian comfort food. Best pork chop rice in NYC. Comes with bean sprouts and sour cabbage. If you love both bean sprouts and sour cabbage, this is the place to be at.
Excellent night Great service Atmosphere was elegant lots of fun Food and drinks were great

What can I say but only this is a true jazz restaurant/lounge and one of the best. Great menu, but what an amazing cocktail menu... pages & pages of superb mixologies. The menu stated the price of the bacon was $5, but when the bill came, we got charged $12!!! If the burger had been good or better than the original, Â I wouldn't have minded the price increase given inflation. My mom's risotto came out cold. If we hadn't purchased another scotch bottle tonight, we probably wouldn't return. To top it all off, we found out that the great and lovely manager Dasha left the place. It is no wonder this was such a different experience from the past. At this point, it is clear they are catering to clueless tourists rather than regulars.

Had an absolutely lovely time here celebrating my wedding anniversary with my husband. They immediately wished us a happy anniversary upon arrival and also provided a happy anniversary chocolate and cupcake. All of the food was great. We had the grilled octopus which was a bit chewy but overall good. The lobster ravioli was amazing. My husband had the organic chicken and loved it with a side of creamed spinach. This place was amazing! Â The ambiance first of all, was great! Â Love that they had live music which was actually fun to listen to! The service was great! Â I had the jumbo lump crab cakes and just one was almost good enough as a meal. Â They were quite large! Â The accompaniments were unique, cornichons, lemons, pickles and a crema. Â I tried the crabcake with all of them and thought the cornichons paired best. Â  I was able to try the chilean seabass that my colleage ordered and it was melt in your mouth heaven. Â Last but not least, we had the famous tiramisu. Â Man is that sooo worth it! Â You have to get it even if just to watch the presentation of it all. Â Everything at this place was great! Â The only thing that did not allow me to give a 5 star rating was I asked a couple questions about the menu and water that was served and no one had any answers for me which was weird. This is such a charming place! I enjoyed brunch here in addition to hearing some wonderful jazz music! The service was impeccable. The ambiance was oozing with old warm charm and the food was delicious. The cocktails were incredible and very creative. All in all, this place is phenomenal.

I LOVED the live music. Was so different than the typical dinner night out. The ambience is very old school jazz. Cheese board, I enjoyed. I also got the gin samplers, presentation is adorable, deconstructed cocktails, but way too strong, doesn't really come together as a cocktail. The sea bass is YUM. Red snapper was no bueno at all, super fishy, but the manager was very apologetic and switched it for us. Ended up getting tartar instead, but was disappointing. Caesar salad was one of the bests I've ever had. A very cool and different dining experience .
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Really enjoyed the evening. Had dinnner with our adult children and their spouses. The food was very good, the music was excellent, and the wait staff could not be nicer. The cocktail menu is rather exotic for me, but everyone seemed to enjoy. I highly recommend for special occasions. It's a little pricey for your weekly go to place. Don't hesitate to give it a try. You won't be disappointed.

For my birthday this year, I wanted a cozy, intimate spot that was more than just a restaurant - and we got just that! The ambiance & decor of the place is fantastic. The live music was entertaining & great - it wasn't too loud or intrusive. It was just enough to be fun without being over bearing. The drinks were great & the food was fantastic. After reading the reviews, I was excited, and it truly lived up to my expectations.
Great Jazz Club with plenty of spacious seating and food was excellent .. Â Worth the trip when in New York if you want to relax and listen to great Jazz Â scene ..
No comment
Beautiful ambiance, speciality cocktails, delicious food and decadent dessert. Our waiter Chris was amazing and the jazz musicians brought an extra special experience.

A lovely place with beautiful cocktails, an impressive spirits selection, a well executed menu, and live music. For cocktails we went with an old fashioned made with an Elijah Craig Bourbon and the Oaxacan from the menu. The presentation on the Oaxacan was creative and helped keep it at the proper temperature. No spoiler - you'll have to go to see it! We split the cocktail shrimp - always a good test - and passed easily. The scallops were excellent although the corn spoon bread could have been warmer. Chicken with mashed and Brussell sprouts had a delicious crust. Coffee gelato was a nice finish and paired well with another old fashioned. Service was attentive, too! We'd have felt good about the value in NYC - but the live music totally put this place over the top. On Sunday night it was an excellent trio playing 1920s traditional jazz that evoked Coney Island. A great night out!
No comment

our server Ray, was absolutely amazing and so kind and welcoming!! It was my birthday and i felt very celebrated and he was such an amazing server!!! the live music is also so fun and very good, they are very talented! everything about this place is great! the food, exquisite!!
No comment
Just incredible, top to bottom. I am now a jazz fan!! Highly recommend for a great NYC experience.
No comment

Lovely spot with class. Midtown is really a food dessert and full of tourist traps. But glad we gave Fine & Rare a go. Their menu was thoughtful and concise with something for everyone. The drinks are yummy and good looking. Look forward to be back for some jazz music!
No comment

everything was lovely. from the decor and cozy vibes, to the music, service and food. no matter where you sit in the restaurant, you'll have a unique experience. i had the chicken, the kale caesar salad, and the chocolate cake. everything was delicious, especially the chicken and cake! my favorite cocktail i tried was the Oaxaca potion, it looked so pretty and tasted so good. we had a two hour time limit for our table which seemed more than reasonable, and were able to hang out at the bar after dinner to continue watching the band. can't wait to come back soon! thanks for a wonderful evening.

Delicious octopus, oysters and crab cakes. Excellent drinks list and thoughtful, delightful service team. My group was not a group of dessert eaters but I'm excited to go back and try the desserts, too. Outdoor seating is fully enclosed but they allow you to keep the doors open for better ventilation on request. Looking forward to returning.

Service is amazing! Drinks are amazing as well. Food is bomb! I love how truffle the fries are as well as the yukon mash potatoes. The ambiance of the place was just spectacular. Recommend!!!!!! Will definitely come back!
No comment

I want to take the time out to thank the wonderful staff for accommodating my friends and I. Temperature checks are taken upon arrival. I'm so happy I chose this place to celebrate my friends birthday. The decor was stunning giving you a Renaissance feel with a twist. The jazz band was absolutely amazing and our waiter Nash was phenomenal. I can't thank you enough for making my best friends birthday spectacular. I had a wonderful time from the food, to the beautiful cocktails. This place is a gem! I can't wait to come back here!

Had a good time. Ordered scallops for main course which was great and Celt it had a sweet sauce which I did not care for. I understand the octopus and kale salad was good as well. We ordered the 24 layer chocolate. I thought it was fine layers like lady M but this was a tower. Had to pack it up. Was yummy though so if you are in a group of 4 or 5 definitely order this.
No comment

Every time here was perfect - the cocktails, the wine, the whiskey, the jazz band, the food the hostess and the waiters. Perfect for friends and dates..or even a small gathering. The owner was absolutely hospitable and knows his business. Love this place.
No comment

We wanted to top off a busy Saturday with a quiet dinner in Midtown near our hotel. Instead we ended up at Fine & Rare, with a blasting jazz band with Brian Newman at the helm - trumpeter extraordinaire and jazz bebop flowing. Really good vibe at this place. True to the name the drinks were fine (a smoky bourbon Old-Fashioned spewing liquid smoke) and the meat was rare (too rare- the kitchen whiffed on this one). Â But the manager, Kristin, rescued the situation- sending back the meat to be done right. Â All was well from then on! Â  A great place, with top-notch attention to detail by Kristin and her team.
No comment
Best atmosphere I've experienced in NYC. Great food, great alcohol, great music. Couldn't ask for a better experience.
Food was amazing. The atmosphere, the employee's and the live music were Â up to par. Will definitely return

A friend of mine got a promotion so I took him to dinner to celebrate. Â We had a great time, live music, amazing drinks, good food, and impeccable service. Â A European friend who joined us said "This is the NYC I expected to see when I fist came to the US." Â Yes, the 1920s Speak Easy ambience/supper club vibe is real. Â And no cover for the live music! Â Truly one of my favorite NYC spots.
The music was so great. The craft cocktail were delicious but absolve all the manager made our experience so great. I will be back with all my friends and I highly recommend fine and rare
This was a grerestaurant from the food, atmosphere and music! Desserts were tasty!The sphere chocolate cake was delicious!!!
We had a nice diner with my wife there for her birthday. There was a live concert with great singer. The food was great. The service is on the very high level, staff was very polite and attentive.

Amazing place. Love it. Ambiance of the bar magnificent. Makes you feel so special. I really recommend

I put five stars for drinks, the best desserts and service. The food was terrible, especially the large Tomahawk was like rubber, the red snapper was semi-raw and no poorly fried, the risotto stank incomprehensibly, as if from a Â fast food place. Disappointed in the food satisfied with the end of our stay as mentioned above, pleased with the desserts and drinks, the bartender more respect.

It is unfortunate that the service is extremely lacking. Both customer service and table service. This was my second time visiting and I was not thrilled the first time so I had been holding back on returning. Well after the experience with the host/manager being quite rude on the phone and at the door, as well as the difficult communication with my server, I'm not sure if I will return again. I also asked for a mock-tail and instead of double checking the server brought me a drink with alcohol. I also tried to email the restaurant to adjust my reservation and never received a reply.

Okay, This was my first time at Fine & Rare, to celebrate my birthday with a little brunch with two of my closest friends, and believe me, it won't be the last time. Everything about this restaurant got me very excited about the dining out again, from the staff friendly and attentive Demeanor to the smooths sounds of Jazz players and last but not least, the food and drinks. I had the steak, potatoes, and scrambled eggs, so delicious. Thank you, Fine &Rare, for your Hospitality!

Wow. My new favorite spot in NYC. Bands were incredible (Kelly and Brian Newman both performed). Absolutely fantastic food, had a wonderful server Chris. Drinks were divine!!! Food was superb. Can't wait to go back.

My friends live around the corner and brought me here, we had cocktails and listened to the live jazz music. Â It ended up being the last live music I saw before covid destroyed all my hobbies. Â If I had to pick a bar to have my last cocktails and live music for several months (maybe a year?), Fine & Rare was a great place to have it. Â I can't wait to come back and cheers to live music again here, but until then, I will continuously watch the short snapchat video I have of my night here and reminisce about what it was like to sit in a bar, have a delicious cocktail, and listen to live music.

I love everything about this restaurant. I will definitely visit again. Sorry don't have pictures to share I was busy enjoying the Jazz and everything else.

Live music we had the evening we went was from 1910s-1920s. It was great. The presentation of the food was great. However, the taste of almost every dish we had was extremely underwhelming. The trout was cooked beautifully. The skin was crispy, but it needed salt badly. Portions were small, too. Did not enjoy the food overall. It could just be because it was restaurant week, but you figure restaurant week is when restaurants would put forward their best to attract new customers. I'll try it one more time for regular meals, but if it's the same experience, I will not return.

Wow. Just was there last night. Ambience, food and drink all get 5 stars. If you're looking for the perfect date night, come here. Their outdoor setup is hands down the best I've seen in NYC this past year. They've even setup air conditioning in the unit, so no worries about overheating on the hot street this summer! Very classy, pricey spot.
Amazing place to take a date. Great background music especially with live jazz music. Also, they have amazing drinks! Definitely coming back to this place
No comment
This place was rare and true gem. The waiter and the hosts were so sweet and attentive they even gave us the best seat in the house. The live music was amazing and drinks were amazingly delicious.
No comment
Clean, kind staffs! They have a band playing beautiful music!! Good quality food with good quantity as well. Will def come back!! Bathroom door was huge for mirror selfies too:)
No comment

We came here with friends during restaurant week and it was beautiful. The ambience is great and had live jazz music playing. The performers were amazing. Most of us ordered from the restaurant week menu and really enjoyed it. Some also ordered the drink pairings. Everything was beautifully prepared and tasted delicious. I loved the vibe of this place and really enjoyed coming here. I would highly recommend if you enjoy jazz music also.

I can't believe this place hasn't been exposed and blown up yet! It's such a hidden gem . Mark such an incredible attribute to those restaurant! He gave us such a warm welcome as soon as we walked in and I'd be honored to have him as the face as my company! They have live jazz bands play during brunch and many other nights! Their food is amazing and their drinks are even better! They have over a thousand wines and spirits in house! When you come here you get treated with the best service, receive quality food, and listen to great music! The best mimosa is the honey one! Also must try love bread. Also Mark brought us a dessert tasting complimentary for us to try! SOMEONE promote this man! Will definitely be back and recommending to everyone I know!
No comment
Place is incredible..A bit on the pricier side but the cocktails are amazing..Staff is very knowledgeable and accommodating. One of the best cocktail vibes in the city, for sure.
No comment

Took my husband here for our anniversary. We had never been but the live jazz, great reviews, and healthy menu options drew us in. We ordered a bunch of apps- burrata, crab cocktail, beet salad, wagyu special, truffle fries. Everything was divine. Our favorite was the crab cocktail bc it was a lot of crab and so tasty. My husband also ordered the steak and it was cooked to perfection. I requested a sidecar cocktail and they were able to make it no problem and it was fabulous. Our waitress was great and we will definitely be back.

As someone who doesn't always take the time out to leave reviews when I have a good experience, I had to leave a rave review for this restaurant because my experience last night was UNBELIEVABLE. My waitress' name Â was Young and if I could leave a review for her alone, I would give her 10 stars! From start to finish, this restaurant exceeded my expectations. I went for a special birthday dinner and the ambiance was incredible. The live music was excellent (not too loud and we were sitting right in front of the stage), and the food/drinks were absolutely divine. We started with the combo meat/cheese/patÃ© board and octopus, then had the NY strip and the Chilean sea bass as entrees (the Chilean sea bass with cauliflower purÃ©e was OUTSTANDING, I swear I dreamt about it in my sleep), and because it was my boyfriend's birthday, they sent over a very cute complimentary chocolate cupcake with a candle, and we ordered the Sphere for dessert which was gorgeous and worth every penny. Their whiskey selection is out of this world (so many to choose from, almost overwhelmingly so) so we chose to do a whiskey flight. Young was so informative and really took the time out to explain each and every whiskey to us. She even gave him a little whiskey on the house while we were waiting for dinner just as a birthday gesture. I ordered two cocktails beforehand which were both also great. We never felt unattended because they checked on us frequently, and I can't stress enough, this was probably the best dining experience I've ever had BAR NONE. If you're thinking about going to this restaurant and bringing someone special, RUN don't walk. I'll certainly be back in the future!!
No comment
No comment

My husband and I went to Fine & Rare for our anniversary. Â It was the most amazing experience. Â The service was spectacular and the food was breathtaking, Â From the appearance to the taste, it was just wonderful. Â Now to the drinks, the Bourbon Explorer to the wines, it was delicious! Â Most of all the service was so wonderful. I can't wait to go again. Â Thank you to a wonderful staff and many memories

Love Fine and Rare. The cocktails were good, especially the whiskey selection. While the food isn't mind1blowing, I don't thing that's the reason for coming here. The atmosphere is throwback and the entertainment likewise. The music kept us engaged the whole time. Definitely will be returning.

Absolutely unique and wonderful spot. Fine dining experience with the warm comfort of quality live jazz bands. Candle lights, mellow, sultry mood. The menu was delicious and the ambience was phenomenal. Staff extremely attentive. Great for a date night. Love.

Oh my! The ambience here is everything. Only topped by their craft cocktails and live music. I was celebrating and this is the perfect venue. Â Very hospitable and low key venue. Five stars even though I think they can do better with their food menu. The experience of a nice dinner here is everything!

Can I just start off by saying that I been wanting to come to this place for a year ! This place was so amazing & i'm so happy to have came here. I took my mother here for Mother's Day & it was so warm and inviting. They have live jazz music every night and the musicians were incredible! We were a party of four & we all ordered something different on the menu and all enjoyed everything that was ordered! The place had a Great Gatsby feel to it. Throughout the Interior Â we noticed that there were alcohol displayed all around & were labeled under names for regulars & their drink of choice. Might sound corny but I thought it was interesting ;) too bad I can't upload my video of the jazz band that was playing! The guitar player was amazing to watch and listen to, especially the solo he had!!! Only thing that was a little disappointing was that the salmon lacked flavor. I asked for the skin to be crispy & unfortunately my plate did not come really hot (right off the pan) however we all still enjoyed our time & experience! Out waiter Chris was very helpful and informative & was very attentive! The buss boy was also very efficient and was very on point! Our table appreciated him as well!

Fine & Rare is simply absolutely marvelous. Honestly great value for the price. Pretty much every menu item that we purchased was incredibly fresh and yummy. Folks working there are always so friendly. All in all Fine & Rare has great experience, great staff, great spot, reasonable price.
No comment

Hostess was foul and rude. Â Would not recommend this place which is trying to come off as high class. Â It takes more than a name and attitude to be a classy establishment. Â Try the Gold Room or really anything else.

I am certainly not a New Yorker, so I enjoy when I am in the city just walking to find different, off the beaten path places for dinner, with the help of my friend Yelp, of course. Â Fine and Rare came across my radar tonight. Â Quite a quaint place, would be nice if my wife were here for a date. Â A low key jazz group and vocals playing, a bar menu that was a book. Â I settled in to the recommended bologna section, which can be great if it is genuine (ok, I am a bolognese snob), or awful if it comes out of boxes and cans. Â I am happy to say this was excellent! Â I will have to come back and try the Bronzino. Â A nice out of the way find in Manhattan. Dark, jazzy, music, classic bar menu, good food.
Great drinks, amazing live music, and the staff members are so friendly. We had a blast!

Incredible night out with my college friends who I have not seen since right before the pandemic hit. We had amazing service, cocktails and food. The outside seating area was really beautiful. Highly recommend.

Here for brunch. Â Great food, jazz, atmoshpere and service at a reasonable price. Â Will be back with more friends for dinner!!

Went here for a friends birthday, I have to say that there is liquors like rare ones all over the restaurant in these shelves that looks like the library but with liquors. Live jazz music was a plus without hearing other people's conversation, the food was very food but pricey. Dessert on the other hand was artistic and crafty especially the sphere where they use chocolate to melt the sphere and opens to a ice cream dessert, overall an enjoyable experience and would want to come back here to try the rare dishes such as the ostrich egg or the scorpion fish.

I absolutely love this place. The atmosphere is incredible- live jazz music in the background setting the ambiance, not like some places where you get yelled at if you talk to the person you're having dinner with. I love the food. The drinks are excellent- they can make pretty much anything and they get really creative with what they do! The bookshelves lined with bottles is an awesome view. Cozy in winter with a fireplace. Highly recommend!

Fine & Rare takes you back in time. I like coming here for the mouth watering cocktails, it's so entertaining watching the bartender make your drink. Their collection of whiskeys are something to really brag about. I can't wait to go back!

Amazing place to come in and enjoy great drinks, small plates and great musicians. Stop here every time I can when visiting the city.

Every aspect of the food, service, and atmosphere at Fine & Rare was immaculate! My boyfriend and I had such a wonderful experience, we are both already dying to go back. The drinks were flowing, food was absolutely delicious, and the service was top-notch! Not to mention they have live music every night? The venue itself is also very impressive. Fine & Rare will be my new secret weapon when I want to have an unforgettable night.

The place has great decor and the service was good. Managers came to check on the table twice. The food was good, not great. But the jazz was really good and enjoyable. Â This is a nice place if you want to do something different. By the way the cocktails were perfect!

I came here for an earlyish dinner reservation with a group of 4 of us. We all arrive by 510 pm (10 minutes after the reservation time) and were scolded for being late... then 15 minutes after we seated the hostess came again and said we'd have to leave by 630 pm. I don't think anyone should feel like they're being kicked out before ordering food! Okay so we order drinks and then it takes a while for the waiter to come back for ordering our meals. Meanwhile the hostess comes back again and says we can stay until 8 pm... I imagine the next table party cancelled? We eventually order and receive our meals... I enjoyed the roasted chicken and my husband wasn't impressed by the steak. The fries were very thick cut and more soggy than fried. The sphere dessert was beautifully presented and incredibly rich. The bartenders here are skilled and artistic, loved the drinks! In the background were some excellent 20's style performers. This was a cool place with great drinks, an overall unique atmosphere, but subpar hostess service. Next time, don't try to kick your customers out before they've even ordered!

This place is perfect for a special occasion. They really pay attention to every detail and look like they enjoy it too, which makes all the difference in New York. The selection of drinks is wonderful, and the food was delicious. The musicians and the lady singer this evening killed it. We really enjoy our dinner and entertainment. Five stars all the way.

It was not crowded and very pleasant on a Friday evening. The two of us did have to sit at the bar though, as some tables were reserved. We got a good view of the stage, with the live music. They have a good selection of cocktails. We were amazed at how beautiful "the garden of eden" was. I would return.
No comment
No comment

Our temperatures were taken at the door and waitstaff were masked. Drinks were very good (especially the blackberry gimlet) but that's where my good experience ends. The live music was so loud I felt like I was burning calories listening to it. Could not have a conversation. Secondly, the waitress and management practically rushed us out of the restaurant, coming by our table every five minutes to make sure we had ordered entrees. And the food? Hm. A $135 steak was 90% fat, crab cakes were cold, and the short rib pasta just subpar. What a disappointment. Hopes were high, but ultimately a letdown.

One of my favorite venues especially for the ambiance and music! You step in and instantly transported back to the prohibition era. Live sounds of jazz, great food and cocktails. The walls are filled with bottles upon bottles of the finest whiskey scotch and bourbons. They even have a fireplace to cozy up to in the cold months. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Tommy Tardie is a great owner and always looking to keep the cocktails Unique and up to date. This is the sister location of the Flatiron room and it lives up to the hype! It's the perfect venue for a date night or just to go solo and be consumed by the music. I go as much as I can especially on a Saturday night when the Brian Newman band plays from 9-12pm. A+++

Amazing! Took my boyfriend for his birthday and everything was so great. The delicious food coupled with the ambiance was amazing. We ordered a smoking old fashioned, 2 Husband #2 cocktails (soooooo good), the salmon, steak, mashed potatoes, and chocolate cake and vanilla gelato for dessert. We will be coming back!
No comment
No comment

Came for dinner and drinks Saturday night. Beautiful outdoor seating, great ambiance with light jazz on the street playing in the background. The staff were super sweet & attentive. Amazing scallops! Definitely going back for more of those :) Very creative / fun cocktail menu to choose from too! Tommy the owner is lovely and has really put a great deal of effort into the new outdoor set up. I shall return!

Fine & Rare is an experience far above many I've had in the city. The restaurant is classy and they take the extra mile to make sure you feel welcome and special. The waiter we had was so engaging and knowledgeable. We got a charcuterie board to share and we all got different drinks that you could tell were made with high quality spirits. All of our entrees were divine, I got the mushroom ravioli special and was so pleasantly surprised by the decadence of the meal. Our waiter coerced us into getting the Fine & Rare Sphere for dessert and we were so glad he did. Very cool to see them melt the sphere in front of you! We truly had a fine and rare experience at this restaurant.
No comment

My daughter and I were trying to squeeze in as much experience on our last day in the midst of freezing rain (celebrating her 21st birthday in mid December) and our Lyft driver dropped us at this ideal spot..it was heavenly from start to finish..ambiance, the cuisine, and our amazing Lauren who treated us as royalty, educating us on the special beverage and choice of local fresh ingredients, while surprising my daughter with a lovely Smorgasbord of dessert tastes..I have sung this restaurant's praises since returning to Texas. The food was succulent, wine was superb, but especially was the treat of polite and friendly staff in a city supposedly known for its abrupt and impatient citizenry. I found this the antithesis..cannot wait to return when there is live music!

I had a great experience at this restaurant. It has a cool vibe and the staff was very friendly, especially the hostess. I rarely order chicken out, but my server recommended it so I gave it a try. It was amazing! I can't wait to go back the next time I am in town.
No comment

Really cool atmosphere! Â Jazz music is a great touch and not too loud as to ruin the quiet lively vibe of the restaurant. Service was excellent. Food - must haves include truffle fries and brussel sprouts! Â The chicken dish is nice and highly recommended. Don't plan to have a super private conversation here though. Tables are quite close in some places in the dining room. Would definitely visit again despite the tight quarters.
Fantastic Food + Live Jazz + Sophisticated Design + First-Class Service = 5 Stars

They had live music the night I went (Friday), which was nice. Had some drink there and friends had the food (I didn't try the food). Drinks are good and are the standard NYC price. Large choice of alcoholic beverages. You can also sit along the bar or they have a counter near the stage for you to have drinks and listen to music. It's a nice place to have a drink and chill out with some music.
Lets talk about great menu, impeccable service, class, live music, super friendly staff and selected clientele. I highly recommend the osso buco with lentils. AMAZING!!

No comment

Love it love it love it. Period. My go to place for Sunday brunch. Not only isn't it packed to sht like the Smith for brunch where you're sardines, this place is spacious, HAS A LIVE BAND! Jazz. And food was great. But honestly, I can't emphasize how good the service was. I must've been approached by a good half dozen customer service oriented servers who wanted to know how I was doing. Sunday brunch at Fine and Fare is an absolute must if you're not a brute. Prices were fair, food great, decor was simply gorgeous, I just love this classy place. 5-Stars + 1. Of all the brunches in the City I've been to, this place was the most....pleasant. Chris our server was amazing, so attentive to us, offering unique menu items, making recommendations. He really took pride in his job. Dasha was also very friendly. The whole staff really. Thank you guys for an amazing brunch.

If you want an upscale dine-in experience, there is no better place than fine and rare. Food portions are incredible along with the taste so definitely worth every penny you spend. I hosted my fiancÃ©'s birthday party here but the reservation alone required a pre-order of food and a deposit which can be very frustrating to deal with if guests don't show up so you lose money. However, the service is just so exceptional and the management/chef are there to give you the best time you can have. Even going back and forth via email with the manager/director was prompt and easy. They do need to accommodate guests of larger than 6/7 parties with the ability to pay individually for what they order, that would've saved me a lot of trouble and money. The 28-layer cake was custom made for my fiancÃ© and was hands down the best cake I've ever had. I truly want to thank the chef for such an art piece. Every guest who tried the cake literally wanted to take a slice home with them. My only problem with the place is the ridiculously loud music that makes it impossible to have a normal conversation. If the jazz musicians are performing, please at least turn the regular music off.

Excellent service. We went for an early Saturday evening meal. The live band and decor provide great ambience. Lovely meal. Generous portions. It came to $225 for three entrees, an appetizer salad, and three glasses of wine. NYC prices. Highly recommend for a special night out.
No comment

I spent my birthday here and it is by far one of the best in the city. Superb service, amazing food, and the jazz performances were great. They also have bourbon tasting and a Bottle Keep Member Program. A new favorite! 5 Stars!!!

The decorations, Â the services and the jazz and food are terrific. The volume is just right allowing a private conversation and the lighting is very soothing to the eyes. Â The burger is a real tasty and also a very good deal at the same time. Â The appetizers are tasty but a little small in portion. Â I love my veggie and the rare beef. Â It was a late dinner for me, Â their sizes are just right but if I was doing a real dinner, Â would definitely go for the main.

I had a great time here. The jazz set was awesome. I definitely recommend the seafood tower for an appetizer, the mussels were amazing! I ordered the seafood paella which was great aside from me having to send it back because the rice was undercooked. The only real complaint I have is the bathroom lighting being so dark and not being able to take a decent mirror selfie in that gorgeous bathroom

What a lovely find. My friends who were visiting from out of town wanted to do a jazz brunch. We were seated right away newr the stage. The live band was great. The food delicious. We ordered a bottle of white wine which was smooth and crisp. We then ordered some fries to start. Our main course included the quinoa salad bowl (YUM!!), the Brioche French Toast (also YUM!) and the skillet eggs (very good). The service was impeccable. It gets a wee bit loud but then any place with live music will be. Definitely going back and would definitely recommend. The fries were so good we ordered another and wiped our plates clean.

I really liked it the food was good from scallops to the burrata to the pay la Frieda burger .. those picks were so good i can't stop thinking about it!! Drinks were great and strong! I would def come back!! Can't wait to try the sister restaurant flat iron !! Thanks for making the night very accommodating!!!
Impeccable service by waitstaff and managers. Great ambiance, music, romantic. Food, drinks, all good! Highly recommend.

One of my favorite restaurants...came when they first opened up and they have progressed very well to the well established place that is Fine and Rare that we come to know. Â Food quality has definitely improved and the music has always been a great accompaniment to the dinners. Â Only drawback, it tends to be chilly in there, so bring an extra layer just in case. Â Will return as usual.

Awesome experience!!! Great, knowledgeable servers that ask the right questions to give you the best experience. My husband and I went to dinner for our anniversary and our server was amazing! Food was delicious and the ambiance was pretty awesome. We will definitely be back the next time we go to New York!
No comment

No comment
No comment

We were in the neighborhood and decided to walk in, originally I was afraid I was not dressed appropriately but saw 2 couples go in with shorts and T shirts and got seated. So we decided to give it a try... when we went in we were denied seats because we were too casual.... Â I can respect that policy but not when they apply it based on discrimination
The drinks can be better here, a bit disappointed. But comfortable space to chill, chatting with friends, while live music is on~

My friends and I have been here twice before for the live music and whiskey selections. It's a great atmosphere but I was thrilled to know that they have lunch during the week. Since I work in mid-town and I often need to entertain clients, this was the perfect spot for a business lunch. The setting is elegant and the service and food spot on. If you've been here for dinner than try their lunch. You won't be disappointed.
Can't stress how amazing their service is!They truly stand by their customers and try to make it an enjoyable experience. Food is reasonable but can be more flavorful. Have to go for Sunday brunch!

Awesome little gem of a place. Â Highly recommend. Â Great music and food. Â But the highlight of this gem are the bartenders and the concoctions they mix up. Â Visit this joint. Â You will not regret it.

Nice decor and pleasant staff. Â The band that night was Blue Opal and we enjoyed listening to them for a few hours. Â The food however was not up to the standards that this type of establishment should have. Â  My meal including French fries seemed undercooked.

We had a good experience here. Music was good and wait staff was polite. I hear this place is owned by the same people that own the "Flat Iron Room" I like the set up in flat iron better. My husband had his back towards the band the whole time. Other than that no complaints. the food was very good!

Great ambiance, amazing cocktails and food. Went with my brother and I pretty much tried every cocktail on the menu! All were perfectly made, flavorful but not too sweet. The live jazz was great! I think it's a great spot for after work drinks and dates. Honesty, if I lived in NYC I'd hang out here on the regular!

We went here to celebrate the completion of my best friend's presentation for work. The ambiance is very sophisticated and comfortable. We loved the live jazz. The drinks were AMAZING! We loved husband #3 in particular. I also had their chicken dish with mashed potatoes - very tasty/delicious. Service was top notch, our hostess Leti was great! we will definitely be back!!

Came here for a Saturday Jazz Brunch. We ordered the Pork Belly Cornmeal Pancakes, Eggs Constance, French Toast and Egg white, Spinach Omelet and some drinks. Overall the food, drinks and the service were all good. Taste wise not much different than other cheaper brunch places but the ambiance and the music were a plus. I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a "can't go wrong" brunch place.
I love this place ! Had my birthday dinner last Monday and it was amazing experience. Food, service and atmosphere were great.

Great ambiance and food! Â Live music, huge spirits list and a thoughtful and amazing menu. Â This is a perfect date night spot. Â I ordered the grilled baby octopus and the NY Strip. Â Both items were perfect. Â Splurge on the Sphere desert! well worth it.

Another fantastic agave class and tasting! I really enjoyed last month's tasting and thought it was worth checking it out again and I'm glad that I did. The selection this time was completely different than the last and they were very odd and exotic. Â Each of the offerings were barreled differently and the teacher, Amanda, was very knowledgeable about all of them. There was a group celebrating something that was a little loud, but the instructor kept it interesting and fun so it was fine. Definitely looking forward to being able to make it to the next one.
Fantastic place to enjoy great food and live jazz. They have a cozy atmosphere, a great wine selection, and excellent acoustics for the live music!

All in all, Fine and Rare is one of the best cocktails places in NYC. Tommy has set the bar for decor, mixology, and ambiance. He use of jazz music, he different elements of the venue whether it is floor depth, booth sizing,or the finishes, speak volumes. Don't be surprised when movies, tv shows, and al types of other happenings occur here. They hit the mark on all aspects. Add in Devin who is a mixology expert, as well as the management and staff, and it's the perfect experience. Congratulations to the team. The #devilsreef beverages are some of the best in the city. This is a new spirit that is Cinnamon Spiced Rum that has just the right amount of panache to a bundle of cocktails. Truly something not to be missed.

The food here is outstanding!!!! The choices of signature cocktails. The selection of bourbon and whiskey and wines!!!! Please get the Mac and cheese! Jazz music the ambience is so chill and warm! Please come and experience this zibe

Every single time we come here it is exceptional. Not sure if the hostess really remembers every single person or if she is just the best actress but we always feel like we are being welcomed to someone's home. Cocktails at the bar were perfect as we waited for our table. Food was cooked to perfection and the service was just the right amount of attention. We didn't feel rushed but they checked in at the right points.
Where do I start? The drinks are great and the ambiance is outstanding. I highly recommend going here for a date but make sure you have a reservation so you get a good spot!

Been here several times for drinks and food and FR never disappoints. It is indeed fine & rare. The cocktails here are very innovative and delicious. I don't think I can ever praise enough about the ambiance and decor. Every decor piece seems to have been carefully picked out and a lot of them have a rich history behind them. If you're looking for fine drinks, elegant ambiance and pleasant live music, then FR is the right spot for you!

The seafood tower in a sight to see! Highly recommend this gem! Tried the burger at wine and food festival and was dying to try the whole burger in person. Safe to say I was not disappointed! We came in a Friday night and the band was remarkable!
The service was great. Â The decor and atmosphere is ultra chic, old Hollywood chic. Â The food and drinks... wow!!! Amazing!

Really enjoyed the dinner and drinks. Menu choices okay, but not exceptional. What we ordered ( scallops and crab cakes were good, but not exceptional. Drinks were good but again not exceptional. Dasha was very attentive, at first it seemed that she was a bit pushy to move us along, but she really was there to help. Music was very good! Would go back the next time in NYC.

Great music, impeccable service, delicious food, and out of this world smoked drinks. What more can you ask for? Well firstly a steak that is not drenched in sauce. The description of the Tamahauk steak states it comes with a chimichurri sauce. Don't get me wrong, it was good, but it wasn't doing the meat justice. The steak came drenched in some sort of sauce that overpowered the flavour of the meat. The said chimichurri sauce came on the side together with blue cheese sauce. When I ordered the same steak in other steak houses it was always seasoned and dry to showcase the meat. Also, a small order of asparagus that costs $14 seems odd since it wasn't anyhting special. Everything else was top notch. The scallops, the octopus, and crab cocktail. Will I be back? Yes, but not for the steak. I think most steak enthusiasts will agree that proper steak is served to showcase the meat, and if the meat is good then only salt and pepper are needed.
Incredible atmosphere. Food was exceptional. Service a bit slow but was made up with their professionalism. Perfect kind of place for a night out or just drinks and live music.
Great ambience, music, and waiting staff is wonderful. Very friendly and knowledgeable. Food is excellent.

This place has great decor and plays live jazz music at night. Â The service was decent and the food was underwhelming. The drinks were amazing here as expected. They need to put more effort in to their food. My burger tasted like it was previously frozen and my wife's steak left much to be desired. The place has a lot of potential. Hope to revisit again.

I love Fine & Rare as a spot to get together with my girlfriends. It gets a little loud near the stage, but the ambiance more than makes up for it. The food and the cocktails are great. I highly recommend the scallops and greens and a blackberry gimlet or the Colorado.
Here doing a photoshoot for a firm/client event, feat whisky selection above average finger food, love their lobster sliders

I took my girlfriend on a Friday night for our anniversary. I would 100% come back even if for a drink. One of the coolest - and classiest places I've gone for a date night in New York. You certainly get what you pay for in terms of the food, wildly tasty and unique cocktails and awesome live music. I will be coming back here not only for date night but also for drinks with friends. If you are a whiskey lover - they have a menu with 7+ pages of whiskies.
I ate brunch here recently, and it was phenomenal! The cocktail selection is amazing! The benedict was perfectly cooked and the thick cut bacon was delicious! Can't wait to come back!
No comment

Attentive service, nice ambiance, but a mediocre, disappointing dining experience. The pork cop was fatty, tasteless. They did offer to replace my dish, but I wasn't in the mood to wait another 15-20 minutes for another dish. There was no dessert menu (weird), and was only offered after dinner drinks, which I didn't care for. Nice jazz band. Go for the music and something else that's NOT pork chops. Willing to give it another try. But this first time sucked.

We came here on the suggestion of a stranger at the airport and wow was he right! The atmosphere is amazing, and the food and drinks were superb! The Bolognese was possibly one of the best things I've ever eaten. The live jazz music was just perfect and the staff more than accommodating. We didn't even have a reservation and despite being fully booked, they still found room at a little table by a fireplace in the front waiting area. Thanks again for an amazing experience!

Overall an "okay" experience for restaurant week. For the first course, the scallop appetizers were overcooked, rubbery and small. The main course we got grilled chicken that was dry but decently flavored. What made this place special and an acceptable venue is the live jazz and ambiance but i probably wont be returning in the future for the food. I recommend this place as a date venue since the drinks were exceptional and a pretty heavy pour.

Had an amazing time the ambiance was just the perfect setting for date night. The chop was amazing! The scallops as well but the charred octopus was my favorite! Drinks were very good and presentation was A1. All in all I shall return!

This place is beautiful, intimate, romantic, perfect for that date night to impress and take you away from 2019 NYC. The restaurant, ambiance, service is spot on, not pretentious, and just makes you feel like they're happy to be there and share the experience with you. With a place that probably attracts snobbery, this place still did not. I loved it. The jazz was at the perfect balance of not too loud so you can still talk, but not too soft that you don't feel it's live. Compared to other jazz bars, the talent here is top notch. The drinks were so, so unique and good. The selection of whiskey and scotch is so extensive that just looking at the list was overwhelming; but I asked the server what he would recommend given what I like to drink and now I've discovered a new scotch to drink! We ordered a scallops and grilled octopus for apps; presentation was beautiful. For entrees, we ordered a strip steak and salmon. Portions were generous and I left so full. I'd love to come back again!
I love Fine & Rare... the best bar in midtown with live music, awesome drinks and the staff from the front to the back could not have been better. Â  Wish we had something similar in St. Louis.
Food was amazing and drinks were absolutely delicious! Perfect for a date night.. you can't get more romantic than some playing the Chello live across from your table !
Amazing food, beautiful setting, excellent service, and I enjoyed the live performance from the jazz band. Great restaurant for date night when visiting NYC. definitely will be coming back next time

Not a place for food but it's a nice little place if you want to bring friends for a not so jazzy jazz night or watch a live show of confused New Yorkers trying to impress each other. I mostly like the font and their match box. It's the nice little things.

GREAT PLACE BUT NOT FOR STEAK. Â We've been all over for steak but wanted to try a new place for a birthday. Â Lets start with the great ... the smokey drinks are absolutely delicious and will leave you craving for refills, the live jazz set the perfect mood, the waitstaff was extremely attentive, and the overall design with a large fireplace was perfect. Â Very few places are so beautiful and allow you to sit at a table right next to soothing jazz. Â The coat check was a nice option. Â The menu is very diverse so whether you're in the mood for meat, fish, or pasta, you wont leave hungry. Â There is also a great selection of whiskey, cognac and other "flights" so you get to try a drop of a handful of variations. Â If you end up buying a bottle of liquor, they offer the option of saving it for you whenever you come back. Â I truly enjoyed absolutely everything about this restaurant except for the steak because it was covered with some sort of a brown sauce. Â A $140.00 steak should not have any sort of spices, sauces or anything else on it besides perhaps a dash of salt & pepper. Â Adding anything on a steak is equally shameful as cooking it 'well done' as both options will kill it a 2nd time and you wont experience the mouth watering flavor that a good quality steak should deliver. Â Oddly enough, this is the 1st restaurant that has done such a thing and the menu description hasn't included it. Â While the menu did say that 2 sauces will come with the steak, they came on the side, so I'm not sure what the brown sauce was since it wasnt listed on the menu. Â I truly hope that such an amazing restaurant will drop the steak sauce. Â Perhaps place it on the side, but definitely not on the steak.
No comment

Wow! Â Took my parents here randomly on a Saturday night because they wanted to see live music while we were in town. Â We were so impressed! Â My father really enjoys rare whiskey and this place delivered providing him with the opportunity to enjoy a pour from a bottle from the 1950s that they purchased at auction. Â It was recommended by our expert server who was excellent. Â Everything was just phenomenal including the live music from Brian Newman. Â Look him up...he's just amazing. Â The decore is beautiful and the drinks were fabulous. Â What a great, classy, fun New York evening. Â Thanks for helping us make a wonderful memory!
Food, service, atmosphere and music was amazing !!!! When you walk it feels like you stepped into 1960's. Such an amazing place.

I have been to Fine & Rare several times, which for me, is the greatest compliment I can pay an establishment. Why? Because with the ever changing gastroscape of NYC, the options at any given moment are nothing less than daunting. The food, mixology, staff, and atmosphere here are just that amazing. The live jazz every night is an awesome theme (as with their sister establishment Flat Iron Room) as well, although on a recent visit, the music was a little less inspiring than in the past. With so many venues in the city, the din is so overwhelming that conversation is difficult at best. Coupled with loud, obnoxious music, packed bodies, and, well we've all experienced that. At F&R, all things are civilized - not pretentious, constrained, nor stiff, just enjoyable. Â An environment where fine food and spirits can be appreciated while appreciating the company of others. If you have not had one of their smoke-infused cocktails, I highly recommend starting your evening off with one. They take it to a new level by offering several wood varietals. Not into peatiness? No problem as their breath of spirits and knowledge are jaw-dropping. They have something for every palate. Their Mezcal collection was another recent surprise: I always knew about their extensive American, Scotch, and Japanese whiskey holdings - but, like 10 Mezcals? I'm stayin! The food - well, it pairs perfectly with everything else. On our last visit, we were a party of 8. We opted for a varied pre-selected menu. Everything was enjoyed: Salmon, chop, strip, *"ribbons" Â (shaved carrots, zucchini, squash with a honey-mustard vinaigrette), burrata, all excellent. As for dessert - just order the sphere. It needs to be experienced. Just go. Just enjoy.

My friend and I went to the restaurant on Restaurant Week and it was amazing, exquisite and elegant! The atmosphere was so relaxing with the dimmed lights, decor, dinner and live Jazz which comes to find out plays every single day! The way the room is setup is great for everyone to watch the band play. Â Waiter recommended drinks were amazing as well. Definitely coming back even if it's not restaurant week.
Nothing like it in the area. Love how low-key it is and how gorgeous they made the space. The staff is stellar, cocktails are amazing. 5 stars and my new low-key spot for live music and cocktails.

What am amazing place. The food was great the ambiance was amazing as well. A great little night out to celebrate my mom's bday. I would recommend the short rib and the chicken. The apple dessert and the cheesecake. Thank you to the staff and the gm who were beyond amazing and helped me celebrate my mom's birthdate.
What fun! 30s style crooners and acoustic band. Nicely planned menu and decor. The only think that would make this place better is a view. I say check it out.

Lovely bar...spectacular drinks! The hostess was fantastic and simply very customer service oriented...she checked our bags to allows us to feel more comfortable by the bar area. There was live jazz onsite and there was a chic speakeasy vibe in the space. The bartender could be a bit more inviting...especially atÂ $18Â cocktails (but maybe she was having a bad day). The craft cocktails were sensational...we only stayed for two and they were just perfect. I would definitely recommend the bar and although we didn't enjoy any food, the menu looked really appetizing.
Amazing classic vibe. Â Dasha the GM is a true class act. Â Thank u Dasha!!!! Â  Come to Fine N Rare to relive NYC's bygone most classy era. Thank u!!!!
I attended a private event here. The wine and service is superb. The live music is excellent. The location is easy from Penn and Grand Central. Impeccable. Will be back!
The appetizer cocktail is so yummy.. staff are extremely friendly . Food is good, no complaint. The jazz experiment is great ... ( I did not like the Gin cocktail thoughï¼

Recommended by a friend I invited a few more and had a great night of live music and some of the best smoked Scotch and Mezcal. We started with a tower of fresh seafood, the oysters, shrimp and lobsters were amazing. We moved on to some great Benzino dishes and NY Strip medium rare made to perfection. We finished the evening with some of their best after dinner Scotch. I was definitely pleased by the service and vast selection of dishes, wine and spi
We had a wonderful time here last weekend. The food was amazing and so was the live music. Recommend for a special evening.
No comment
No comment

Didn't get to try anything as we arrived to the bar around 11:30 on a weeknight and since no one was around we looked to find a bartender who then informed us they are closed. I was surprised- I said don't you close at 2 am? He said well yes we are supposed to but it depends, we close whenever we feel like it. Welp there goes that. bye!

Went for a four course dinner w/ jazz by Brian Newman. Surpassed expectations--cool spot. I'm not a jazz super fan-just like good music-loved Brian and his band. Excellent! Food was good, nice variety. Amazing cocktails, and great service.
No comment
We found this place by accident. Great selection of 400+ whiskeys and custom cocktails. Vibe is laid back and cool. A must visit for anyone who enjoys a spectacular cocktail alongside some cool jazz.

Last minute reservations for a Saturday night proved to be a winner. Got a table in front of the stage (the wife got to watch the show and I was only able to hear it). It was loud at the table, but I expect that when sitting 4 feet from a band! Â Food was good. We left full. The Smoking Old Fashioned was a hit. I recommend the scotch with Maple smoke.

Very nice place, great atmosphere and music. Service is also very attentive and quick. I would recommend this if you are going for a romantic date . The only wish is for them to have few more sharing options. Came with a party of 3 and while we did enjoy the meal options were limited.

Very cool place! We had a great night! The food and entertainment were outstanding! "Brian Newman's Residency" was unbelievable! All of the musicians are extremely talented! The only negative was that after the first set, the band took a break, and then we felt like we were being rushed out and pressured to order more food or drinks - Even though we had 2 rounds of drinks, full course meal, and dessert. We ended up giving up our table front and center, and moved to the back stools on the second level. All in all, we will definitely go back on our next trip to NYC!
No comment

This was a great find, came here for Sunday Jazz Brunch, food was great , cocktails were fabulous and then the jazz trio started...really gave it a cool vibe, would highly recommend and will definitely be added to my "must return" list when in NY.
Love this spot and found it through opentable. I keep going back over and over. The food is great and the atmosphere is perfect for a meeting. Not loud for lunch!
