This place was really charming ... the chops were delicious as was my bolognese pasta. We heard a great band that we enjoyed a lot . It was a Thursday night and place was not completely full which surprised me. I think it's lacking a vibe while you wait in between music sets ... I would say playing some upbeat music in between would do it . Lovely place with good service and good live music ! Miami 2018
No comment
Delicious food, fabulous cocktails and a very funky atmosphere combined with lovely jazz performances makes Fine & Rare one of my new favorite spots for dinner.

Very cool dinner spot for some amazing selection of whisky. Love jazz bar with talented musicians. The food was amazing and the dessert was delicious!!! Must go if you are looking for some fine dining with live music. Cocktail menu had great variety. Would come here again when in NYC.
No comment
Always the best. Food and drinks are amazing. Worth the price. Service is excellent. The music is always on point. We try and visit once an month.
No comment
No comment

Had dinner here with friends who are "out-of-towners". The food was very good, the space is beautiful. We were there for the early show which wasn't an overly stimulating performance, however it was just after New Years so a tough time for entertainment. The food and service could not have been better. Just keep in mind this is a cocktail/Scotch (bottles are displayed suspended above the venue; very cool wait staff climb ladders to get bottles) place wine is an afterthought with not a great selection. Fun place to go. I'll try the Flatiron Room next.

The reviews are right! This place was awesome. Went for an early dinner with my family. They made a pasta with red sauce for my vegetarian son even though it wasn't on the menu. Cocktails were amazing. Food was excellent. Service was impeccable. They even had five pages of single malt scotch, so I doubt anyone would be disappointed by the drink selection.
Very impressive! Excellent service, food, and jazz. The staff are incredibly welcoming and accommodating. Will return soon!
The food was incredibly bad, nothing at all what we expected! The ambiance is great and the drinks are very good, so if you want to go there just stay at the bar and go have dinner somewhere else.

What a great find!! Fine and Rare is exactly that the food is wonderful, the service is excellent and the ambiance is perfect. I had a great meal listening to world class jazz talent! Thanks again Fine and Rare!!

I would say my experience here was just okay. Given the friendly service and luxe ambiance, I wanted to love it here. To me, though, food is still the most important feature of a restaurant and it missed the mark for me. My nearly $30 bowl of vegetarian gnocchi was chewy and therefore difficult to eat. Couldn't finish the dish, but luckily there was some bread served alongside dinner that was accompanied by a delicious butter spread. That aside, the drinks were unique and the music was a nice touch.

Great evening with my girlfriend and another couple. The music is excellent and the smoke Old Fashioned are something special. I would give the food 4/4.5 stars but the rest of the experience puts it over the top.

I'm glad this business has remained open during Covid. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They helped me find a scotch I really enjoyed that I would not have otherwise ever planned to try. I would give the staff 5 stars. The atmosphere with the live music on a Saturday night in the middle of Covid was amazing... made you forget there is a pandemic going on. It was on the louder side so having a conversation with all 4 of us was difficult but it was nice to have live music. The reason I only give this place 3 stars is because the food was not very good. I went with 4 people and all of us were disappointed in our dishes. The steak I got had good seasoning but it was very tough. When I spend $40 plus on a steak I don't want to have to chew each bite 15 times or have to saw through it with the knife. My girlfriend has an allergy and we asked for the carrots to be served on a separate plate they put them on the same plate as the steak. The food was also on the saltier side, which made some of the meal difficult to eat. The drink selection and staff saved the night but I probably wouldn't order food here again.
No comment

This is a really awesome spot. Â The atmosphere is very low key and sexy. Â The live music is nice and adds to the vibe but isn't overwhelming. Â Devin, the head of the cocktail program, is great, knowledgeable, professional, and helpful. Â I think this place is a hidden gem that is in progress and I'd rather keep it hidden (because I hate crowds); however, I believe people should be aware of a good place.

Great place to hang out. I love the live jazz music and raw bar. Wonderful service. The servers are very attentive and always cleared used plates and cutlery quick. I definitely recommend the oysters and other items from the raw bar. They were very fresh. I had gotten the paella. It was filled with seafood and well seasoned, but the rice was a bit watery. I would recommend a different entree since there are better places for paella. I got the Fine and Rare Sphere. If you love desserts on the sweeter side, I would recommend it. The dessert was great and very good in the beginning, but it was a bit too sweet halfway through. I would have preferred the sphere to be made of dark chocolate and the liquid chocolate to the dark chocolate as well. This is my personal preference. It is a great take on a classic American dessert nonetheless.
No comment

Not sure how this place has gotten such great reviews. My husband and I had dinner last night and while the jazz music was good, the food was sub par and the prices exorbitant. Don't waste your time on this place.
Thanks to Dacha and Evelina and Tom and Greg our group had a wonderful evening. Loved the food and music. Thank you!

My girlfriend and I were in NYC for her birthday trip and I found this place while looking through Yelp for dinner ideas. I picked it because it seemed like a unique decor with live jazz and interesting cocktails. We were not disappointed! The decor feels very old-fashioned and has a very classy atmosphere. It was great having the live music while we ate and drank. We both ordered cocktails and enjoyed them both! The food was great as well, we both got the NY strip (which you could probably get away with just splitting) but it is very good! We also got a side of the Mac N' cheese which was definitely one of the highlights of our meal. Our server, Greg, provided excellent service. We would definitely come back to this place.
Amazing cocktails and incredible live jazz. Definitely a hidden gem and perfect for a date night.

I took a friend here for her birthday. I'd been before with a large group and quite liked the drinks. The live music is great and the songstress belted our some heartfelt tunes. My back was to the stage but my friend enjoyed it. We opted not to drink and just had dinner. I got the bolognese and she tried the fish (I think it was bass?). She liked it but didn't love it. I didn't try it as it was sitting on a bed of veggies which included bloody onions. My dish was fine. The pasta was a good consistency but the sauce left a lot to be desired. I actually put hot sauce in it to give it some flavour and that is blasphemy. Sigh. I really wanted to like it. We then had the creme brÃ»lÃ©e which was the winner of the night. There were flecks of vanilla bean which leant it some complexity and bits of fruit on top. All in all I'd rate the dessert a 6/10 and the food 3.5/10 so average-ish. One nice touch is I mentioned to the waiter when I ordered the creme brÃ»lÃ©e that it was my friends birthday and he brought out extra desert offerings with a candle. We really appreciated it (too bad the taste wasn't there). The two dishes and one dessert came out to 100 after tip. So meh. At least there's live music?
This is one of my favorite places in NYC! The decoration is incredible! There's a lot of history there. The food and cocktails are amazing!!!

This place was very full at 7:30pm on a Saturday. There would have been no room if we wanted a table for dinner without a reservation. We got seats at the bar, which gave us a nice view of the stage. There were two different jazz bands that came on that evening. Besides my friend and me, there was an older couple who seemed like regulars sitting at the bar, a young man having a drink alone, and a group of friends standing around and chatting. The tables seemed to be mostly filled with couples. The music was nice, and was quiet enough that people could still have conversations. They had a great selection of whiskeys, and the bartender had a lot of information about each of them. It looked like someone would climb up on a ladder when people ordered less-common drinks that weren't kept in the main bar area. I was served my 1792 Sweet Wheat Bourbon from the flask, and given a glass with water, a glass with ice, and an eyedropper to add water more carefully. My friend got a Penicillin (the cocktail, not the antibiotic), and it was very complex.
So glad I found this gem! The ambiance is excellent, the jazz is great and yet not better than the NY steak! Just delicious! A great place for a night out on the city that never sleeps
This is great for fancy date night and dinner with a corporate card. The jazz was fab and easy listening, whisky list was of course extensive but pricey! A refined place for the more mature crowd.
No comment
No comment
Cool place, jazz atmosphere is great! Â Service was top notch. Â Love the bourbon options and we didn't feel rushed by the staff even though we lingered long after dinner was finished.

BIG FAN of this new bar / jazz club. Â If you've ever been to the Flatiron Room, it's very similar vibe, but a slightly bigger space I believe. Â I met two colleagues here for drinks here after work and we really enjoyed the live music - it was similar to Nora Jones. Â The drinks are pretty Â  pricey, so sip slowly or go on an expense account!

Modern classy establishment with great bar and table service. Jazz is a staple. We went here for Valentine's Day 2018. We enjoyed the ambiance, cocktail and wine service at the bar and food. It is a bit pricey as expected for a restaurant that coins themselves "Fine and Rare".

Ambiance and music was lovely. Great view of the jazz band and very nice decor. The bartender was great at explaining the different whiskeys in my flight and was very nice. Mixed drinks were weak. At the dinner table, the waiter forgot our appetizer, never answered our questions we had about an entree, and took forever to bring us the check. Food was mediocre. Paella had undercooked rice and was dry, pesto gnocchi was not very good either. The manager took 20% off the check but we felt that we were put up with and had to coax that out of him. Would not come back.

Great atmosphere and decor. The live jazz was so nice however I wish my husband could see the stage as his back was towards the stage. Not sure why they sat us there because there were better seats for both of us. The food was okay.
Place is great, love bringing people here to enjoy the live jazz. They play all the classics, the drinks are quality, and the food is great. Love it.

Went for a special birthday. Food was excellent , service was amazing. Chris made the night extra special. Chris's recommendation of the pork was spot on, pasta with Bolognese was delicious, Salmon was perfection. To top all of this off, there was amazing live jazz in such a cool old New York venue. Just go!
This place was beautiful. Servies was excellent also manager was very nice (-; highly recommand for dinner or drinks.
Had Christmas brunch here! GM Dasha is wonderful and took care of everybody in my party. I've been here several times and it has always excited my expectation.
Wonderful atmosphere. Great service and the music was terrific! Â I highly recommend this special spot.
Undeniably pricey, this place is worth the price tag with a great atmosphere, cool decor and sensational cocktails.

Beautiful interior with matched small jazz combos make this restaurant a hidden gem. The service was great and the food delicious. Recommend setting a Saturday reservation for about 8:00 so you can catch the tail end of one band and the performance of a second one.
I celebrated my birthday here and the staff made sure my party was accommodated well. The cocktails were excellent, will definitely come back again.

Terrible service . The seats at the bar in the main space are about as uncomfortable as it gets. Waiters more interested in getting your credit card info than providing service. The hosts were dazed and confused. The food is mediocre. Fifteen minutes to get one drink.

Go for the single malts. They have a huge selection and offer flights of some very special scotch whisky. Enjoy the appetizers, skip the mains. Stay for the music and the space, it's comfortable and live jazz is always a treat. Don't sit at one of the raised tables. Too confining. Ask for a table near the fireplace.

I went here for my birthday brunch with some friends for the Sunday jazz brunch, and it was a very nice venue. There was live music playing while we sat at a table in front of the fireplace which helped since it was pretty chilly outside! My group wasn't feeling very adventurous with the drinks, so we didn't end up trying any of the cocktails, and mainly ordered separate dishes for ourselves. It does take a SUPER long time for the food to come out, so I'd recommend getting cocktails to help pass the time, or come with the expectation that you'll be waiting at least 30-45 minutes for your food to come out. To their defense, I think they were trying to get all of the dishes out at the same time...but the flatbreads for example does not take that long to prepare in my opinion! Overall, still a great place to dine.
No comment
No comment
World class whisky and bourbon bar. Â A bit pricey but great late nigh after dinner joint.
What a wonderful experience with an amazing jazz group!! Wait staff was excellent and food was pretty good. Loved the interiors with clever art deco vibe. Â Highly recommend it!

We came for a date night - this spot is absolutely perfect for that, or perfect for an intimate work dinner. The staff and atmosphere was amazing. The staff was incredibly friendly and once the music started getting going around 9, it was a great time. The drinks, as you can expect, are not cheap but are well made. The bartenders are knowledgeable and all of the ingredients are fresh. I was a bit disappointed by the food. We shared the salmon - which was a tad dry and lacked flavor, and the steak-which was a bit fatty. We also had the Brussels sprouts - very good, and the French fries (to die for). Overall a great experience, just wish those main entrees blew our socks off the way the atmosphere did.

We came here for Brunch on a summer Sunday. The atmosphere is pretty awesome...there was a jazz band playing--a cello, singer, and piano that really made the experience. We ordered a few different dishes. My fiance and I got the baked eggs and our cousins got the steak and eggs and the french toast. The clear winner was the french toast--it just smelled so good, but around the table, most of the dishes were quite liked. There was a minor snag with my dish--the eggs were a bit overdone when they came to the table so the chef re-fired the order, which was nice and appreciated. In the meanwhile, they brought a round of sample bloody mary's and comped us a dessert since the second dish took so long to remake (it's a baked dish, so I understand). Over all, service was excellent--Lauren our server understood the issue and was quick to fix. I would definitely come back here as the cocktails at the table were a hit (mimosa and highlander) and again, the music and the ambiance were stellar.

Service was amazing. Â Servers were very attentive and helpful with recommendations not only for food, but for drinks. Â Their cocktails were all amazing though my favorite of the night was their burbon old fashioned with smoked cherry wood. Â The food was also impeccable with all of it coming out in good time and the tomahawk steak was done perfectly. Â I highly recommend the truffle fries. Â Great for a date night as the jazz provided great ambiance.
Everything from the cocktails to the food are amazing!!! Â The atmosphere and live music make it a great night!!!!

I came here for NYE dinner. I love that they do coat check! The atmosphere is great! The decor is beautiful. There was a Post Modern Jukebox-esque band playing that was very good. Everything about this place was above average except the food. The food wasn't bad, however, I have had better food for a much cheaper price.
Great place in Midtown for a late night bite, a tasty craft cocktail, and good chill music.
No comment

The server was very engaging and very nice. Went there for a birthday lunch. Was very quiet and has a nice ambiance. This place is legit what the names says "fine & rare" they have these interesting art pieces placed around the restaurant. Food was a perfect portion for myself and it was delish!

On our last night Â 3/24 in New York we ran across Fine and Rare. Â  What a find!!! This is New York at its finest. Â Great music, outstanding food and amazing drinks. Â If only that was all that mattered but the over the top service and bartender were the best. Â Thank you for making out trip end on a high note.

This place was exactly as expected. Great value for a high end steak/seafood restaurant. The branzino fish was just okay, the duck was exquisite. The ambience was excellent and romantic. it is a bit too loud to talk comfortably. also very close to other tables, can hear noth conversations. The live jazz musicians were perfect. The old fashioned drink was to die for. the bartender poured a horrible guiness. i gave 4 because was not however would give a 4.8

SURPRISE! We ended up here, not knowing what they were, after another place had a one hour wait. That was one of the better surprises in a long time. Spotlessly clean, soft lighting, friendly greeting. Live Music, No Cover Charge. Real Sweet-Voiced Singers. Four excellent dinners: steak, tofu, chicken, paella. Nice wine selection, plus mixed drinks. We cannot wait for our next visit. Easily accessible from the Q.

Time Out New York published a glowing review of the cocktails, decor, and other refinements at this place shortly after they opened, and I happened to read it yesterday while plotting a visit to an art gallery in the vicinity. My partner and I stopped in last night (a Saturday around 8pm) and really enjoyed ourselves. It's a large, upscale space with a very unique setup, including an ample stage for their wonderful jazz bands and singers. Coat check is complimentary and the hostess who greeted us seemed lovely. I ordered the Smoking Rum Old Fashioned with mesquite smoke (their signature cocktail and an olfactory marvel) and the Tim Tucker for my partner and I to share...somewhat unevenly because it was delicious and he is nice. Our server was extremely cool, too. I look forward to visiting again once the full menu is available, if not sooner.

At Fine & Rare last night to celebrate my husband's birthday. Â It was a perfect night from start to finish. Â We started with a Whiskey and Cheese pairing in their tasting room. Â Jordan, the tastemaster, did a fantastic job. After that we had a great dinner - shared the Octopus app. and had Pappardelle Bolognese & Faroe Island Salmon for main courses. Â All were excellent. Â The live jazz was outstanding - Brian Newman's Quintet. This was a perfect evening that I highly recommend. Â Finally, what made the night really special was Dasha, the GM. Â She made sure our night was perfect every step of the way. Â She knows what good service is and how to deliver it. Â Thanks Dasha for making the night even more special.
No comment

Great venue, love the decor. Watermelon pomegranate arugula burrata salad appetizer was delicious, but the nocoise salad was flavorless. Steak was overcooked and fries were hard to eat (not fried crispy, but not in any means soft either). In summary, food was subpar. As far as service, thirty minutes to get water, an hour to get one appetizer, another hour for entree and an extra 30 minutes to get an added side of fries. Either the kitchen needs to get its shit together, or the restaurant needs more staff on the floor because my waiter had major bags under his eyes and looked like he hadn't slept in days. I had high hopes for this place but not even the live jazz performance can save this place.

I was lucky enough to be a guest here and was amazed by the walls of whiskey from wall to wall from floor to ceiling. I don't know how expensive the drinks are but as I said I was fortunate to be a guest and its probably the most extensive whiskey bar I've ever been in. The food was good as well, its a really fun place that just amazes.

they have live jazz every evening! Â Fine & Rare is a cozy spot, with great drinks, fresh ingredients & friendly staff. the only drawback, for me, is its price tag. Â go before everyone discovers this place!
Wonderful time! Food, drinks and atmosphere was great! Jazz playing through dinner and the mescal Manhattan was terrific! Gotta try....

Came to celebrate our anniversary. LOVELY. Mid century vibe, in both the menu and the live music and decor. The food was amazing and the service was attentive. A GEM of relaxation and quality in the middle of a busy city. We will be returning the next time I'm in NYC.
I love this restaurant! It's perfect for a date night. Talented jazz band, delicious food, and great drinks! Get the lamb chops if they're on special when you're there!!
Atmosphere great, musicians wonderful but the food was flavorless and overpriced.

Went here with a large group for dinner. Food was delicious. Scallops and carpaccio were very good. Chicken was fantastic. Steak was very tender and delicious. The desserts were great too.. my favorite was the sphere dessert- delicious! The restaurant has a cool vibe and the jazz singers made it a really nice experience.

Just went to jazz brunch here and it was so delicious. I had the salmon Benedict possibly the best I have ever had, with perfectly poached eggs, melt in your mouth lox, a hint of dill and a delicate hollandaise sauce over crispy potato pancakes. My son enjoyed the pancakes and we finished it off with a warm lava cake whose molten center would make Master Chef proud. All this while seated in a beautiful banquette, watching a talented jazz trio on stage, and surrounded by a warm and inviting decor that looks like a restored jazz club from a bygone era. Even if this place did not have music the prices would still be a steal for a fancy proper brunch.

We had a delightful time while visiting NYC. Â Our server Fahed was absolutely the best. He described the menu to us in detail and answered every single one of our questions. We had the best service. The truffle fries were phenomenal. The music was beautiful. The entire experience was exactly what we needed. Thanks Fahed!
Great service, great scene, great Booze and wonderful tuna poke! All around great! Came for my boyfriends birthday! Highly recommend
I really love this place. Kinda hiding place. Amazing food and the drink "eaten of garden" is yummy. We like jazz and trying go there and relax my evening. Definitely recommend.
Rose and the cheese platter hit the spot. Devin was amazing company... def a great place to stop into if you're in the neighborhood... and if you LOVE whiskey!!
Just had a lovely birthday dinner here. Everything was absolutely perfect from start to finish! It truly made my day! Can wait to come back!
Wonderful ambience, entertaining live jazz music, great food, extensive selection of scotch and even better service. Dasha, the manager, helped make our 5 year anniversary very memorable!

We came in here for drinks on a Monday night. The bartender who served us was very good. The drinks we ordered were absolutely delicious. The vibe and ambience is great for a nice drink or a romantic date night. It's also a wonderful place for whiskey lovers! There's also live jazz playing which added so much to our experience. Will definitely be back here!

This is my second time at this restaurant and I went back because the food was amazing, the atmosphere reminds me of the 50s, very classic, live jazz, great place to have scotch and listen to live music. Presentation of food was impressive. I would not suggest this place for steak specifically, I thought steak was ok because I have been to many steakhouses and top of my list would be River Palm in NJ, Peter Luger, and Del Frisco's to name a few BUT they do have amazing appetizers which were delicious. I would definitely go back.

Had a long overdue reunion with some grad school friends. Â Food, drinks and service were decent, but we were seated right next to the stage at the base of the short set of steps used by the performers to get on and off the stage even though the restaurant was not full. Â There were plenty of other empty tables available the entire night. Â We had to get up out of our seats and move our chairs and ourselves out of the way each time the performers had to get on or off, take intermission, or move their instruments on or off the stage. Â This happened at least 6 times between the two bands performing. We weren't there long enough for the 2nd band's intermission; otherwise, we would've had to move at least 3-4 more times factoring in the intermission and the end of the 2nd set. Â To add insult to injury, two of us were pushed back into the alcove such that we could not see the stage or performers at all. Â Putting a table, chairs and diners right in front of the steps while the stage is in use is clearly a NYC Fire Code violation and ruined what was supposed to be a nice night with friends who hadn't seen each other in a few years. Â For the amount of money we spent, we could've had a much more enjoyable, uninterrupted time at any of the other upscale restaurants in the city.
No comment

Cool new spot. Very nice interior and very cozy atmosphere. Talented and great live music performers everyday. Big alcohol selection and you can even buy your own bottle of liquor and come drink it any time you want. Can't wait when they will open full dinner menu.
No comment

This is a great spot for a decadent night listening to some great performers. The food is just okay, nothing mind blowing, but the atmosphere really makes up for it. I'd definitely go back for the pleasure of live music in a beautiful space. Check it out!

Had a meeting on 5th Ave. and needed a quick lunch prior to. Stopped in to Fine & Rare knowing nothing about the restaurant. The food was excellent. It was a quiet Monday so I had a lot of attention from the staff. I'll definitely return one evening for more good food and live jazz. This obe's a keeper.
Impeccable service, food & dessert, great ambiance and the music was phenomenal. Wonderful experience. I cannot wait to go back.
Fantastic food and service! From The live jazz music, to the decor and the whole vibe in here is great. The drinks are so delicious! Me and my friends will definitely be back!

Excellent spot for drinks, and a great jazz vibe to go along with your smokey whisky concoction. Thoroughly trained & attentive staff. The food choices on the menu were good, though there's not an extensive food menu to begin with.

Visited the city for daughters birthday. She located Fine & Rare and we went there for brunch Â  What a fabulous time. The food was fantastic and the music was wonderful. Highly suggest going!! Â We will return once we return to the city!!
Great ambiance, music was great, food was great, cocktails too notch! Cooper was an amazing attentive server! Really loved the whole overall experience from entering to exiting! Highly recommend.

Not really for dinner. To big and your easily forgotten. It kind of misses on any style they were going for. Yeah you get the friends of the owners giving good reviews but it there few to begin with you have a un popular resturaunt who's owner doesn't have many friends = Not to friendly. Michael,

Service was TERRIBLE !!! Food was ok, awesome drink list. Music was amazing and Â he only reason this place has customers is my guess the live music. Shameful to charge this much for food and rush hour paying guests out. We had apps dinner, a bottle of wine, dessert and We had to tell our waiter to leave us alone while we finished our after dinner drinks. Stop harassing your paying customers and focus on your service and quality of food.

We had a wonderful experience at the Fine and Rare jazz brunch on Sunday! Â The service was perfect. Our server did not rush us and was so pleasant and friendly as we celebrated a birthday. The music was fantastic and just the right volume to enjoy but still converse. We sat in a spacious booth and the atmosphere was elegant but comfortable which is rare indeed. I would highly recommend this place and look forward to coming back again soon!
Fantastic experience. The team are so welcoming and warm and the jazz band was next level. Had such a great night, thank you! Will define be back.
Beautiful brunch. Food was beautiful. Staff attentive and friendly. Soft French Jazz made for a unforgettable morning.
The ambiance was perfect, the jazz was perfect, the whiskey selection was perfect, and the overall experience was perfect. It was far exceeded my expectations.

Cute little jazz spot right in Midtown. We went before the happy hour rush came in on so it was quiet when we first got there. Nice live jazz and great cocktails. I do wish the stage was a tad bigger.
No comment
No comment

I loved this place! The Jazz was a wonderful accompaniment to our dinner and conversation. Cocktails were amazing! Â The manager Natasha treated us like special guests all evening. Â I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys great food and drink with some live music. Â Also, loved the atmosphere.

Ambiance is great and jazz band is lively. However, the food was greasy and subpar to say the least. The brussel sprouts were swimming in oil and undercooked, and the burger was wet with grease and overcooked. Way overpriced for what you're getting.

My girl friends and I celebrate our birthday every January, and I picked this restaurant because it served Restaurant Week menu. We got to sit at one of best table in the restaurant because we mentioned to the hostess Izzy that we're celebrating our birthdays. We enjoyed the live entertainment with very attentive waiter Fahed. The restaurant manager Mark came by the table several times to make sure we're enjoying the food and service. I mentioned my pork chop was a little over cooked. He immediately requested a new plate for me. Then he surprised us with desserts and champagne for our birthday! Great great service and food all the way! Can't wait to bring more friends s and clients to the restaurant again!!
We were seated at 11:00 and the kitchen stayed open for us. Â Great atmosphere, good food and music!
Over rated and over priced. Service is terrible. Bartenders are slow as molasses and rude. Prices are out of control for a mediocre bar. Â Never again.

Wonderful place for a date night or entertaining guests. Extensive fine drink selection and delicious cocktails. Food was very tasty (loved the vegetable tagine!) and the atmosphere was wonderful. Got to see two different live jazz performances during our meal. They were both spectacular! A unique experience and my boyfriend and I had such a great time!

A place with live music and good cocktails is rare in NYC these days. Â  Got there around 5:30 and they already had performers on the stage. The cocktails here are quite good. They don't come cheap but cocktails are made very well. We had the Ginger Brenner House, Highlander, a flight of Scotch Explorer, and the Smokey Old Fashioned. As for food, I would skip it. The pork chop we ordered was on the tough side but acceptable. However the sides, truffle fries and French lentils were subpar. We told the staff about the non truffle tasting truffle fries and they took it back to the kitchen. When they brought it back, I thought there would be some hint of truffle taste. There was NONE. So we didn't eat any fries. Onto the French lentils. One word. BLAND. We asked for the manager and brought this up with her. She apologized and made things right. Â I would prob stick with cocktails and music but nevertheless service was great and they did what they had to in order to smooth things over. I would def come back for the music and the cocktails. The two different groups playing were quite good. The first group was better but the second wasn't bad either. The cocktails were done right. Our Scotch flight was presented well. They brought six glasses and then a caddy with all the Scotch to be poured. The guy pouring was pretty knowledgeable and we had a good flight! They also have other flights like tequila, rum,etc.

My family and I came in for Father's Day brunch and I must say the service here is outstanding! Since the moment we walked in we were warmly greeted by the host Letty. The manager Masha personally walked us to our table and made sure we were comfortable and had a clear view of the stage. She constantly came over to make sure we had our food and drinks and that we were happy with our service she is a lovely person and very funny and sweet. She really cares about her job and most importantly the customers. Our server Greg came over to take our orders and when we couldn't decide on drinks or our meal he was very helpful and knowledgeable such a great guy and very funny aswell! Amanda the bar manager personally brought out my drink and let me tell you the drink was spectacular and made exactly how I asked. The food and drinks were all amazing and the dessert was even better!!! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and family!

I loved the experience. Music was wonderful. When the band took breaks, the ambience music was a little too loud and a completely different genre which threw off the vibe. The food was excellent, scallops and salmon. The service was very attentive, but felt overly rushed. The main dish was served right when the appetizer plates were picked up. We wanted to enjoy the music but felt very rushed by all the staff. I would recommend spacing the dishes out more and not have staff hovering over the table..

2.5 stars. Food was sub par. For appetizers my boyfriend had the tomato salad which had waaay too much balsamic vinegar and I had the arugula salad which was ok. For our main course he had the paella which he said was ok, not great, and I had the Greek grain bowl which was 80% quinoa and had hardly any beans. They also ran out of tofu when I was there. So basically we paid $20 for a huge bowl of quinoa. The ambience is very weird. When the jazz band wasn't playing, they had songs that sounded like techno/electronic music blasting. Totally confusing. Would come back for the whiskey classes, but the prices are too high for the average food.

We fit this visit in between matinee Hamilton and Billy Joel at MSG. Â Wish we had more time, because we certainly would stayed longer. Â Loved it. Awesome cocktails... smoked rye old fashioned was fabulous. Had we stayed longer I wild definitely had another. Â Music was wonderful. Â We sat by the fireplace and it was not too loud so you could still carry conversation easily. Just right. Â Food was outstanding, much better than I was expecting as we first planned this as a cocktail/music stop. We shared scallop appetizer and I had Duo of Duck. Â Excellent! Â We'll be back!
Music was great! But my drink was awful and food was cold sent back twice and still came back cold definitely won't be coming back

We came here for brunch on Xmas eve. They had a live band which was a nice touch. However, the food was less than appealing. The bread that they served was almost stale, I couldn't even chew it. My lobster roll was covered in mayo, a little sour and was probably only 2 tablespoons worth. My husband's baked eggs sounded amazing on the menu but was also disappointing when it was served - it was over cooked. Expensive and a waste of money.

This place is awesome. Â The only thing holding is back is the service. Â Unrefined, unenthusiastic, and just a little sloppy. Â Food was excellent and the setting just phenomenal. Â If they could give your staff a little "refinement"'to match everything else, you'll have a real winner.

Amazing place to take clients and impress the best of friends. Great place to get the deal done and celebrate birthdays. My favorite part? The amazing selection of rare drink. Â Whiskey, tequila, and rum; all amazing stuff
Nice decor. Went on a weekday after work. Â Great scene with nice music. Drinks are a amazing.

This is good place to go for transection of food and music but realize a bit of compromise on each. Â There is no cover however the food and drink prices reflect this, but overall a reasonable value. Â We were politely accommodated with a table near the music. Â This is a small intimate venue and perfect for a romantic date night. Â I would not necessarily recommend for multiple couples. Â  We arrived 8 30 and saw both bands. Â The later band was definitely more professional so we would tend to come back for drinks and snacks rather than full dinner. Â Would certainly recommend the meat dishes over the others. Â We thought the wine pours a bit small so would suggest a bottle. Â The service was attentive and certainly they made you feel welcome to leisurely listen to the music. We will be back.

This place has a wonderfully 1950s atmosphere complete with ambient lighting and modern flair. The music is great. We tried their rib eye steak which was quite accompanied by some satisfying sides. The real star though were the expert drinks. Highly recommend the Smokey old fashioned.

We went to this restaurant on the advice of the hotel concierge. Â We went for Sunday jazz brunch, and were not disappointed. Â I loved the old New York feel of the place, and the warm fire was welcome on a bitterly cold day. Â Service was attentive, but not overbearing. Â The cocktail menu was expansive and interesting. Â I had a classic Bloody Mary, which could have been a tad spicier. Â The brunch menu is diverse, with items ranging from classic breakfast items to interesting sandwiches and salads, to seafood towers. Â I had the Laphroaig cured smoked salmon Eggs Benedict, which consisted of two perfectly poached eggs over a small slice of salmon on potato-leek pancakes. Â The Hollandaise was yummy, but I had a little difficulty finding the salmon. Â It came with a fresh arugula salad as a side. Â My companion had the Seafood Cobb salad, which was topped with a egenerous portion of crab, lobster, and shrimp along with usual bacon, blue cheese, and avocado. 2 deviled eggs were the accompaniment. Â The jazz trio was lovely and added to the ambiance. We will definitely plan a return visit when we're back in NYC.

Looked too stuffy at first but is quite chill inside. Â Small party having the rum and whiskey flight and good conversation. Great date place. Â Good mix of people. Live music was soothing. Â Service was impeccable. Would come again.

Amazing cocktails with a great ambiance and live music. Â Staff was very attentive- greeted at the door and found seats for us at the bar. Not crowded which was surprising bc the whole set up (fire place, decor, jazz) is kind of perfect. Drinks are a tad bit expensive.
This place probably has my favorite food! The flatbreads are amazing, the owner is super nice and I will defiantly be back!
Wow. Super evening this place just sticks out as so different. Drinks were awesome.Food was unique and tasty.. Entertainment made the evening special. We will be back for sure

Great food, drinks, staff and overall vibe! My favorite drink was the smoked old fashioned. Although there are only small plates available, they are very filling and delicious. I'll definitely be back!

Let's just say that finding this gem was the highlight of my NYC trip... not only was the atmosphere classy, the service and food was exceptional. Im not one to do things twice in NYC but I'll definitely be returning to fine and rare. Thank you for a memorable jazz experience

Mediocre. This place is charming and inviting but the price tag for a cocktail is a little too high when you're positioned in midtown east where everyone is looking for a happy hour special regardless of their age. I'd give it another try but overall not blown away. Service was pushy and rushed; was being asked if I wanted another drink when I was two sips in...clearly a slow night.

What a terrific experience at Fine and Rare! It's clear the proprietors have put a lot of thought and care into this establishment, with quality details from decor to music, cocktails, spirits, and a satisfying food menu. Tasty drinks and small plates, and superb service. Our server Ben took excellent care of us. Perfect for date night or a relaxed evening with friends.
Good food! Nice vibes! Good service! One of my favorite izakaya spots in nyc! Super fun
No comment
Nice service, good environment. Although lunch time does not offer Yakutori, still looks pretty good.

Came here for a friend's bday and luckily we didn't have to wait long for a table for 6. I loved the casual but intimate vibe of the restaurant and was amazed by the kindness of the staff. We ordered calamari, fries and karaage for the table, which were all pretty good! I ordered the pork Katsu curry and a shishito pepper skewer. The pork was a little dry and the curry needed a little more flavor but I still enjoyed my dish! And the skewer was well seasoned and pretty good. We brought a cake for my friend and the staff was kind to give us a candle and bring the cake out for us. Would definitely come back to try the cotton candy sukiyaki! Overall a great experience and would recommend this spot if you're in the area.

Very solid option for izakaya fare including sukiyaki and nabe pots along with donburi bowls and skewers. The prices are quite reasonable, the portions solid, and the seating actually pretty spacious for the location. They also have a decent happy hour. Worth a stop.

Place was pretty decent. Came here on a Friday night at 8 for a party of 3. Wait time was only 10 mins. Food came out super fast and looked great on first impression. Ambiance was quaint and warm with a lot of couples eating together. Would recommend.

You NEED to get the skewers. BY FAR, the best things were the skewers. Pork belly especially was melt-in-your-mouth delectable. Only one skewer comes in each order so beware a few won't fill you up! Noodles were very flavorful, and the curry was good! Service was very fast and the prices were pretty good for the area! 10/10 would go back again to try new items on their menu!
No comment

Love this place! This is a Japanese restaurant right in the heart of midtown near 34 st. There their famous cotton candy sukiyaki which we didn't get and it's all over IG. We got their eel and avocado sushi and their chirashi Don as well as the beef tongue Don (which we didn't think we would like) but tasted so delicious! We absolutely loved everything and had a great time here. The waitress was attentive and provided great service. Overall we had a wonderful experience and will be back to try more food!

amazing service and water. the ramen thet we got was fantastic and the sushi was just next level

Came here on a weeknight. We got some yakitori and the cotton candy sukiyaki hotpot. The yakitori were good -- my favorites were chicken ball and pork belly. The cotton candy sukiyaki was too sweet, so will probably will go for the regular kind if I come again. Â Nice izakaya overall.

I had a good experience there, I've been probably 5 times and the workers are nice and the food comes out quick.

Amazing service and great food/drinks. Will definitely be back my next time in NYC. The vibe was great as well

Delicious food , especially the mushroom skwers!!! And excellent service, the pot is too spicy for us, they replace another one without peppers for us. Nice~

We got the yellowtail carpaccio, potato salad, and cotton candy Sukiyaki. Presentation of the food was very nice, the cotton candy sukiyaki was good and interesting, on the sweeter side though. The cotton candy melts into the soup as it cooks making it sweet. The meat was very tender and cooks fast. It comes with tofu, cabbage, mushrooms, watercress and noodles. All the food was fresh and very tasty! They also have a large menu!

The food here is very tasty! We got the candy floss sukiyaki, which is very interesting! Never seen a cotton candy on top of a hotpot. The server said they didn't put any sugar in the soup base, so the cotton candy is the way to let customers adjust the sweetness level. The cotton candy melts into the hotpot. The grilled beef tongue, pork belly yakitori, and chicken heart yakitori are all so good!! Everything is very well seasoned and grilled!! Definitely would come back again for the yakitori. The hotpot was great, but it was not mind blowing or anything. It does come with the ice cream. Also note that two orders of hotpot minimum when you order any hotpot. Service was good too! Overall, a very nice meal.

This place is a scam. We came in late and ordered this beef hot pot but I guess the meat ran out? so we ended up with a bowl of veggies and soup for $50, so my question is why would u still let us order it? The waitress didn't take care of us at all cause he was busy closing, but has the audacity to ask for tips in my face. Don't come here, it's waste of time and money.

Ordered through Uber Eats and didn't wait long to receive my food. I was very excited and had high hopes. Unfortunately, I was let down. I'll lay out how it was and let you decide. The American Wagyu was dry and not seasoned, maybe a little black pepper was on it, and it was $5.50 for the 4 small pieces (pictured.) The Tako Yaki had one piece of octopus in it, the size of a pencil eraser. The Yuzu Cheesecake was $9 for two doll size slices that tasted store bought. The deep fried calamari was flavorless, and came with no sauce to help. The Salmon Tataki was great, simple but fresh. Lastly, the Alaskan Snowbird roll, was the best dish by far, the salmon was fresh and plentiful.
Great food. Great service. Great vibes. Food came out in good intervals. Looking forward to trying different things.

I wanted to visit this place after seeing it on Instagram so many times, so I finally made the trip here and as soon as I got to the entrance I could not even tell if I was at the right location. Just from looking on the outside you can tell that this place is not authentic Japanese food -- it looked more like a Chinese restaurant with Japanese food. Upon walking in, the smell of bleach and dishwashing soap hit my face and I already wanted to leave but it was too late because my friend had already been waiting for me inside for 20 minutes and we felt bad for leaving. We ended up ordering 3 skewers and it came out to around $18 I believe....so not worth it. The skewers weren't bad but its overpriced and nothing special or authentic about it. The service here also is not the greatest, I called to ask if they accept reservations and the person who picked up the phone immediately went "NO RESERVATION" a millisecond after I finished my sentence. And when I asked if only walk-ins are available they quickly replied as if they were in a rush. Funny though because when I walked into the restaurant it was basically empty.
The mentaiko mayo has little bit sour, so you would not get sick of the fries. The draft beer is really good! I would also recommend chuhai! They have so many kinds of drinks.

I recommend this place because the flavor is good and I like how they use marshmallow to add sweetness to the sukiyaki pot.

I love this place. My girl and I come here after work for the best skewers and drinks. The drinks are very affordable and lovely. The selection of authentic japanese food is remarkable. I definitely recommend this place; the server CK and Chris are amazing.
hidden gem. the skewers are delicious, many options to choose from the menu, and the happy hour was a bonus!

Came here on a Wednesday evening with friends looking for a new izakaya and saw that this had just recently opened. The location is pretty convenient and actually quite empty inside. The decor was pretty good in regards to an izakaya style. However, if you are looking for something amazing/wildly good/ I think this place is just okay for having a quick dinner. They have combo options which is pretty cost efficient and have rice bowls, udon and such. Overall the food was good. Was it special, not really but it's decent and for those who have never had an izakaya experience should go try it.

I stayed here for 5 hours!!! The service, drinks, and food was AMAZING! It was such an amazing experience here that I have no regrets. The owner was more than welcome for new guests to be here - such amazing service. Good vibes and good food, 10/10 I am definitely coming back again!! :)
I love their ramen and noodles, especially the creamy noodles! Sooooo GooooD. Only $3 each skewer.

We arrived at 4:15 and got our food at 5pm. Surprisingly popular place because it opens at 4 and is almost full by 5 on a Saturday. Unagi don is highly recommended! Yakitori is ok. Will try sukiyaki next time!
Yakitori is where it's at! The seafood bowl was delicious as well and the staff was excellent.

sushi rolls are surprisingly good. They have happy hour until 7pm. The ingredients are fresh which is important for Japanese cuisine. Only the fried chicken is a bit over cooked . Good place for after work comfort food
Taste really good and definitely worth it. Nice ambiance and background music! Service is great too. will come here again

This place is so cute with the option to mix and match your own bento box with onigiri and lots of side dishes! I got the atsuage tofu with gomaae, hijiki, and a basic (black sesame) and original (miso paste) onigiri. My favorite was the miso paste onigiri. The black sesame was good but it was a little dry. Great bento boxes. Â enjoyed the tofu, two onigiri and side dishes. Â quick prep ordering at counter. Â nice sparse minimalistic space. Â Great local gem. I look forward to coming back soon.

The food here is delicious, and I appreciate their eco-conscious choices in packaging but the service is atrocious IF you have an issue. If there is no issue, getting food here is fine. Today was one of those days where I had an issue. I ordered my bento box online at 3:20 and was there at 3:30. I waited there 20 minutes as I watched three (!) walk ins order and leave with their food. I wasn't particularly mad but wondering if my order fell thru the cracks so I nicely asked the counter person there (a tall, curly haired dude named Jonathan) if my order was coming up. He responds to check my phone of the pick up time, which turned out to be in a few minutes, to which he responds, "Well that's when it will be ready." Â How rude and unsympathetic! Finally when the order does arrive, three minutes before closing, I decide to have one rice ball before heading out. Seeing me opening the bento box inside the bag, Jonathan then goes on a rant about how rude I am by eating there when they are closing, then he goes to the back kitchen and passive-aggressively loudly tells whoever's there that I'm eating there because they took forever. I was opening up the box to have one rice ball! Good grief. Despite how delicious the food it there, a rude counter person like him just ruins the entire experience.

I was very excited to spot this place on the map, it was the perfect lunch spot. Every bite of my bento lived up to my expectations and had delicious flavors. I had the tofu bento with a tuna and a salmon rice ball as well as curried cauliflower and edamame for my sides. If i lived here I would stop in all the time for a rice ball snack or a bento lunch or a refreshing tea.

Great lunch spot. Tried the tofu bento box with tuna+mayo and salmon rice ball. Everything is fresh, filling, and flavorful. I could eat 10000 of the tuna mayo rice balls. Vibe is great too- I usually do take out but even waiting for the meal with the jazz playing and sweet staff makes me happy.

Really great wholesome delicious Japanese food. Very fresh, great portions and prices! Perfect lunch stop. The bento box is such a good deal for the quality and how much food your get. You can pick a meat or do a tofu veg option, then you also get two sides and two rice balls of your choice. The sides range from seaweed salad, to curried cauliflower. I really enjoyed the green beans in a sesame sauce. Had a nice nutty flavor on top of the crisp beans. The rice balls were also really good! I liked how they were slightly warm and not like chilled like the rice balls you typically might find. Everything was cooked very well- tender, crisp veggies, soft yet firm rice, & tender salmon and chicken. I left here feeling satisfied and happy. Will definitely be coming back to try other options in my bento and I herd the grilled corn rice ball is very good as well.

Everything about this place was perfect and I cannot wait to go back and try more food from their menu! The shop itself was super sleek, modern, spotless and I loved the jazz music playing in the background. I ordered the ume and original rice ball. I am Japanese and it was my first time eating onigiri with organic brown rice. It definitely had a different taste and tasted very healthy, but still VERY good! I seriously want to go back and try more things from the menu. Highly recommend checking this spot out!

I get Rice and Miso almost every Tuesday for lunch at their pop-up in West Elm in DUMBO and was so excited to hear they opened a location in Boerum Hill. I love their bento box with tofu, two brown rice balls (tuna is my favorite) and two vegetable sides.
No comment
Such delicious and very healthy options. If you are in the neighborhood, you must try. The staff is always super helpful and friendly as well.

This was a fantastic find for something clean and simple, but absolutely yummy to devour every last bite. Â I did the bento box with a pick of two onigiri (original and beef), Â two sides, and miso soup.

Great, simple menu, quality ingredients, very fresh/light and I appreciate the vegetarian options & veggie side dishes. Â A nice departure from the more common (and often mediocre) sushi and noodle-centric japanese options for lunch or a quick snack. Â Definitely going back. Â Also, it seems like they may experiment/try out adding japanese baked goods/pastries or other offerings in the future.
This place is so beautiful. I feel incredible when I eat their lunch. The place itself is tiny and can be an intimate experience with other customers- but it's also very quick for takeout.
I love this place! Â Perfect spot to grab a quick lunch during the week. Â The energy is serene and the rice balls are DELICIOUS.
Delicious tofu bento box for lunch in a quiet, calming atmosphere. Â It is small but luckily it wasn't overrun so my friend and I were able to sit and eat and chat. Â I will definitely go back.

So happy this place opened up in the neighborhood. Better than my mom makes - eek! I rarely choose brown rice for my onigiri, but I am loving their onigiri (all brown rice, no white option). Everything I've tried has been excellent...tofu steak, miso soup, hijiki, green bean goma-ae (perfectly cooked), wakame cucumber salad. And my two small kids have been gobbling it up as well. A great place for a healthy, delicious meal or snack.
Awesome! Beats Mitsuwa, quality of the ingredients and the flavors are all excellent.

Rice & miso is a spiritual experience. Clean, delicious food in a calming minimal interior. The bento box is the way to go - both chicken and tofu are amazing, and I usually wrap up one of the rice balls to snack on later. The only downside is that it's closed on Sunday, and for some reason I crave it EVERY Sunday! But yes, do try this place out, you won't regret it!
I only tried the rice balls with spicy tuna. It was yummy definitely want to stop by and try the bento box some time

I wasn't very impressed by this place. Food was okay but certainly nothing to write home about. Chicken was gross, which caused me to just throw them out.
This is such a nice addition to the neighborhood. Tofu or chicken bento box, rice balls and osozai in a beautifully designed, skylight-lit storefront.
Clean, bright space with thoughtfully prepared little Japanese snacks. Delicious matcha lattes.

Serene space, super polite staff, beautiful counter, and completely delicious food. Â I had the bento box with tofu steak, 2 vegetable sides, and 2 rice balls. Â Everything was delicious, and the rice balls are made to order - so the toasted nori that wraps the rice ball is still crispy when you eat it. Â Lovely. Â Everything - the vegetables, the tofu, the rice - was fresh and just right. Â I particularly recommend the Original rice ball, very flavorful. Â But everything was very good.

This place is such a great addition to the neighborhood. The food is yummy, fresh and offered at a good price. I also love the simplicity of Â as well. I think this will be my go-to lunch spot.
The food was good. It didn't blow me away but I really liked the originality. I'll be coming back to try other things and update my review. I highly recommend giving this place a try!

Went by today for the first time for lunch. Had a bento box lunch with chicken, two lovely side salads, and two brown rice balls (tuna and beef). Perfect little lunch. Took the food to go because there are only 4 stools inside and they were taken. Cash only for now.

I don't write many reviews, but I am making a point to write one because I want this place to make it. Â I happened to notice it walking by. Â It's small and easy to miss. Â Definitely a take out place, but the storefront is nice and clean looking. Â Their menu is pretty small, comprised mostly of $10-$14 bento boxes, $3-$5 rice balls, and miso. Â I got a chicken bento box; it came with 2 rice balls and 2 vegetables. Â Everything was terrific. Â I highly recommend it!

Came here for the first time tonight with a few friends. Oh. My. Gosh. Absolutely delicious. We live in the neighborhood and have been waiting for a good neighborhood place to open. This is it. The owner came over and introduced himself and helped us with the menu. The staff was all super attentive. And the food. Wonderful! Â We ordered a bunch of starters and sides to share. The octopus was out of this world. The dips, and local foods- all so tasty. They make their own red wine which is super smooth. Cannot wait to go back and try more.
love this place! best tuna tartar in the city hands down!
Absolutely delicious!!! The best Thai food in Brooklyn! The drinks were exquisite and tasty. The food was even better. It was fresh, bold, and flavorful.

It's great for lunch. The ambience is nice and intimate. The drinks are nice and strong will definitely recommend I've been here three days out of the week.
Amazing food, love love love! Fast service and awesome staff. So fresh, so good, tasted every herb and ingredients - will come back again!!

This place was so good. I honestly have no complaints just the massaman curry was a little salty but it wasn't overally salty . The vibe the staff . Everything was immaculate . Our server was the sweetest and so kind. I really enjoyed my drink . I had a lychee mojito and I also had the chive pancakes for a appetizers super delicious super fresh . I really enjoyed it . I would def be back here and the prices are great too .

The curry's here are delicious. I have to say the green curry is quite spicy. I loved the panang curry, great spice and flavors with all the veggies & chicken. The service, ambience, and lighting was lovely. They use real candles & flowers on the tables so it feels a little fancier than your everyday Thai dinner!

Glin was very good! Cute spot in Fort Greene that had a good amount of different options. To start we had the curry puffs, seafood salad, and their tom yum soup. All were great. The curry puff had great filling and was nice and flaky. The seafood salad I just loved! It had a nice subtle heat, which I really enjoyed. The tom yum had great flavor, a lot of mushrooms, and was served very hot. For our entrees we got the pad see ew with shrimp, and the massaman curry with chicken. The massaman was very good, although I do wish it was spicier. It was pretty mild in heat, which was a little bit of a disappointment. The pad see ew was alright, and leaned a little drier. I'd probably pass on ordering it when I come back. However, everything else was amazing! The passion fruit lemonade is a must order as well! Overall, great place that I'm happy we stumbled upon.

Excellent food! Perhaps the best Thai food I've had in NYC. (Even better, in my opinion, than a more popular michelin starred competitor in the city). Go for the branzino with mango salad on top (Pla Neung Manow) and the savory, spritely Crispy Duck Thai Fried Rice. Mango Sticky Rice is of course a classic (relatively sizable portion) and the pumpkin custard special was a nice and subdued nightcap.

This is elevated dining, not just another takeout Thai restaurant. Â Dined in during restaurant week and found the ambience, meal, and attentive service to be A1. Â Don't overlook them as a date spot.

This spot is an absolute gem with delicious food, drinks, and friendly service. I came on a Sunday afternoon and was seated right away. It was a super hot day and I don't think they have AC so it was pretty warm inside but they had the entire front open (doors/windows) which helped a little. The lychee lemonade was sweet and refreshing and my friend enjoyed her Thai iced tea. It was my first time trying chive pancakes and wow! So so good and crispy. We also started with the spring rolls which were cooked perfectly. The shrimp fried rice was so flavorful & a big enough portion to share. I also really enjoyed the pad see ew. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. I will be back soon to try more!

Glin Thai is my go to place when I want good food, good vibes & great service. My friend introduced me to this spot, but I've taken over Â My fave is the Drunken Noodles w/beef and the passionfruit lemonade
Don't sleep on this place. Wonderful staff, romantic atmosphere and delicious thai food.

My sister and I stopped in this place as a last minute decision and it was such a delight! First off, the staff were so friendly and personable. I didn't get the waiters name, but he engaged in conversation and shared their story of how they all came from Thailand and started this business together. He made it such a warm environment on such a rainy day and even gave us a complimentary thai ice tea to try!! For food-- I've had Pad Thai from over 100 different restaurants (one of my fav foods) and this one ranks top of the list as well as the pad se ew. After we left, my sister and I kept talking about how great both dishes were on our walk home. We'll definitely be back and excited to try all the other options on the menu!!!

Great service - good food, ordered 2 apps - curry puffs and seafood salad as well as a noodle and curry dish to share. Vibes are cute. Would go again for happy hour!!

Best Thai in the neighborhood. Love this place so much. Highly recommend the red curry!

They have a decent lunch special. For $13 you get a choice of a soup or a salad, I got the soup Â , then I got the beef pad see-ev w/ pancakes on the side. This time it wasn't as greasy like the last place this was.(Ace Thai Â ) I definitely finish my meal .portions are small . But very tasty . If you post your entire meal on Instagram/ or Facebook you get free dessert! In this case we did. So I also got the cookies and cream ice cream w/ whip cream on top! . That filled us up for sure ... they also have happy hour here too. Till 7 pm so I ordered the passion fruit martini. It was a bit strong but I like it the way too! . We sat in the front section. The have bar seating too and more seating in the back! . The staff here is very friendly as well .

Delicious food, friendly staff and beautiful space. I came here for dinner and it was so delicious and beautiful that i hosted a 13 person dinner in the back. The manager worked w me to select a four course meal and the staff was so attentive and kind. Go eat or celebrate an event at GLIN!

I went in there for the first time since they reopened. Â It was formally Ace Thai, I am assuming its still the same owners and they just got a bit of a facelift. Â And I like it very cute but still super casual. Â The food is as good or slightly better than the Ace. Â Very friendly service and food comes out quick Happy Hour everyday 12-7PM.

made my second visit for lunch special after work today. A Thai restaurant owned/operated by Thai people, which is actually hard to find!!! Lunch special includes appetizer and main dish. So, So good. I had pad thai both times and they use thinner noodles, which is unique! Their sauce/dressings are gentle. you can get free iced thai tea or lemonade (?) during lunch special if you dine in, for Grand opening. Excellent service - attentive and smiley

The food was top notch along with the service and atmosphere. Cocktails were made fresh. Duck was hands down the best duck i ever had. Crispy skin and boneless with a delicious sauce. Drunken noodle and pineapple fried rice was perfect. Curry puffs and chive pancakes were a great start.

The end to a wonderful meal! First time going in person after having a great ordering in experience. We got the chive pancakes (delicious!), the papaya salad, green curry, pad see ew, the eggplant tofu and the chocolate lava cake. Everything was great! Can't wait to come back to try even more. -- definitely the best Thai in the area!

Stopped by glin for a casual lunch. Enjoyed the food. Ordered the crispy chicken wings which were delicious and fried to perfection. The service was also great. My server was kind and attentive!

V impressed w Glin Thai Bistro. So thrilled they just opened. Ordered the pad Thai ex spicy (thai spicy), and superb. The noodles were thinner than the usual but still aldente. V fun to eat. Had a great balance of flavors- not too sweet, not too tangy- and that charred wok taste. Bf had massaman curry, and it was also excellent. Beef was tender, rich, complex but balanced flavors. Tom yum soup was also v good. Had a bit more depth than the usual Tom yum. Think it might've had a splash of coconut milk? Overall will def be back, and bringing more company! Hope they have longevity bc you can tell there's a lot of love here!
Excellent service, atmosphere, food, portions, price. Rare restaurant that checks all the boxes.

Amazing and so glad this opened up in Fort Greene! Great service and incredible food. Very good prices too for NYC! Will definitely be back soon!

Their food and service was so good that me and my husband came here twice in one day. We had their Pad Cha Seafood and Tom Yum Seafood and they were amazing! The Tom Yum had the perfect amount of spice and so much tasty seafood in it. And to finish it off we had their mango sticky rice both visits, which were the perfect ending to our visits. But even above their food, we say their service was out of this world, they were super hospitable and kind during both visits. They made sure we had everything we needed and were super attentive to our table. Definitely a must-try spot for delicious Thai in BK!

This restaurant was not crowded but met the quality standard of any great NYC Thai restaurant. Â The atmosphere was great with warm, scented air and tropical decorations. Â The house special cocktails were all well crafted, and the happy hour goes until 7. Â The food was also good, with all the standard Thai dishes available and well made. Excellent plating, service is very friendly. They keep live flowers which is a nice elegant touch. Food is well seasoned and prepared to my liking. Wish I wasn't a tourist so I can keep coming back!
Great Pad see ew with chicken. $15 plus tax is a great price. Friendly staff, and they were open on in the fourth which was nice. I wish then luck, I'll be back.

New gems in Brooklyn. Very cozy Thai place. The food is fresh and everything we order is delicious. We went for a large group and they were able to accommodate us right the way. The staff were beyond nice. Reasonable price and very nice decor. Signature drinks are so so good.
Amazing Thai food!! The Pad Kee Mao=Drunken noodles was flavorful with beef. Spring rolls and and soup also delicious. My favorite part was the iced coffee!!

I love this restaurant the food very delicious and good service , I feel very clean atmosphere

Great food and fast service also wonder and casual Ambience. Â I would definitely go back there again!

We absolutely LOVE THE WARREN. Can't say enough good things about this place. Our personal favorites include the truffle Mac and cheese, "meatballs" that you can't even believe are made of eggplant, Warren burger, Â and kale salad. Dimitri, Jose and Junior make all their guests feel at home inside the restaurant. Despite indoor dining being closed for covid, they have made the outdoor seating comfortable, warm and still feels as though you're enjoying an intimate dinner. Dimitri, the owner, has two bottles of his own wine that I'd recommend for everyone to try (Maison Lapin).

Visited after watching a show at the Lucille theatre up the street. The space is small. Nevertheless, we were seated within 10 minutes of arrival. Service was fantastic. But the star of the show here was the food. I ordered the scallops. THIS was a five star meal. Best thing I've eaten in a long time. The scallops weren't overdone. They were flavorful. The sauce that was under the beans and mushrooms was amazing. The veggies were fresh. My husband had a burger. He said the beef was great quality. The fries were hot and fresh. This was a great late night option that we stumbled into on a whim. When in lower Manhattan, I will be sure to return. AMAZING.

I was very impressed with the food at The Warren. No wonder since most of the other restaurants around the area were quite empty compared to the popping atmosphere at The Warren. What a fabulous find in the Village! Don't be fooled by the hours posted on Yelp; they actually open at 4:30. We got there right when they opened (or a little before), and the place filled up quickly for happy hour. The punch was good, the Brussel Sprouts were a very nice surprise with TONS of cheese slathered on top. They twice fried chicken was good, but the pork belly (not on happy hour) was my favorite! Will definitely be back next time I'm in NYC!

My wife and I love The Warren. This place is truly incredible. I had my first date with my wife here - four years of marriage and a one-year-old later, we still make every effort to visit this fantastic place. It's intimate, fun and the cocktails are incredible. The food is sensational, and you won't be disappointed with anything on the menu. The owner Dimitri is a stand-up guy who is always there with the highest level of hospitality. Great place for group with friends. Very cozy feels and plates to share were all good!

I always love my experience here and so will you.

Just moved into the neighborhood and discovered this place coming home from a walk. The food and drinks were AMAZING. Living in New York I tend to like to branch out and never repeat restaurants but this place I'll surely be coming back to. The tacos and truffle Mac and cheese will not disappoint!

Love this place. Amazing food and an ever growing menu. Great cocktails. I've had some of my favorite Nyc moments right at the bar.

We went for the burger -as we heard it was great and it was definitely not worth it and the price was way too high - $25. Would not recommend or go back.

My waiter was wonderful and I left so full, I couldn't even finish the mussels. I'm sure it's going to be one of the tougher places to get a reservation in no time!

Love this restaurant! It's so nice and cozy, not too many tables so it's not packed and uncomfortable. The service is great, our server Irene was so attentive and sweet! I will definitely be visiting this place again, the chicken was amazing!

Great new spot and the fluke Crudo is really REALLY good! I will Def be dropping in again for dinner and To see the downstairs speakeasy once it opens. Great atmosphere and a cute date night or girls night spot!

This new place is perfect to hang out. It has good music, delicious food and cocktails, the service is outstanding..I love the bartender! The burger is seriously the best burger ever! You have to try it. I will definitely come again

My favorite restaurant in NYC! The entire menu is absolutely delicious (arugula flatbread, garlic shrimp, Mac and cheese, poutine, "meatballs" to name a few) as well as the amazingly crafted cocktails (Mary Jane and the daily Punch). Come with a group or on a date, the ambience is so welcoming and cozy. Great happy hour until 8pm and their staff is super friendly and attentive.

I visited here a few times. Every time I visited, the menu changed. I think the first time I visited the food was the best! The other times it was okay. This place wasn't what i thought it was but maybe i just read the info wrong. The mussels were amazing! I had a chardonnay and my date had the Warren punch. It was a good place, nice and cozy.

Wine was good. Food was good. Prices were great -- 3 drinks, 2 appetizers, and 3 entrees for $100. Service was a little slow but it was a busy night! Waitress was professional and kind -- Would return :)

Big fan of this place. Was recently introduced to it, as the owner is a friend of a friend, and it's great. Great bar food to accompany great drinks. Very relaxed atmosphere with a cool diverse crowd. The place is accommodating to everyone. I can't wait to go back!

This place is great for after work drinks and a bite. Â The cocktail list is good. I'd recommend the Warren Punch. We had the gnocchi and it was divine! the service was quick, the drinks were good and the atmosphere was really nice. This would be a great date spot because it's nice and romantic but not too expensive. Will definitely be back!

The restaurant has nice vibe but their happy hour set up is strange-only at the bar and high tables on weekends, meaning Friday nights..what's the difference between regular tables and high tables. Happy hour food was just so so. The service was interesting - not sure if the experience is matching up what I was reading in the reviews.

The atmosphere here was great. Love the vibe inside. We grabbed a cocktail while waiting for our table. The bartender was very friendly and crafted this vodka, pear and pecorino drink that was actually quite delicious. Â The service was fantastic and we ordered several small plates. We have not stopped telling everyone about the "meatballs". They are eggplant with ricotta meatballs that sliced like butter and melted in your mouth!! To die for. Would for sure go back again when visiting the city.

Great spot in the village, family people all good music. The people watching walking by is second to none. I had the place by chicken Benedict, which was great. The queen had the avocado toast. $6 mimosas!!! We came here on a Sunday afternoon, great spot.

would not come here again. Could hardly get through the burger, which is supposed to be one of the best things here. Service was subpar.

I came here last night Saturday. Lovely day, the hostess, bartender and my waitress were all amazing. I told them I was going to waiting for a bit for someone. The main course food was great as well as the HH drinks and food were delicious. Thank you to the staff last night for your great hospitality and vibe. My boyfriend and I will be back.
