I'm really sad I couldn't give this restaurant a 5 star rating. Food was absolutely delicious. Truffle Mac and cheese and the "Meatballs" (made of eggplant) are must absolute musts! But it was uncomfortably hot in the restaurant. Apparently there is a boiler room above the restaurant for the apartments which makes this place feel like a sauna. Again, great food. I'm sweating as I write this.

Came here on a Sunday evening. It was pretty empty with less than 8 parties but the vibe was great. Tony, the bartender, was super cool. He offered great recommendation for food to share and made us delicious drinks. Will be back!

This was a great local bar. Â My wife had the local punch and we both had some crispy Brussels sprouts. Â Very tasty and great atmosphere. Â Definitely worth a try for their happy hour or food when you can. Â I will be back!

What a wonderful place. Â The atmosphere is great, it very cosy and a bit loud but its got a great 'feel' especially on a cold NYC winter night. Â The food is excellent if a bit expensive. Â The service was wonderful, we had a lovely waitress named Anna from Virginia who just awesome in every way. Â I highly recommend you visit, my cousins from Ireland loved the place. Â Have the Truffle Mac & Cheese, the Fried Chicken Starter, the Burger and ask for Anna! Â A can't miss.

Absolutely awesome experience at the restaurant.. the food was incredible.. the service was beyond good, our waiter was attentive, patient and so friendly.. had to wait a bit to get a table which was expected on a Saturday night, my only issue is that there was a column in the wall that stuck out into the booth bench and it was a little bizarre they even have a table there. It was a bit uncomfortable but I managed fine.

It was Saturday, I made a reservation at 4pm and we were the very first customers. We were greeted by a waiter who knew my number of guests after giving him my name. I'm already happy. We're seated immediately without our full party and noticed that the table was wobbly but didn't say anything. The waiter noticed himself and fixed it in front of us. So far, service is great. We had the grilled octopus and brussel sprouts, delicious. I ordered a glass of cabernet, which was smooth and warming, perfect. I thought I'd have room to order another dish but I was filled. Our waiter was friendly, attentive and personable. We never felt rushed. The restaurant is cozy, dim lighted, romantic. I can't wait to go again and try their other dishes. I had a lovely experience.
Our service staff was David! He was clear, direct and quick!! Great worker, too. Â Can't wait to be back on Mondays for the $10 Burgers. So excited to try the other beers too!

I had the chicken and waffles and it was DELICIOUS - I did not even want to give my husband a bite of it, it was so good. I also had the day's House Punch, which was only $6. I'm a bit of a lightweight and it was very strong to me - I was loopy halfway through (but it tasted great). My husband and his cousin had Bloody Mary's and said they were some of the best they have ever had. My husband had the poutine and said it was very tasty, but the portion was a little small.

I love this restaurant! Super cute vibe, low lighting, always has vibey music on. Dmitry's cocktails are always perfection. I had their new Ribeye steak last night and it was phenomenal! You will NOT be disappointed. Their lamb chops are also fantastic. Great consistent service, perfect for a date, cocktails with friends or dinner solo!

We went there to celebrate a birthday. We went down from the Bronx and the birthday girl came from Brooklyn. The staff is friendly and inviting. Our waitress was amazing and friendly. The food was even more amazing. The Octopus salad was so good that the people at my table all had to try and I was left with very little. I ordered another one!! Excellent, I'm still thinking about it! Â We had literally everything on the menu and passed it around. During this feast the staff was attentive but not intrusive. I'm still smiling from the wonderful experience I had at The Warren, you must try it! If you're not from the area, get there a little early and go to the pier or take a stroll afterwards. The 5 stars are for Food, Decor, Staff, Atmosphere.

It's been a while since my last visit and my prior review stands. This is the absolute best place in the West Village. Just had a dozen oysters, half from the east coast and half from the west coast. Incredible oysters and said to match. Also shared sea scallops in a butter reduction and grilled shrimp with my wife. All doshes impeccably served and Super delicious. Demetry and his staff continue to shine.

First the good stuff. Genuine hospitality from the hostess. We were early for our reservation but we're offered our table even though the rest of our party wasn't coming for 30 minutes. Good menu lots of choices. Here on yelp it describes the price point as $$ not true. With drinks and wine by the glass at $13- $15 each and a burger at $21.00 Â more like $$$. Also the place is loud. About the service, appetizers came out quickly, water was replenished often, but delivery of our entrees took more than a half hour after we had the appetizers.

Great spot! Came here for dinner on a Friday night. A friend and I shared 4 "plates": truffle mac and cheese, arugula salad, grilled octopus, and ravioli (special for the night). One of the best mac and cheese's I've ever had. Tons of cheese, silky consistency with crunchy breadcrumbs on top, and not dried out - couldn't stop eating it! Salad was simple but fresh and the octopus was tender and well seasoned. Ravioli were delicious and had an amazing sauce. Other reviewers mentioned small portions but I thought all of these were fairly generous - more than enough food for 2. Great music playing and overall energetic vibe while still being able to hear each other talk. Service was also extremely friendly and quick! Â Would come back for sure!

Very friendly staff made this Â a pleasant place to hang out. Happy hour prices were good and the salmon dish which I was told was new to the menu was excellent. Nice Decor and atmosphere.Definitely recommend

Neat little place situated right outside the Christopher Street PATH stop, the Warren bridges the casual with the slightly more upscale. It's a solid wine bar that also has a large TV screen showing the football games. Cool atmosphere with decent enough service. Drinks were great.

Where do we start! Come here for brunch... Order the burger DEFINITELY THE POUTINE TO SHARE and the fried chicken Benedict! Whatever the punch is go for it amazing every day.. Start with a spicy Bloody Mary can't go wrong.. The cheesecake is like eating clouds with crumbs.. Special touch! Amazing service people good vibe!!
The women are hot. The food is orgasmic. The service is fantastic. The menu is awesome. Love love lo e

I came here for a private party. The appetizers: flatbread, sliders, fried chicken, octopus, and poutin, were very tasteful and delicious. The owner, Dimitri, was very accommodating, and professional . He created a signature drink Â especially for the party. There was no wait time at the open bar. Staff was very nice and kept the appetizers coming. My family came out of town for this private event and we had the most amazing time. Great people, company, ambiance and vibe. Great local spot. I can't wait to come again.

The Warren is a must in the west village. The owners are top notch professionals and they know how to provide great service to their customers. Â Had a private party here and everyone had a blast. The drinks and the food were fantastic. The space has a great vibe. Â Try the special punch that changes daily.
Completely professional and responsive in midst of challenges w delivery. Â Amazing food and classy management makes this place a must for delivery or eating out!

Great service, great location. Â Their happy hour goes until 8pm during the week, and the offering of small plates and drinks on HH is subtlety robust. Â The full menus leans more towards tapas style servings but the attention to detail and quality is that of a full entree at an expensive restaurant. Â When you couple that with incredible service all night, it's a recipe that I'll return to try again!

We stumbled on this place. We came early when they were just opening and enjoyed their happy hour. Got two beers, a dozen oysters, the fried chicken, a punch, and the shishito peppers. The food, ambiance, service, and music were all outstanding. I got the Ommegang white which was refreshing and delicious. The fried chicken was excellent with a great outer crunch. Â The oysters were extremely fresh and tasty. The service was super friendly. Â We would definitely return. Â Look forward to trying the octopus next time.

6 out of towners got together here last night and the food and service were great. Neighborhood is chill and cool of course and there was an intimate and friendly vibe. Our server looked cute in her suspenders! We walked up a block to Henrietta Hudson's to dance a little before heading back to our hotel. Great night, thanks Warren!!
This place is pretty small but the happy hour is great and runs until 8pm. The Mac n cheese is delicious!
Efficient, friendly staff. So-so food. Majority B&T crowd channeled into the restaurant by the nearby PATH train makes for a weird atmosphere. A disappointment overall.
Happy hour $8 til 8pm. The atmosphere is cute. The staff isn't super attentive so it took a while for us to order, but the flatbread was tasty and the wine was decent.
No comment
Went there because it was ranked highly on some list of happy hours. Â The drinks were fine, but there were no vegetarian options for snacks/foods on the happy hour menu - that was not so cool.

Made reservations through yelp an hour before and got seated at the best spot in the house, right in the nook. The ambiance was lively and fun, yet also very romantic. Service was top notch, drinks were good and the food was nice too! I only wish they offered a few vegan options. A solid pick for a last minute Friday night outing!

I went here with my gf to get out of the rain one night and was a bit put off because the bar was a little snug. The hostess immediately showed us to a table and we ordered drinks that were brought within 2 minutes. I cannot tell you how amazing our night was. The food was amazing, the drinks were superb and after we finished our meal the bartender invited us to have a seat at the bar. Many locals and regulars (considering the place is new) welcomed us in and we had a very memorable night. Been back a few times and the bartender always remembers us. Can't tell you enough about this village gem.

Food is okay under seasoned, but the service, in particular Ivi, probably the worst service ever!! Â Took 15 minutes to get my martini. By the time it came it was warm had to send back. After we ordered our food never saw her again. Had to ask another waiter for another drink. She was quick with the check. Never came back and asked how everything was. Â  Just awful service. Â Food was under seasoned. The Mac and cheese needed salt as did the poutine. The burger was good.
This is pretty good for a splurge. New American food with good cocktails. I had the poutine to start and the lamb to follow and was not disappointed.

we went after a show on Broadway and it was almost empty. Â they were out of a couple entree items we wanted but I understand quality control. Â I a had the lamb which was out of this world. Â the flatbread also worth a mention.

What an absolute gem! I happened to stumble upon The Warren and I'm very glad I did. (Take advantage of the complimentary Warren Punch by checking in on Yelp) it's a nice refreshing summer drink made with pears. Oysters were a great starter. The grilled octopus was cooked to perfection! Octopus can go horribly wrong when not made correctly but The Warren has mastered it. I had the short rib poutine; although delicious I wouldn't call it "poutine." There aren't cheese curds in it like Canadian poutine, think along the lines of cheese fries (with white cheese.) Whatever the cheese situation is- they're delicious! The twice fried chicken is a reason on its own to visit The Warren. It's deliciously crunchy and the sauce.... mmmm the sauce! If you're lucky enough you may happen upon one of the owners, Tony. He can definitely carry a conversation =)

Great spot! Love the open air inside with floor to ceiling windows in the front, relaxed atmosphere with chill background music. Good spot for catching up with a friend on a Sunday night! Â Bartender was super friendly and extra plus- there's outlets under the bar for charging your phone!
We really liked this place, it was a hot night and with no A/C we thought this might be an issue but the place was nice and cool with some ceiling fans. The food was great, try the meatballs

The ambience of this place is nice and quaint. Â The food on the other hand was almost good but wasn't executed well. Â The shrimp we ordered came in this butter water and was very under seasoned and was supposed to be garlicky but I couldn't taste it and the burger I had was cooked well in the middle but somehow the bottom was burnt. Â Service overall was good and they were friendly but I was a bit disappointed since the reviews are amazing. So I think it's just ok

Solid food and drink, but they kept messing around with the music volume, and the server didn't quite get when to ask us what.
Came here on NYE, they were short staffed. Even though the venue wasn't popping, my friends and I waited 30 minutes for our drinks.
Omg. Great new addition to the west village. The food is amazing and so is the staff. I had the the burger and I loved it. My friend had the chicken just as good.
My drink had egg white in it that was served unshaken and stringy. Absolutely no help provided by server or manager. Horrible service- had to leave immediately.

I found The Warren recently on a trip to NYC. My girlfriend an I stumbled upon this place in the Village due to it's high rating on Yelp!. The food was excellent but the real star of the show was that they have Crabbie's Ginger Beer. It is now my new favorite beer ever. The pricing was reasonable for lunch compared to some of the other places in the city. This place is brand new and I am sure they will last with such great food and service.

I had a delicious meal here with very warm service. The Chili Shrimp starter was tasty and had a nice spicy kick and the flank steak main was also cooked perfectly. Cocktails here are amazing too! Highly recommend this restaurant.

So I literally was craving a burger, and saw that happy hour burgers were 10 bucks (can't beat that).. not only is the place a perfect spot for a drink or dinner, their food is excellent! I had the burger and fries and it was definetly worth it! Right next to the path, great location, and awesome customer service. A must eat if looking for a quaint local eat!

Awesome service and awesome vibe! Came here twice in 2 weeks and both the times the drinks and food were amazing, especially the double fried chicken, bacon mac and cheese, and the warren punch!! Definitely a place to stop by after work for happy hour and to just relieve any tensions
One of the best chicken liver I had. Beer selection was good too. Enjoyed our happy hour.

Chill atmosphere. Background music allowed for good conversation. Great drinks and food menu. Portion size smaller than what many restaurants of similar price and quality, but it's so well done I didn't mind.

I always recommend The Warren for drinks and bites in the West Village. It is perfect for meeting friends after work, a date, or a solo drink - the environment has an elevated casual feel, and while you'll see people dressed in after work clothes it manages to be fairly laid-back but also nice. I typically come during their great happy hour (which goes until 8pm) and stick to the small bites, though the larger entrees also look delicious. Get the brussels sprouts and some charcuterie to pair with one of the many wines they have available. There is also a daily punch that is worth looking in to. This is not a huge space so would not bring a large group here, but its perfect for groups of 1-4. The service is always friendly and timely, even though there are usually numerous people to attend to and only a couple of servers. I've enjoyed coming here year round: the space provides a nice reprieve from the harshness of winter while in the warmer months the windows open up allowing for you to bask in the city's full summer glory.

Food was superb. Â Had the Ribeye. Â It was TNT dynamite! Â Our server guided us through the cocktail list with charm and an infectious smile. Â This place makes you feel right at home off the bat. Â We sat in the private room upstairs. Â The best part by far was the Teddy Bear working the bar. Â I think his name is Meech? Â He was a delight. Definitely coming back.

I am about this place! Got off the path and the open windows/doors looked especially inviting in this beautiful weather. What's more beautiful? Their happy hour specials $7 bites and drinks. Had the poutine which was the truth! Met the owner, Dimitri, he was wonderful and beyond sweet! Great vibe and priced very reasonably! Very, very glad I strolled in!

Meh. Cramped with a bit of a cheesy feel to it. Burger was ok - nothing more. And for $25, it better be more than ok. Happy hour is decent, but it's just not a comfortable place, or one I'd recommend anyone head to. More like a 2.5, but given that I can't muster any reason to ever head back (after a few visits) we'll go with a 2.

We had dinner here last night and it was just ok. The service left a little to be desired. The food was quite good, but they were out of the flatbread that I'd really been looking forward to. I had the winter greens salad - excellent, and the brick chicken - pretty good. My friend had the burger - delicious but the bun was so soaked in sauce that it completely fell apart as he ate it. Ambience was very nice visually, but it stiflingly hot. Probably won't be back.
No comment
I've never been to a more pleasant bar in my entire life! the hostess incredibly gorgeous and the bartender was more than friendly! Food and drinks were delicious and reasonably priced! Yum !
No comment

Great place for happy hour. Sat at the bar and chatted with the bartender who was knowledgeable, friendly, and passionate about his cocktails. He even made a couple drinks for us and the few other people at the bar to try. Happy hour included a punch - a gin based fruit and citrus mixture. The word punch usually turns me off but for $7 during happy hour, I tried it and I was surprised how good it was!
Cute place on the west side! Went here for happy hour and discovered the Yelp deal (one free drink). Delicious drinks and a really good meat & cheese plate. Will definitely be back!
No comment
Great cozy atmosphere. Service was great! We tried a lot on the menu and everything was amazing!
Out of control. Awesome drinks but the real star is the food. Chef is amazing. Great wait staff. Awesome energy. Can't wait to go back

Excellent food and drinks. The fried chicken and bacon mac and cheese especially stood out. Great service and ambiance as well. I went last night and have already recommended the restaurant to several people.
Great service and food!! The ambiance chill and layed back. Highly recommended. Lamb chops and Sate were delicious.
Really good service & food. The atmosphere is great, wait staff is extremely accommodating and the Warren Burger, Chicken Liver Foie Gras, and Twice Baker Chicken all are highly recommended.

The Warren is a newcomer to the West Village scene, and soon to be an institution. Everything from the breezy, modern yet cozy atmosphere to the food and cocktails, The Warren strikes the perfect balance of sophisticated and comfortable. Come for dinner, drinks, or their incredible happy hour. Can't go wrong!

I had the best truffle Mac and cheese of my life and I'm not being dramatic. It was to die for. I also had the pork belly and black kale salad - both were also so delicious! This place is great for groups but it's not that intimate so if you're looking for a quiet spot then i wouldn't recommend it. Make a reservation if you're a group larger than 3 arriving around the happy hour time. This place has great happy hour specials by the way with and a ton of shareable plates. I'd highly recommend this spot!! I really enjoyed my time here.

$1 oysters at 8pm!!! oh my yes!!! although everything else was just ok... group of 4 so we ordered brussel sprouts, grilled octopus, pork chunks w/kimchi & twice fried chicken w/cabbage slaw... I told my friend she should've ordered the burger as our sweet waitress highly recommended & she replied, "I haven't seen 1 burger come out that kitchen!"... good point... go for the oysters, they were A+! Nicely dimmed cozy spot, hard to have a conversation with more than 1 person, music didn't seem loud until we kept asking the waitress, huh? what? say again? nonetheless... they have souvenir matches. :/

Come to Shorty's you can drink at a good price what your favorite sports team and good music is playing with request, when you come ask for the best bartender Yvonne she great even saved my hat for me when I left it one night .... great place
All i have to say is go. Amazing vibe, great food and drinks and Dimitri the owner /bartender is one of the nicest humans on the planet.

This Place is Amazing!!!! Food is tasty, never disappoints, Great Job with the Wine selection, service is always on point, don't even let us ask for water :) , try the Mussels with smoky tomatoes, ask for extra bread, hear me on this one ;) , great atmosphere , I keep coming back here and bringing my friends, highly recommended if you are in the village
This restaurant looks beautiful and fancy inside. I highly recommend this place. Drinks are amazing. The food is very yummy... I will come back again.

Yesterday was the first time I went to The Warren. Â OMG! Â The food was amazing and the staff were all so attentive and friendly. Â I rarely visit the city but I would go again just to visit this wonderful place. Â Try it...you will be glad you did!

Had a fun time at the Warren. Food and drinks were great. The short rib poutine was awesome. Got super crowded around 8 pm so come early if you want a seat at the bar. Crowd is sort of different - seems like a mix of college kids and people who stop in on their way back to Jersey because the Path train is next door.

I had a great experience Â at The Warren , i just walked by the door i had a great welcoming from the manager or the owner called Dimitri, i really liked the feeling and the vibe to be here , than i asked his suggestion about the menu , i ordered a burger was delicious , just from passing by i feel the warrant its my hanging place , i always stoping by in my way home to have a bite or take advantage of there happy hour.

We dined at The Warren last night and it was an amazing experience! Â From the ambiance to the catering staff and the impeccable food, definitely a place to go back to! Â And the Warren punch is delish! Â Shout out to Edwin and Evie for the outstanding service and best of luck to Dimitri, the owner!

Next time someone is planning a birthday at your place, you may want to inform them that YOU DO NOT HAVE A HARD LIQUOR LICENSE yet. Â And as for the person handling events, I thought he was on the ball and thorough and responsive until the day came when I actually wanted to confirm all is set and I never heard back from him! Â It's really a terrible thing to do to someone on their birthday.

Came here for drinks this time. Just drinks. They were nice enough to let us in before the clock struck 4. It was a different experience from when we were there last because it was just drinks, but we had major success at enjoying our tasty drinks at the bar. We were relaxed and enjoying stimulating conversation, and at first, it was just us. Soon, the place started to fill up, and the volume went up, but by then, we were heading out to enjoy our next stop.

12 dollars for a bottle of sparking water. Â  bill was maybe 40% too high. Â we drank during happy hour. Â this place is the biggest ripoff I have ever had. Â the food was maybe 3 stars at best. Â you guys deserve to go out of business. Â  if the owner reads this fire the manager hr doesn't deserve to work. Â If you are the ones setting prices. Â please quit the restaurant business. Â you don't deserve to make money
Had an excellent meal here with friends. Food, service & atmosphere were terrific. Cool, trendy spot with good cocktails & friendly servers!

Only one server for the whole restaurant. Â He also bused the tables. Â Took forever to get our wine, another 20 mins. to get ice. Â EXTREMELY small portions. Â You may need a slice of pizza after dinner. Â One a' those joints, if ya know what I mean. Â Food was tasty but I had to finish my friend's steak after my scallops. Â Grateful she had a big lunch.

I read about this in some article and saw some awesome Yelp reviews, but showed up to an absolutely empty restaurant for brunch with friends one weekend. The brunch was fine but nothing special and they had no tea when my friend asked. Don't get it.
Food is good, and our waitress is amazon even she is super busy, she still taking care all the tables really well.
Checked out this spot this week. Great drinks and food. Â I recommend the fluke and poutine. Â The staff was very friendly and attentive. Definitely coming back here again.

This Warren is very warm and welcoming with soft lighting for a romantic date or a get together with friends. The cocktails are fun and creative. We all enjoyed the 'Warren Mule.' They also have a very nice wine selection for menu pairings. The food is delicious and the small plate options make it easy to try lots of different menu items. Everything was fresh and seasoned to perfection. Some of our choices were the oysters, fried chicken, brussels sprouts, Warren Burger and the best black kale Caesar salad ever! Definitely a cozy spot for great drinks and dinner. Looking forward to trying brunch soon!

This place is ok; a bit overpriced for what they offer. The food was really average, so I wouldn't go here again. Also, my boyfriend and I didn't like the $25 cancellation fee if not canceled at least 48 hours prior to reservation. Â Considering how unpredictable a night in Manhattan can be, this is a good reason for me to not make a reservation at this place again.
Good bar food esp the happy hour price. A little to tiny cozy place. Good selection of drinks as well. Will definitely do happy hour there again.

Well I had my first taste of The Warren tonight and I must say it won't be my last. Sampled four dishes tonight and I was not disappointed at all. From the lamb chops to the twice fried chicken it was amazing. Flavors were all over the dishes and then i was treated to the flatbread which was crisp, fresh and full of life (could eat this all day) Loved it and will have to come back for more. The venue itself is warm and inviting and has a "Cheers" type feel about it. Even a Norm and Cliff at the end of the bar. The staff are friendly and attentive and also were on point. Owners were very much about there customers which is rarely seen nowadays. Again Loved this will be back again!

I came here a about 2 weeks ago with my girlfriends and I absolutely loved loved loved it! From the moment you walk in you are greeted with such warmth and wonderful hospitality. The decor is homey and a great place to have an intimate date, drinks with your friends, and even rent it for private parties. The staff tends to your every need and are very attentive. The bartender (Sal I think) is so friendly and makes the best cocktails. The owner even came by our table several times to make sure we were content. The food was nothing but AMAZING! We had a lot of tapas and were able to try out many items from the menu. Everything on the menu has a bit of delicious twist that makes you want more of it. I personally am not an oyster eater because I have been let down so many times with the freshness and taste but I think I finished about the whole dozen. Their famous hamburger melts in your mouth as do the pork chops and the lamb chops. Everything was exceptionally fresh and you can tell that it was the highest quality of food that you were eating. This is definitely going to be my new spot and/or late night go to place. I highly recommend it and I have been in the restaurant business for 13 years. It's absolutely one if the best places I have been to in a very long time and a must try.
Great restaurant. Amazing Staff. Food is awesome, burger, oysters, and all the specials are terrific. Great place to meet people and have an amazing time.

Came in on a Sunday afternoon with my girlfriend for a few drinks. Really liked the atmosphere and the two female bartenders were very nice. The prices were more than fair. The one star review is due to what appeared to be the manager on duty. Fairly young, dark hair, bearded guy in a suit, looked the part. He single handily ruined our experience. No joke. It was slow, so he stood at the bar and talked to the two female bartenders the entire hour that we were there. The problem? He was so LOUD. A loud booming voice. And he's literally standing 5 feet from us, and 3 feet from the employees he was talking to. How did he have no sense of his own voice? I couldn't tell you. So loud it was hard for us to have a conversation. We literally looked at each other and were like, are you kidding me? On top of that he was dropping F bombs and swearing in his loud voice as well. As a manager myself, I was pretty taken aback by his unbelievable lack of common sense or professionalism. We literally cut our time there short solely because of this man. We will never be back. I hope ownership see's this review because my god, with this man running your place.... best of luck. What a turn off.

This review is for atmosphere and wine alone as I didn't eat here. Â The gruner on the BTG list is exquisite, balanced and super easy to drink. Â My friend had the Moscato and thought it was delightful. GREAT Happy hour deals. I came back the same day because I enjoyed it so much. Â Atmosphere, quality product, and excellent staff. Â I work near by and will probably make this a regular after work spot.also crazy close to the PATH train. I've found a new watering hole!

We went on Valentine's Day for the first time and loved it. Â The ambiance was lovely, intimate and cozy and the food was excellent. Â There was a lively bar scene. Â Though swamped on such a popular night, they made every effort to accommodate and offered free drinks any time there was any delay (which was rare, for instance we had to wait ten minutes past our reservation time, which for Manhattan, especially on V-Day is nothing). Â One could tell that they really cared about their customers. Â The shishito peppers, arugula salad, salmon with spinach, chicken, and sweet potato side were especially delicious. Â We'll definitely return.
been seated for an hour. no food. nice. wine on the house. Â OK. Â food will be nice. tick tock tick freakin tock.

The Warren is not only a great bar to meet up with your friends or colleagues for a few drinks, but it's also a fantastic place to have dinner with your significant other. The food and drinks are all beyond delicious. I would highly recommend the burger, steak, lamb chops, and twice fried chicken, but whatever you order will make sweet love to your taste buds. From the food and drinks to the lighting and decor, the atmosphere and staff at The Warren will keep you coming back again and again. I definitely highly recommend it!

Amazing twice fried Chicken Benedict! I couldn't help but finish the whole plate - my friend definitely eyed my plate with food envy. I stopped in here for lunch with a group of friends and everyone had a great meal complete with Warren Punch! We really enjoyed the ambiance and breeze from the open front window. Definitely recommend this new find in the city!
What a great spot! Right off the the path train, and our bartender Dimitri was great. Tried the warren punch and the foxy lady and both were excellent. Will absolutely be back to try the food.

Left a message for the manager to discuss the raw pork situation after my visit. Never heard anything back. Was willing to give the place a second chance, as the decor is cute and my partner, who got to eat his meal, looked like he had a good steak. Things happen, and you just acknowledge it and make it right. Â But no response. So, if the Warren isn't concerned with what they put on the plate, neither am I. What a shame. I always give places a second chance when it's warranted. But when a group of friends suggested we try the place out recently, I was more than happy to suggest we eat elsewhere. We ended up going for dinner at Westville, where the food was outstanding, and to the Dead Rabbit for drinks later, which was another winner.

We had a great experience at this restaurant. A party of 8 with many individual requirements. Part of our food came out late. They were kind enough to accommodate us with a round of free drinks. The food was amazing. The Atlantic Char is extremely crispy and moist. Overall, great food. Good wine recommendations, and a beautiful atmosphere. Thank you

Really? How did this place get such good reviews? We were here for my birthday celebration and I felt so bad for having my friends come here in 90+ degree weather with no A/C. It would have been OK if there was any outdoor seating. But no, we were placed in a sauna- like room with little ventilation. All of us were sweating like crazy, extremely uncomfortable but wanted to give this place a try. Â The food was sub par. The chicken paillard was a quite a let down. Â The twice fried chicken was too greasy for our taste. Mac and cheese was watery ( it is more like mac and cheese soup) Â but to be fair, it is flavorful. I would have given this place one star if it was not for the decent waitstaff. But honestly, I could not wait to get out of the restaurant and move on to a different place for drinks. Sorry, I do not recommend this place and will not return. There are too many good restaurants in NYC to waste your money and time here.

Stopped by for dinner at the Warren on a weeknight with a friend. We ordered the Flank Steak and the Chicken Paillard. The steak tasted great but was so small (5 bite sized pieces), it was practically an appetizer. The chicken was basically an inverted salad - 2 flat pieces of grilled chicken with some sort of white marinade, with romaine lettuce on top - it was awful. We ended up leaving and going to another restaurant to have a real dinner. Will not visit again.

Drinks and tiramisu were the best. Staff was excellent. the only suggestion i have is to please rinse out the greens better. there was quite a bit of sand in my octopus salad. i would try again, because the atmosphere was delightful.
The food is tops, both in quantity & quality. Â But the music is horrible and so loud it impairs conversation. Â Why not just Broadway show tunes--or (even better) silence, so people can converse?
We were seated in a cozy nook great for chatting and enjoyed nice wine, tasty burgers and decent brussel sprouts. Service and atmosphere were great. Would totally go back.

My boyfriend and I live just down the block from The Warren and we were so excited to see this place open. We had high hopes that this would be our new neighborhood spot. It did not disappoint! Amazing service, delicious burger and a great happy hour special. The octopus might literally be the best I've had in the city. Thanks, Dmitri! We will be back.

Only had drinks here so I can't comment on the food but the service was great and so was the atmosphere. Drinks were mixed well. Prices are typical for the area. Waiters checked on us frequently and were friendly. Good music as well.
New comfortable neighborhood spot with a pretty standard American menu. The oysters were fresh and my steak was cooked properly. Friendly and cute on the inside too.
Love this place.they are open pretty late.friendly stuff.highly recommended. Amazing happy hours deal for cocktails
LOVED the brunch menu! Â They were able to accommodate a party of 13 and the staff didn't miss a beat. Â Will go there the next time I am in the City.

Very intimate, pleasant spot. Loud at first, but the staff turned down the music and we were able to enjoy our food. Very good hamburgers with a good quality beef. Server was very friendly. The food took a while to come out....but was delicious and worth the wait.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
The food is really good. The portion is on the smaller side. Excellent service! Cute ambiance, Â good for brunch, lunch, or dinner.
No comment

Does not look (nor is it) fancy but the vibe was right, staff was cool (thank you Luis) and my nephew and I had a great time. Spicy feta app, grilled octopus, moussaka, and salmon platter just made for a delicious night. I've ordered from them on the past for take out, but being there was a great experience. Pictures are attached apologies but that spicy feta cane out first

This place was exactly what you need ! The service, the good and the ambiance was perfect. I sat at the bar while RUBEN was bartending and the drinks were perfect, strong but smooth. The music was good, and the food was good as well. Service is where it all starts and the whole team was smiles. If I lived in this neighborhood, this would be my neighborhood bar. I will definitely be returning ! Thanks for the hospitality Medusa, thanks to RICH as well.
Great food ! So delicious. Place and music wonderful. Thank you! I'm really recommending

We had put a reservation down for a party of 7, and they accommodated us accordingly even though it was last minute. A solid selection of appetizers. We ordered the Spanakopita and Zucchini Chips for appetizers. I went for the white fish which was phenomenal. Tad bit on the pricy side but the drinks are good, staff are nice, and the decor is modern and hip. Quiet Greek version of Miti Miti across the street (same owners). Will be back!
No comment
No comment

Last night we were celebrating a birthday of someone who needed to sit outside- they gave us a heated private patio! All of the food was outstanding! Almost everyone in our party had a food request/severe allergy , and our server handled it was care, precision, informed us of the ingredients and was able to give us veggies instead of bread- flying colors! Even my old-fashioned drink was divine!! We also had to split the check betwn 6 of us, and she cheerfully did so although it was quite complicated. We will all absolutely will be back here!
No comment

Decided to come back for more and brought the fiancÃ© and he loved it as much as I did! We ordered the Greek Mac and Cheese which was wonderful! We also got the Loukomades (Donut dessert), which is a fried donut hole with honey and walnuts. They were both very good and so much fun! Definitely a place to go to if you want something different!
I have no complaints. I came hungry and left full. My food and drink was good. The aestheic and layout was nice too.

Really liked this place. Went for lunch and had the lunch special with a friend. We both had gyros (me, chicken hers, lamb) that came with pita chips or a salad if I remember correctly. Carb-lovers we chose the pita chips. We also had the icy Aphrodite (frose) for drinks which were quite good. Servers were kind and attentive. Their decor was cute. Would go back for dinner.
Very fun and laid-back spot! Looove the design and theme! The food was delicious and the service was great. Would definitely come back for more

We came here by chance looking at the high reviews and decided to give this place a shot. Came here on a Thursday evening and there were about 3 tables occupied. We sat outside in the patio section and the service was very good. We ordered the Branzino and the Greek plate with a lot of different veggies, my favorite being the okra with a tomato sauce. The food was just alright- nothing spectacular but the server who was the bartender as well was very attentive and kind.

column3: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: The food and drinks here were really good. Â I really wanted to give this review 5 stars but had to knock one star because of the service. Â When we first got there we were able to choose any table to sit at. Â Then our server came over to tell us that happy hour was going to end in about 40 minutes so if we wanted to order we should. Â So we ordered a frosita and a sangrita. Â We waited about 10-15 minutes and still no drinks and it seemed like our server was preoccupied with something else that they had forgotten about us. Â Another table had come in and sat down and somehow ordered drinks and got their drinks which led us to then get the attention of the host to ask where our drinks were. Â They finally brought our drinks over but I don't think the drinks were correct. Â She handed me my drink and said margarita and I was like no is this the sangrita and she was like yes. I took a sip of it and it was definitely a margarita. I couldn't be bothered with asking for another one after already waiting 15 minutes for our drink order that they just pour from a slushy like machine. Â Maybe it was an off day as they seemed to have something going on - just wished that they were a bit more attentive.

We came for a late dinner on a Friday night and had a great experience. We got the pikilia (all 5 dips), the saganaki, and the octopus. Everything was delicious! The black truffle tarama was our favorite dip - unique and absolutely delicious. Their pita is also very good and fresh tasting. The saganaki was very tasty, though I do like when it's served very hot and soft, and that's not the case here. The octopus is good and it's a healthy serving size! Brandon and Nini were so friendly and pleasant. It was overall a great experience and we'll be back.

Delicious Greek food in a beautiful, hip, and capriciously decorated setting with great outdoor seating, close to Barclays, and open late late! We tried the dip sampler which comes with enough pita for two but enough dip for five! If you order just for two, be prepared to save the dips to slather all over your entree (which probably comes with more pita) or just get extra pita and have a dip feast! I was floored by the black truffle fish roe spread - I wish I had a huge jar of it at home to put on everything. Tzatziki was nice and thick, spicy feta was rich salty deliciousness, eggplant was fresh and smoky, and the beet hummus was light and sweet. For entrees we got the lamb platter and the salmon platter - I ordered my salmon rare and it came out perfectly. Sashimi quality in the middle! And it was a huge filet with a nice layer of skin. For sides, I preferred the spinach rice over the Brussels sprouts - it paired better with the meat and you get a delicious dill and feta salad on the side anyway so no need for more veg! Also shoutout to the pita which comes hot, soft, and doughy in the middle - could have made an entire meal off of it. Wonderful summer feasting.

Got take out from here last night and it was delicious! We ordered 2 American Lamb Gynos with sides of French fries. We didn't have to wait long either which was a plus. Our food was still warm and fresh by the time we got home - the French fries were so good! Looking forward to going back.

What a great place for a boozy brunch. The price was great. I had the $25 boozy brunch. I had the mimosa. There was such a variety of flavors. I had the passion fruit. I started off with the Grilled Halloumi Cheese. It was delicious. Â I then had the Greek Omelette with feta,vegetables and loukaniko pork. Â The food was great and so was the service. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because it didn't put me over the top to justify at least 4 stars. For me to give 4 stars it would have to impress me. This review is a bit complicated because it didn't come across as a totally Greek restaurant. It had a little Spanish flair to it. If you look at the menu it has Carne Asada gyro and platter, Lamb Empanadas and Sangria. All Hispanic dishes or descriptions. The food was decent not impressive. If you're going to be a certain ethnic food restaurant then be that all the way. It's like you have an identity crisis with what you're serving. I don't know if it's because they're trying to please too many people but if I go to a certain ethnic type of restaurant then I want to experience that ethnicity's food and no side tracking. Come to find out that the owner is the same owner of two other Hispanic restaurants in the same area. So I see where they get the influence from. If you're a Greek restaurant then keep it Greek. If you're a Colombian or Mexican restaurant then keep it totally Colombian or Mexican because that's what I am there for. To experience their native cuisine. The service was good and attentive, but again, the food didn't put me over the top like the Greek restaurants in Astoria. I just wish that I didn't have to go all the way to Astoria.
No comment
No comment

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: No comment
No comment
Have always loved this little spot on 5th Ave. good good and delicious drinks - worth your time!
Great food and great serviceHad a great lunch with my brother. Â  I will definitely be coming back.
No comment
Best Greek food in park slope. Food is always fresh and fairly quick. I would say it's worth the money, even if it's a tad overpriced.
No comment

If you're in the area, you must stop by here for dinner. We came here in a Sunday night and they seated us right away. The ambiance is casual but very playful. We ordered the Greek fries pastitsio (Greek baked pasta) and the lamb platter. I felt like I was eating from a green grandmother with the pasta, it was soo good. I ordered the frose with ouma. My first time tasting it and I would compare it to licorice that's slightly fruity. Overall a good experience, I'll be back
No comment
No comment
No comment
Fantastic on site catering and service by the Medusa team and Sean, more food than we could handle, great diversity and friendly staff! Highly recommend

Saw all the good reviews so i decided to try this place out for lunch. Â I am a huge fan of pastissio, this was just ok. Â I am not used to it not being in lasagna shape, this was more like a loose ziti dish. Â A bit on the bland side. Â For a lunch portion at the price I paid, i was expecting a side salad or pita with it.
No comment
No comment
Food was to die for and the service was even better! Hugo was amazing. He anticipated my every need and was super sweet. Definitely try the cocktails too!
No comment

The staff at Medusa are a pleasure and go above and beyond to make sure every meal is above their standards of quality. Alvaro was our favorite. He was so lovely and helped us chose the best selections for my party. (I'm very picky with my food!) Happy Hour discounts. Everything is freakin' delicious! Check it out and see Rich. Â The manager even made sure my party was happy, which is a rarity in Park Slope. Definitely check it out.

Medusa is a welcomed recent addition to the family! I already frequent Bogota and Miti Miti. In the height of the pandemic, I took my sister to Medusa to dine outdoors for her birthday which was amazing. On a whim, we decided to go back last night and it was perfect! Nini, our waitress, was amazing. She was SO sweet and gave the best recommendations. For food, we had the zucchini chips that came with an amazing tzatziki dip. In addition, my sister had the carne asada gyro ( Mini's recommendation) which was BOMB. I had the Hercules gyro, which contained American lamb, pork sausage, and chicken, and came with both marouli salad (so crisp, flavorful, and fresh) and fries. The meats were so well seasoned and balanced. For drinks, we got the mastiha mojito, Mr. Purple, blood orange margarita, lesvos + homos, and frosita. Ended the night with free shots as well!
Brandon our server was amazing. Brian the bartender makes great drinks. Highly recommend this place good ambiance and excellent service.
No comment
Kind staff, wonderful food! Whole table was very happy with their gyros. Cocktails also reliable.

Great food and lovely service. It's spacious so I felt like my friend and I could have privacy. My friend and I had the grilled octopus platter, and the massouka. Both very well seasoned and we didn't have to wait long for the food either. Coming back soon!
This is a great restaurant that is under appreciated. Â Food is excellent, the restaurant is gorgeous and service I outstanding. We love it and come here often and are never disappointed.

Stopped by with some friends for an early bird dinner. The waiters and waitresses were very nice and attentive. And the waiting time was reasonable as there were not as many customers at that time. The amount of their fries and vegetable salad was big enough for 3-4 people to share. My dish was salmon with spinach. I cannot judge if it's authentic or not, cause I am not very familiar with Greek food. To me, it's just OK but not impressive at all. I have also noticed that their menu is not vegetarian-friendly, as there was only one veggie dish (eggplant) available in the entrees.
No comment

I was looking for a quick pre comedy show dinner and I'm very happy I found this place. The service was great and very quick when we mentioned we were in a rush. The food was delicious. I'm a vegetarian and loved the halloumi gyro (with fries). They have happy hour all day during the week and we were happy to take advantage of that fun perk. Definitely would recommend for a casual dinner and some great Greek food.

This place was a delight. I am suprised how empty it was! The food was ok but the staff made our dinner amazing. Nini and Brandon made sure oir drinks were exactly what we wanted and brought our food oit in a timely fashion. I would definately come her again

This place was so good! The food and service amazing. Will definitely be back! Came here with my father and sister and we were in love. We got the authentic greek salad to start and the dip sampler! We were full just off that!! If you like truffle, the truffle hummus will make make your taste buds dance. We also got the half roasted lemon chicken, pork platter and lamb platter. So so much food and flavor. We had left overs enough to feed us again the next day!!
Unbelievable time here tonight. Great local crowd, fresh and delicious food, refreshing well-poured drinks, and unbelievable service. I believe we had Brandon - what a guy!

Came here for brunch with the family and had an amazing time. From the start our hostess was very friendly and accommodating. Let's us move our table outside since it was so nice out and was easier to get a proper seat for the baby joining us. Drinks were solid for a brunch spot everything you'd ordinarily expect and done well. The dip sampler is great for a group good with sharing. A lot larger portion than I had expected so plenty for everyone. Fresh crudite and pita to dip with, we ordered extra cause it was so good. Personal favorites was the spicy feta and was pleasantly surprised by the black truffle Tamara. I normally don't like truffle but this was subtle enough to not overpower the tastebuds. My only complaint is I wish they had just a regular hummus as not everyone is a fan of beets and the flavor can be a bit much. For a main I went with the brunch gyro and loved it. So much flavor, and was able to use some of the remaining spreads to create some delicious unique bites along the way. Sooooo much food though. Will be back for sure.
No comment

I placed an order through a food delivery app for pick up. Food was ready upon arrival. Ordered the moussaka and the squid ink truffle infused dip with a side of pita and crudite which came with a small side of greek salad in two separate containers. The moussaka was underwhelming. The layer of bechamel was thin and lacked a depth of flavor and heartiness I expected. The squid ink infused truffle dip was tasty and I would have appreciated a bit more texture. It was well infused with truffle and the pita was a good pairing to that. The reason for the rather low rating is due to finding mold on the tomato that came with the salad. It was a big turn off and I could not help but double check and wonder about the food quality for the rest of meal. Really hoping it was an off day. I will not return.

Love this place- Brian the bartender is THAT. GUY. He makes great drinks and especially delicious shots that are exactly what you want-the right amount of alcohol to make a shit worth it, none of that wincing from a harsh plain spirit. The drinks are fire and the food is also great. Maybe surprisingly, the fries are top tier here

Nice spot. Good date spot. Good service. Food was tasty. Greek food was good. Need more vegan options as far as protein, but the sides were amazing. I particularly liked the spinach rice. This place was clean and neat. Very nice spot to grab a bite and converse.

Nene and Brandon!!! They are the best!!!! Seriously the food here is the best! Great customer service! We were checked up on several times and taken care of in the best way! Thank you so much for the best service
No comment
Great food, fantastic service, and a relaxed vibe. Will certainly be back very soon.
We stopped by for a drink here and the vibe was amazing! Brian, the bartender, was fantastic and the drinks were sophisticated and delicious! Highly recommend! We will definitely be back!

Went here on a Friday night & ordered the hot aphrodite and fried calamari. Both hit the spot. I had my dog with me & there was plenty of outdoor seating. Glad that the weather was great. Check them out for all day happy hour. You won't regret getting one of their drinks! Also, the fried calamari was fried to perfection & seasoned perfectly.

Amazing food, like really amazing fresh food, but the service was terrible. Food took 40 mins to come out, And we specifically asked for the app to come out first, but everything was brought to us at once. I had to ask for our waters to be refilled and for my margarita, as I saw it sitting on the bar counter for over 10 mins after it was made. The bartender was sweet she tried to step in, but our server wasn't attentive at all. Only time he came to us was to take our order. The other servers were attending their tables frequently yet we were neglected the entire time. Not sure what the reason was, maybe inexperience? Either way, very disappointing as the food was great. Not sure if I would dine in again.
No comment

Brandon was our sever and the food was absolutely amazing! Service was phenomenal and the vibes immaculate. We found this place a few months on Instagram and have been dying to go. Quick service, great portions and such friendly staff. Be sure to ask for Brandon! Well definitely be back as soon as we're in town again!

This place is fabulous and you'll love it's the fish is to die for and such good portions. Hugo the waiter and bartender is the sweetest. He knows the menu so well and always knows what to suggest. The rest of the staff is so nice too. Great meals here! I get the branzino. You'll love it.

Medusa was a choice made because my wife and I enjoy great GREEK CUISINE which I assure you this WAS NOT IT I ordered the branzino which btw is one my favorite fish and she ordered the baby lamb chops medium well. My branzino was tough the capers were old her lamb chops were served medium rare we had to send it back to be cooked more well to make a long story short I have been sick ever since I left the restaurant that was this past Wednesday evening it's now Saturday I'm starting to feel better. I definitely will not give these guys a second chance. I'm sorry.
Nene and Brandon were amazing! we are definitely coming back. Food here is amazing, great service, and overall great experiences! Checked in with us and was a friendly environment!
I went here for the first time with my family for my birthday and we all loved it! It is a really cool atmosphere with great Greek Food! I highly recommend it!

We loved this Park Slope find! It's got an eclectic, colorful decor, a delicious Medusa Brunch Burger filled with things I've never had on a burger before--including tomato jam made in-house--a killer spanakopita, and decadent, spongey Nutella loukoumades baby donuts. Not to mention, great service sitting at the bar with Brandon! Will definitely be back next time we're in the area.
No comment
The sampler of dips was delicious. The salmon was very flavor and perfectly cooked. The gyro platter was disappointing but the gyro wrap was good, although definitely need to order extra tzatziki.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We love Medusa!!! Not only is it a fun atmosphere, but the food & drinks are delicious and the staff is wonderful! When you go make sure to ask for Nini and go visit Brandon & Bryan at the bar. The gyros are delicious and although I always say I'll branch out and try something new, I can never stray from them. Looking forward to the warmer weather when they open the windows and bring tables out to the streets! It's the perfect spot for a night out or a fun brunch!!

Seconds after entering Medusa's doors after midnight on a random Thursday night, it was absolutely clear that we had made the right choice! The wonderful smells quickly transported us to another realm! Brian, our waiter and bartender greeted us with enthusiasm... and upon our request, he quickly and skillfully crafted signature cocktails using our spirits of choice. He was great with casual banter and helped us make our appetizer and entree selections which where all out of this world!!! The stuffed grape leaves are served warm, and although I didn't ask to confirm, their texture and flavor gave off homemade vibes; absolutely no words for the grilled octopus! Absolutely melt in your mouth tender and well-balanced flavors. On to my entree, a classic mousaka which was nothing short of mind-blowing, wonderful presentation, fresh ingredients, and layers of blissful complexity! Bravo to everyone at Medusa for creating such an aesthetically pleasing space to compliment our spectacular meal... thank you, Brian for attending to us so well! We look forward to returning soon!!! A+++

The food is amazing, and as a Greek person, that's saying a lot. Our server Marco made sure we had a great experience. It was such a blast!

Great spot for dinner, delicious food and drinks, not too busy. The server, Hugo was very accommodating! I'll be back for brunch.

My partner and I had dinner here on a few occasions. The food here is excellent, and Hugo ensured they accommodated our low carb diet. In an area with plenty of food options, this place really sticks out in a good way. We're looking forward to eating here again soon!
No comment

Friday evening we decided to head over to Park Slope Brooklyn , our "go-to" neighborhood for great eats! This night we actually let Yelp reviews determine were we would dine. We knew we wanted Greek food. Medusa Greek Taverna Turned out to be an excellent choice. Greeted with a warm friendly smile , seated right away our Server Mariah introduced herself . Such a lovely person. The atmosphere was Chic, Cozy, Comfortable , and Classy! Started off with a White Sangria for me, and my boyfriend had frozen Sangria, OMG both yummy! Not starving, but looking for a lighter choice on the menu. We ordered Grilled Octopus with a bean paste that was "OFF THE CHAIN" delicious, Fresh beet salad with goat cheese, Fried Calamari, Greek Olives . Everything was so delicious, definitely recommend this place. 5 stars ***** Cant wait to return. Thanks for a great meal. M & J

We came here on a Saturday night and it was not too crowded with outdoor seating available. Â We ordered the pikilia (sampling of five dips- highly recommend!), spanakopita, grilled octopus (delicious but small portion), mac and cheese with orzo (flavorful but wasn't a huge fan) and the lobster gyro. Â Service was attentive and food came promptly. Â Most portions were big and we left the restaurant pretty satisfied.

Absolutely phenomenal Greek food. Everything was super fresh and the service was great as well. We Â had octopus and rotators. The octopus s was chaired to perfections and the potatoes and a delicious dressing. The village salad was fresh and very well dressed. The short rib melted in our mouth and deserts we had the custard Â pie made to order was everything. These are the same owners as Miti Â Miti and Bogata. The next restaurant should be Italian bc they just do everything so good.

The hospitality from the staff here is so incredible. They are truly great people trying to offer you the best dining experience you can ask for. The food was incredible and even though I barely venture to Park Slope area this is such a cute spot in a prime area with extremely tasty dishes. My host George was such a gem as well. He was very attentive, not only to myself but everyone he came in contact with. They do have both an indoor and dining area but I preferred sitting inside because even the decor and vibe felt overall amazing. I would definitely be back for some gyros and a quick bite when I'm in the mood for great Greek cuisine!
Insanely good food, fair prices, large portions. This is the second time I've been here and I can't wait to go back. George, the incredible waiter who took care of my friend and I, is the bomb.

Amazing food. Amazing drinks. Fantastic service. The food is always fresh and Marco provided phenomenal and friendly service. Can't wait to come again. Thank you Marco
I was disappointed with the chicken platter. Â I ordered Horta which I thought were the Lima beans bit ended up being the spinach. The platter for $23 was really sad.
Love the Greek frappe. So far we had small plates and it was all good. We also ate outside which made us fell safe.
was starving late night in the neighborhood and stumbled on Medusa, so good!! Brian was an amazing server. Definitely recommend!

My husband and I have been trying to get here since they opened but due to covid we were it's been hard. Finally made it out and Mark made our experience worth the trip out from queens. I highly recommend this restaurant. We started off with a few spreads and grilled octopus ( the grilled octopus is a must), we then couldn't decide what we wanted for our mains so we order 3 different ones, lemon chicken was so good and the with a strong but not overwhelmingly taste of lemon, I will be coming back for this dish. We also got the braised lamb platter as well as an order of baby lamb chops which were cooked to perfection. I highly recommend a meal here and hopefully you get to have Mark as your server, he was nice, friendly and very approachable.
Great, flavorful Greek food that is cooked perfectly! Couple this with an upbeat ambiance, and you e got a winning combination. All very authentic and delicious.

Came into Medusa, had a great time. Tapas were delicious. Bartender Brandon was super knowledgeable. Ended up sitting at the bar with Carolyn from Â Miti their sister francise, shes amazing. Â So much fun. Â Come hang out with these guys at Miti and Medusa.
Had dinner with my girlfriend yesterday. Staffs were very friendly and food was delicious. We will definitely come back!
Great spot to eat! a highly recommend the zucchini chips (they were phenomenal). Brian was a fantastic server and was basically running the place. My fiancÃ©e thought he was easy on the eyes.

Nini was our server and she was amazing. The food was AMAZING and overall we were happy with our food. I got the octopus platter! I ate every bite. The brussel spouts were to die for. Also, the drinks? Please get ourself one. I had the cucumber jalapeÃ±o margarita and yeah...top tier. But back to Nini, she is the best!!!

I love authentic Greek food and decided to try Medusa when in Brooklyn for a few days. Our waitress Nini was also greeting customers at the door and her service was outstanding throughout the experience. She added her personal touch by taking time to converse with us and make menu recommendations when asked. The octopus appetizer was excellent, prepared well and served with gabs purÃ©e and capers. We did not have entrees but the brussel sprout salad was sufficient for a meal, and adding grilled shrimp made it over the top. Take a look at the description in the menu and you'll see what I mean. My son had the grilled chicken gyro with very good pita bread. It's a small place and I enthusiastically recommend it. The menu selections include a number of authentic Greek dishes. I will return to Medusa to try more.
The atmosphere is so much fun, and the food and drinks are amazing. Really enjoyed the vibe! I sat at the bar, and the service was great. Our server Brandon was extra attentive and hospitable!
Such a pleasant surprise. Amazing food and great service. Such a gem. Will definitely come back.

Could not recommend this place more. Food is delicious, service was quick. Hugo is awesome. I had the brunch burger. You must get the lemon potatoes. It was relaxed when we went on a Sunday afternoon, but they also have bottomless brunch if you're trying to party! Go now!

I was recommended Froze' by a local barkeep, i was weary. Meet a group of 4, sitting for brunch I had the lamb gyro and grilled octopus with my right hand. Outdoor service but we have to adjust. We enjoyed rounds of rainbows drinks and i forgot where I was. It was awesome and the bartender Wes was a solid. Would recommend to anyone visiting the slope. If you're up for a great afternoon, cheers, great ambiance and a break from the gentrification. Stay free my people.

Absolutely LOVED this neighborhood Greek place. The Happy Hour wine special is unreal ($8 a glass), the food is delicious, and the portions are big! The team is also so kind - Taylor and Lenie were awesome. Will definitely be back!!
Love the food! The wait time for the food definitely needs some work. But it's good solid food and the atmosphere is good, esp for brunch.
Absolutely delicious Greek restaurant in the neighborhood, with wonderful hospitality! My very Greek boyfriend approves.
The baklava was ridiculous. Â Who knew sausages and yoghurt could be so good. Â Very friendly staff.
Amazing food! They seem to prepare everything from scratch, and the output is beyond what I expect. I go for the spanakopita each time I visit. 5 stars for it!
No comment

Extremely disappointing meal. Â Greek salad was tired, tasteless and small (and didn't even come with warm pita like most other places), fries were mushy and cold, and spanakopita was greasy and flavorless. Â  Absolutely terrible.
Came here to get some birthday drinks and Apps. Nini and Hugo took care of our group! Truly a great place! They'll take care of you! A++++++

The food was amazing, so great to find this restaurant in my neighborhood with authentic food. The service was top tier, we were served by Nini and she was so attentive and knowledgeable! She recommended our meals, and we all enjoyed them. Can't rave enough about the food AND service!!!
SO YUMMYYY and amazing service. Get the platter and thank me later :) BRUSSELS SPROUTS TOOO. So unbelievable and friendly staff

Amazing spot with great food and ambience. We ordered the zucchini chips, grilled octopus and the grilled shrimps as the appetizers. The seafood was fresh and well seasoned and the zucchini chips were fried light and crispy. It was not greasy at all! For entrees, we ordered lamb chops and the branzino. They were cooked perfectly and even the sides were delicious. Overall, I love the food but we also love the service. Everyone greeted us with a warm welcome and we were lucky to have Brandon as our waiter. Great service. Highly recommend.
No comment

Without a reservation, we waited about 30 minutes to be seated on a busy Saturday night. Well worth the Â wait. We all (4) shared the Village Salad, so fresh with great dressing. I ordered the Spanikopita, great Phylo crust. My husband ordered 1/2 roasted chicken, great portion size Â and tasty. My DIL ordered okra and sardines, she loved it Â  My son ordered short ribs with orzo. His was delicious but disappointed with the size of the meat, about 2" square, lots of orzo. We also shared the Greek fries, Â really good. With Three alcoholic drinks, total was $175 with tip. Rather pricey but we would r
Such a great find! Good food and service! Pita chips with the eggplant dip were my fave and the waiter Hugo was so sweet! Definitely will be back.

Best gyro in the area. Meat is never dry. Not that cheap tasteless stuff you get at some Greek places. They care about their food. Fresh ingredients and a solid menu. Cool vibe at the storefront and also strong on delivery. If you want Greek this is a good bet. Also recommended the spanakopita, the dips(some are better than others I could do without the favs dip) moussaka, pastitsio. One note I love the fried zucchini chips but I have had some times where it is too salty and not as crisp. When they nail it it's amazing! They could work on consistency, that being said it's always still pretty tasty.

Loved this new gem in park slope! I am vegetarian and found so many veggie/vegan options that I was blown away. Definitely recommend the zucchini chips. Would so return to try the 5 spread sampler; looked very enticing. Our server Mark was very courteous in the recommendations and went above and beyond to make sure we were pleased and catered to. Since I made a reservation we were given a nice seating. I loved the geek vibe and touch all over from the medusa at the entrance to the Greek statue models on the ceilings and the blue clean crisp bar setting etc. entire staff was attentive. The vegan baklava in the end was so yummy, packed 1 to go as well. The mocktail list is very interesting. I enjoyed the Trojan horse which had a smoky taste to it. Can't wait to return!
The food smelt so deli from the street it drew me in. It truly lived up to my expectation. The food was delicious! Hugo was just fantastic offering wonder suggestion.
The waitstaff (Hugo) as well as the food was exemplary. Each and every plate was delicious and the waitstaff were friendly and knowledge about the menu. The prices were so reasonable too!!

This place is absolutely insane! It is the new sister restaurant of miti miti, where I have been going for years. I had a feeling this place wouldn't disappoint. From the staff, to the food, everything was a great experience. It's extremely fresh and everything was delicious from the appetizers to the dessert; the octopus literally melts in your mouth. I will definitely be back

Ok, we came across this restaurant searching for greek Â  food. So we decided to come here and let me tell you!!!!!!!!!!! Â Everything I oerderd was cooked to perfection, the grilled octopus the lamb chops, the fish , the bread, the drinks everything was sooooooooo good which is hard for me to find. And the server Brandon was so attentive and accommodating We loved him. I will FOR SURE be back again. 10 starts for me. Oh and very clean as well.

Excellent and creative drinks, awesome service!! Try Toula that bitch was the best drink I've had in a long time.carolyn from miti who is a server at the sister restaurant shes amazing Â come over and enjoy it time have great service with nene eric and brandon a place too u Â can call home
Marko and Ninni were amazing hosts and the food was amazing! Â  Lovely new restaurant!

Loved the food- had the moussaka, lamb gyro, and pikilia and greek mojito. Nice big servings and flavorful food. Brandon was our server super friendly provided great customer service. Would dine here again!

Get the zucchini chips! This place is so tasty and the portion sizes are great. I got the lemon chicken and my mom got the eggplant dish. Both were incredibly tasty. All of the desserts are made in house. Go here.

This place is a tucked away spot that is definitely worth a visit. I loved everything that we ordered, so it's really hard to pick just one thing. The hot Aphrodite, the Pikilia spread, the Okras, and the Spanakopita were amazing. Great service as well. If you are looking for authentic Greek, you don't need to look further than this gem.

Drinks are good but the food is not authentic Greek at all. Microwaved block of cheese instead of flamed saganaki, no traditional Greek wines. The waitress was sweet but she couldn't even pronounce the Greek entree names. Plus they kept the lights on as bright as a diner; definitely not conducive to a relaxing evening.

I was fortunate enough to be invited to a private tasting of this new restaurant through a friend and I must say they perfected the octopus appetizer the restaurant decor has you feeling like you are in a restaurant in Greece. The bar section of the restaurant is a great size to just go out with a few friends for drinks and apps by the bar. The mocktails are a must!!!! Try them all!
Delicious and fun! Went there for a friend's birthday dinner- our server, Marco was super attentive and made the evening special, along with the whole staff! Thank you!!

Got delivery a couple of times from here and it hasn't been great. Today I ordered a couple of gyros - both were totally soggy / left the bread inedible. I think you guys should really pack the bread separately. Also the salad that came with the gyro was truly just a pile of shredded lettuce with a sprig of dill in it. Hardly a salad. The lamb was tender / tasty. This place might just be better if you go in person.

We were looking for some yummy Greek food at a place that was COVID-safe with good vibes and Medusa was perfect!!! The dining out front was very warm and ventilated. The food was fabulous, as were the all day happy hour deals. Our waiter had great energy that made us feel so welcomed. Wow- we will be back soon!!!

Enjoyed a delicious meal and appetizers. The drinks are really great! Our waiter George was very friendly and provided wonderful service. The restaurant interior was very inviting and they took every precaution in regards to spacing and cleanliness. Can't wait to go back!

Came here with my friend for lunch, very nice ambiance super clean. Â George the waiter was super nice, attentive, it was my friend first time having Greek food, Â George took his time and explained few nice options. The food was delicious, portions are filling, we ordered zucchini chips was so good, spinach spanakopita, we also had desert and Greek coffee. This is my 2nd time here and I had very good experience

This spot has a great service team, especially our server George! He recommended excellent wines and food. The octopus, shrimp and lamb is on point! When we had a small issue with the cook on the salmon George took care of it right away and everything else we had was perfect!

Ordered delivery of gyro and baklava - fast delivery and delicious wrap. The fries on the other hand were ... well not good. Definitely will order from them again.

Went here last night with my boyfriend for a Saturday date night. Was waited on by a wonderful, well informed, very attentive waiter named George. Excellent food, excellent service and fantastic Greek wine George was happy to tell me about. Going to make this my go to date night place!

Came here for a bday dinner, and had an amazing experience! Our server was dynamic! We requested they play BeyoncÃ©'s Coachella album, and they kept it on BeyoncÃ© for the entire evening. When Spotify switched in an R Kelly song, they immediately changed the song, showing that not only was the food and service great, but that the staff is conscious. The food is GREAT! Definitely get the lamb platter if you come here.

I wish i could give it more stars! We had a great time there with friends. You can order just about anything on the menu and not be disappointed -- it's all very good. My waitress was super friendly, very fast and my food was pretty darn good. I am a fan!

Awesome place with great food. Â Seems to be an addition to Bogota and Miti Miti which are so tasty. Staff is super responsible with COVID precautions, we had George whose food suggestions and drinks were spot on and he was very nice. Spanakopita was perfect and the icy Aphrodite goes down real nice!

Stopped in for an early dinner and was pleasantly surprised with a wonderful dinner consisting of the sampling of spreads with pita. The feta and pepper spread being at the top of the 5 served, but they were all delicious (eggplant, pea, fish, tzatziki were main ingredients in the other 4). Greek village salad, which we ate along with the apps: Nice dressing, well presented and tasty. Chocolate mousse for dessert to share (as it's big) and coffee. I also enjoyed a mocktail. Wait staff were very polite and considerate. New restaurant sparkle. Worth a visit.

I went here on 4-7-21 with my girlfriend and the brussels sprouts were the best brussels sprouts I have ever tasted. It had the perfect amount of crips and a tiny touch of sweet... so tasty. The beet hummus was also impeccable and the margarita was spot on. The best part of this spot was the service. A young man with long black hair served us and he was truly pleasant and helpful and kind.

Horrible service. I don't know how this place is operating. Not professional at all. I ordered food from them for two people and Â for the price I paid for, the portions were tiny. I called them and they said they would take care of me. I went in today to meet with the "manager" and they didn't want to do anything about it and barely would match the amount I spend. The front cashier guy was rude and told me he can't help me because they are busy. After speaking with the manager arif , they finally gave me some food complimentary. They were very rude and they even left the food outside on the floor for me like I'm a piece of a dog and told me to pick it up. SMH.We all want to support small businesses but not these kind. Don't waste your time but head over to greek xpress near prospect park. Never going back here ever again.
