I heard that a new Greek restaurant opened not far from Barclay's so I decided to give it a try. Medusa is small attractive restaurant that has a lot of potential. I did not have my gf with me so I opted to dine at the bar. First problem is that the bar stools do not have a back's and are very uncomfortable. The second problem is that they do not have a winter awning, and every time Â that the door opened I got blast of cold air. The staff are very hip, but not very experienced. Now to the food. Tzatziki sauce is good, not great. Mussel's were very good, and the Octopus was tender, but not very fresh. Lastly, The bathroom's do not have hot water, and I washed my hand's with ice cold water. I will return once the weather get's warm, and post another review.

came to medusa for a second time and had an amazing time the food was on point and service was on point i sat at the bar where i met carolyn from miti miti the sister restaurant and she was amazing told me all about the boozy brunch she was very welcoming i will definitely make a stop in to visit her great businesses

Ordered in for delivery on a whim and was very pleasantly surprised. The chicken with potatoes was incredible. So were the Greek meatballs. I will definitely order again. I almost gave a 4 star review because we ordered through Caviar and they suck, super high fees and they actually delivered to the wrong address and didn't even attempt to get it to us. Since that's not the restaurants fault I don't feel it's fair to discredit them I will never use Caviar again however.

LOVE this place. We have eaten in and also ordered delivery and both experiences were great. The food is amazing and the service is thoughtful. When there was a mixup with our order, they called right away and got it sorted out. Thank you!!!!
B. E. S. T. authentic Greek food I've ever had! Â The salads were so fresh and tasty! Â The calamari was so fresh and crispy! Â The lemon potatoes are the best ever!

Food is superb. I ordered a Greek omelette with Greek cheese fries, and wow!! Pretty much restaurant heaven for anyone who likes a good vibe, awesome people and delicious food. Will definitely be going back!
Best Greek in the area for sure! Delicious and strong frozes! Fresh salads and love the chicken gyro. Gotta also get the baklava mmm

This might have been the best octopus I've ever had. The waiter George was so sweet and as a Greek family my mother and I loved that he spoke Greek and lived there for a little as-well. He was so sweet and made great cocktails also. The food was amazing and they have outdoor seating all COVID friendly with heating and what not. The best Greek place in the neighborhood.

Hi! I am new to Yelp just created it a few days ago and have officially joined the help team. Not sure if any bios was owners will respond because I didn't see many responses on the page. You guys should be more active. I live in park slope and often find myself passing by places that seem so nice, but never have the time to sit and eat at them. I was passing by the other day and decided to come and eat some lamb chops. I was greeted by Juan and Lillian. (Both great people by the way.) Lillian was my waitress and was very attentive and nice. She was able to answer all my questions and trust me I had a lot. I ate the Lavraki which was so good. The one star was taken off for the wait time because I ended up waiting around 40 minutes for my food. When the waitress told me it would take longer for it to cook I didn't expect to be waiting there for 40 minutes. I then ate the chocolate mousse which was okay. I wish it was served colder and was a more lighter and creamy texture. As for the lavraki it was great. Definitely worth the wait. I really love the service here. I can't wait to come back. I' definitely will ask for Lillian or Juan again thank you guys!

My partner and I had a great experience with outdoor dining at Medusa tonight. The heat lamps are perfectly positioned for maximum warmth. I highly recommend the Figalicious cocktail, a fun twist on an old fashioned with fig jam, and the Medusa Burger, which had an insane tomato jam. What can I say, this place knows its jams! To top it off, our server George had such a joyful and positive energy. Loved it.

Honestly I go to a lot of Greek restaurants and this one was just great!! It doesn't look like anything much from the outside but inside it's super cute, has a very chic vibe and the food was excellent. Every dish we ordered was perfectly seasoned. The lamb chops very just excellent and a good large portion. The zucchini chips are a must. We were served by Mark and he was a phenomenal waiter and host. He was professional and attentive and always willing to go above and beyond. Thanks Medusa for a wonderful Greek surprise in park slope.
Good service. Unfortunately the food is subpar, the branzino we had was dry and moussaka was a strange sweet taste.
Good flavors love the Medusa sauce but $15/$16 for Gyro is a bit too pricy for me. Â Would go back for a more fine and dine type meal however where such a price point would make sense.

Got the zucchini chips, lamb gyro with fries, and baklava. All delicious, the zucchini chips being my favorite (seriously could not stop eating them). Also, our waiter, Ari, was great and created an awesome vibe while we were there.
Fantastic restaurant the food was delicious and the staff was active I would recommend this restaurant to my friends,the food quality was superb I would look forward to come here again

BEST NEW RESTAURANT IN BROOKLYN. This place is absolutely divine. The chef came out and greeted every table and we couldn't help but talk his ear off about how incredible the food was. The short rib with orzo was out of this world!!
Food was delicious and platters were huge! Brandon was friendly and accommodating :) We opted for indoor dining and felt very safe!

Celebrating the New Year with another delicious take-out from Medusa Taverna. We ordered items we had not yet tasted, (octopus, spanakopita, moussaka, okra, zucchini chips, baklava) in addition to their wonderful spreads and salads. We have enough for 3 meals! The portions are substantial. The octopus was divine. Â Spanakopita was so light and fluffy. Â Marvelous. Loved the zucchini chips. Warmed them in the oven. The other food remained hot. The packaging is top-notch. Everything in its own little tight-fitting container. Nothing leaked. So fortunate to live within 15 minutes of this superb restaurant. Truly authentic Greek food!

This place is amazing. Good food. Great for sharing with a bunch of friends on a cold rainy evening. Our server George was quite nice as well and very knowledgeable in helping us plan our evening. Really recommend if your itching for Greek or even more so just some good pita spreads and meats!

Best restaurant I've been to in a long time. Went to Greece about two years ago and since COVID I thought I would never experience the food again...I was wrong. Medusa has the best AUTHENTIC Greek food you can find. Only thing that compares to the food is the service. Again, having been to Greece the people there were so welcoming of tourist. The staff and owners of were so kind and generous. You have to go to this restaurant. Order take out and make a night of it. Once restrictions are lifted we are bringing our parents here. Best food in BK!!
Fabulous Greek food (don't miss the stuffed grape leaves) and terrific service. Ask for George; he's the best!

I ordered my beloved pastichio and couldn't even finish it. I've never tasted a pastichio that doesn't even resemble at all in taste, what the actual dish tastes like. Everything was unseasoned making the meat taste very unappetizing and the dish bland. My stomach feels sick thinking about the taste of the food. There were NO spices used. I'm so disappointed. The leftovers went to my dog.
We had a really good experience here! The customer service is wonderful! Highly recommend the leg of lamb platter with the bird del sprouts!

Excellent spot with great service! Outdoor dining is nicely set up and servers are all observing safety procedures. Loved the zucchini chips, grape leaves, meatballs, and brussel sprouts. Our server George was fantastic!

I ate there yesterday for lunch for my cousins birthday and everything was absolutely delicious. We had the assorted dips, calamari, Greek salad and fried cheese to start and then the delicious octopus and chicken for entrees. Yummy cocktails as well and our server George was super attentive, knowledgeable and sweet. Overall we had a great afternoon with great food and service. Thanks!

I have always enjoyed my delivery food from Medusa Greek Taverna before, but last night my food was so nearly inedible that I'm still mad at myself for eating as much as I did. Â  I have never ordered the moussaka from them before but I was really looking forward to it. What arrived was a takeout dish of lots of lukewarm potatoes, a small amount of Â ground lamb and a few oversized slices of eggplant topped with an entirely loose unset bÃ©chamel slopping over the sides. Â No spice, sauce or even salt, . Â  It was easily the worst moussaka I've ever had. Â It seemed like they didn't actually have any moussaka when I ordered it and they just threw some ingredients in a tub and hoped for the best. Â The Horta tasted a bit rancid as if it had been cooked in oil that was not fresh. I couldn't eat more than a bite of it. The meals redeeming feature was the Greek yogurt topped with cherries which was delicious as always. I don't know what happened to this restaurant, but this was severely disappointing. Desperately need a good Greek restaurant around here.

This place is great. Â Ordered delivery and everything was dynamite. Â We got one of the family combination dinners with the chicken and pastichio and the lemon chicken. Â  It reads as pricey but this was a very good deal. Â Will become our Greek go to in the area.
As frequent travelers to Greece and lovers of Greek food, this was not Greek food.... it was disgusting and inedible though. And directly went into the trash. Time to order pizza....

At the end of a day when the whole shelter at home thing was really getting me down, I really really really wanted to try a new restaurant. I found Medusa Greek Taverna on Caviar. And I'm so glad I did. The food was DELICIOUS! And delivered far faster than estimated. The halloumi gyro was exactly the comfort food I needed. And the sampler of dips was so flavorful. So happy I have leftovers of all of them to keep enjoying. The food reminded of food I ate at tavernas in Athens. I'll be ordering from Medusa again, and can't wait until I can visit in person.

Great 1st experience, from beginning to end. Â Cool vibe, welcoming door staff, good cocktails, terrific server (Andrew), great food...we'll be back. Â Only thing to keep an eye on is that there's some overlap in the dishes (ie zucchini chips contain tzatziki...so, don't also order tzatziki). Â We'll be back
Great unhurried service, good food, nice vibe. A great option in the Slope. I will be back.

Had a DELICIOUS meal here, super creative menu building on all Greek classics I know and love. Â Ambiance and staff are great. Â Spread sampler was a great way to start off, the Zuchinni Chips were amazing, Cypriot Halloumi dish incredible, Fish Plaki, Tsipoura, and Steak entrees were all excellent. Â Will definitely be back soon.
Really delicious food (best Greek salad I've ever had) and amazing service. Highly recommend!

Delicious, delicious, and this is from a Greek American...the food was totally authentic and the standouts were the avgolemono (egg lemon) soup, the pasticio, and truly everything we had was fantastic. This is going to be our regular go-to!

Unfortunately, the crab soup dumplings and regular soup dumplings lacked the same light dumpling wrapper and filling we remembered. The soup inside also had more fat renderings than I'd like. The restaurant was renovated but unfortunately the meal lacked luster this time around. Service was fine. Cash only to avoid credit card charges, plus an automatic 18% gratuity is included.

Other entrees are good too, not great or standing out but not bad. My qualm is that all the soup dumplings contain pork. They don't have any with chicken beef or just seafood.

He brought us a lo mein style dish with allllll sorts of seafood including lobster. It was the best surprise. Good prices too !

Came here on a weekend for dinner. There was a long line, but I appreciated that the workers kept things moving so we didn't have to wait too long (maybe ~20 minutes for a table for 2). The process of getting a table may not be intuitive, but you have to go in the restaurant to check-in with a worker, who'll give you a number. They'll call out the number when a table for your party is ready so you'll need to stay close to the restaurant while waiting. The menu is pretty extensive. We tried the pork soup dumplings and fried rice cakes - both were delicious, prices were reasonable, and service was fast.

Extremely overrated. We're from San Francisco where excellent Chinese Restaurants are a plenty. The dishes were okay, but nothing stood out. Maybe we should have ordered the soup dumplings. We ordered the Fried Sea Bass, Fried Rice, Scallion Pancakes, and Sesame Chicken. Our teenager liked the Sesame Chicken. Everything was edible but nothing stood out. Service was curt, (which we don't mind as long as the food is good) The prices of the dishes don't pair with the overall flavor of the dishes. The ambiance was actually nice Â due to the big family groups dining the same time as us. You can hear the subway rumbling by. (Which we liked. It gave the place an interesting vibe. Another group did not) AND they are cash only. There's a BofA close by and they have an ATM. Their bathrooms were clean.
My fav crab soup dumplings. Great cold n hot dishes. It's packed now so good. Cash only

We had the crab soup dumplings, twice cooked pork and the mai fun. Also, this isn't advertised anywhere but this restaurant is cash only. How is that still possible? The atm fees are outrageous of course. I don't understand how it is rated so highly on yelp

On a little trip with my teenage son, this was on his list to try and we weren't disappointed. Ordered hot tea, scallion pancakes and the pork soup dumplings! It was all delicious, hot and food and drinks arrived very quickly! Would highly recommend, don't forget your cash!

Â Seemed pork soup dumplings where doughey and somewhat flavorless. Â Cash only was also a turn off.

Ordered the chef recommended Shanghai chicken broccoli was good chicken was ok . I eat out a lot probably wouldn't come back there's so many other places . Service was good ambiance is nice as well. Cash only spot.

Got an order of each of the dumplings and an order of the beef and broccoli for 3 people and it was the perfect amount of food. We really just wanted to try the XLB and nothing else. We ordered just one order of the XLB and I appreciated that the waiter did not judge us lol. Fast service, quick and easy! They also offer take out too. Most people come for the XLB but I did see that other dishes looked good. Price was reasonable, but was it the best XLB I've ever had ? No. It was good, but just not the best. Love the quality and freshness though!

This place was just OK to me. The price point for the food is fine but I did not see the hype for it. Service was fine and they seemed like they were always in a rush, which was understandable given how busy it was. We would have to try to flag them down if we needed anything. We ordered soup dumplings, scallion pancake, and the Shanghai noodle soup. The soup dumplings were not that great to me. It was hard and doughy on the top while being dry. Other soup dumplings I had were with a clear broth on the inside but this was not. There was scum inside and it was a lot richer than others I have tried. The scallion pancake was okay but a little greasy. The Shanghai noodle soup had a lot of veggies, which I was craving for during my trip, however it was pretty bland. Not sure if I just ordered the wrong items or if I came on a bad day, but I was not impressed.

Second time to this place and I have to eat the soup dumplings before I leave the city. I had the Pork soup dumplings they are so good and juicy, the service was very quick and attentive. Environment wise was modern and little noisy but I didn't mind it. This is a must to try in NY, and don't forget to bring cash if not they got you have and ATM! Totally recommend and coming back 100%!
The crab soup dumplings here are excellent. Much better than the pork. For excellent pork soup dumplings I recommend Nanxiang Xiao Long Bao in Koreatown.

I have been looking forward to Joe's Shanghai for quite some time, and finally got to go! This location is in Chinatown along with many other yummy Asian eateries. My friend and I split an order of pork soup dumplings, chicken lo mein, and shrimp fried rice, and it was plenty of food. The portions are pretty big which is good for eating in in large groups. All of our food was delicious and came out timely, even with a crowded restaurant. The soup dumplings were delicious and full of flavor, I would definitely recommend ordering these. The noodles were also very flavorful, they may have been my favorite item we got. The shrimp fried rice could have had a little more flavor, but nothing a little soy sauce couldn't fix! I would definitely recommend Joe's for a great meal in town!

This place is so overrated and not worth the hype. The only pro is the quick service and nice/clean interior. I'm not sure if there is just a decline in food quality since it's become so popular with tourists, but I didn't find any of the food we got enjoyable or flavorful at all. The scallion pancakes barely had any scallions in it and were really bland. The fried pork dumplings had no flavor, just grease, and the dough was way too thick and gummy. The pork soup dumplings were really big, making for a good portion size, but the skin was also way too thick, the soup was not clear or flavorful, and the filling was just okay. The dumpling skin to meat filling ratio was so off that we couldn't even eat most of the skin bc it was too much.

So, you can say I'm one of those fools who wait an hour in line to eat great food, and Joe's is one of those few places where I will give up my precious hour to satisfy my soup dumpling craving. Â My wife and I have been coming here for 25+ years, and we have been trekking up from the WDC area a few times a year to drip our way to eat the famous soup dumplings. The dumplings have always been spot on and consistent, which is a primary key to a successful restaurant. Â  It has been over 3 years since our last visit due to the COVID pandemic, and we have final broke out of the shell to make it back to Joe's to devour the soup dumplings, and I must say, I am so heartbroken to find that the soup dumplings are NOT what it used to be. Â The dumpling skins have become thicker, the soup taste profile is a bit off, bit into more crab shells than usual, the side dish sliced ginger is not thin, and the most noticeable is the size of the dumplings is larger. Â Furthermore, the bamboo baskets are not lined with Napa cabbage, which makes the dumplings stick to the parchment paper. Â Why am I complaining about the larger sized dumplings? Â I did notice that there are considerable amounts of NEW restaurants that are serving the same style dumplings in the nearby blocks, and I can only assume that Joe's is feeling the competition. Â  With competition, Â one will always try to do bigger and better..... Â I have been in the restaurant business for over 40 years, and I can see that this is an initial sign of nervousness when they are met with fierce competition. Â I've always preached that quantity will never prevail over quality in the restaurant business. Â Quality will always create and increase repeat customers. Â I am so so sad to see the negative changes at Joe's. Â Unfortunately, last night at Joe's might have been the last. Â It was great while it lasted.

When I'm in nyc, this is the place I wanna eat soup dumplings. Â I tried other places before but nothing beat Joe's. Â The soup inside each dumpling was amble for slurping. I wouldn't say that it was anything spectacular to warrant the long wait times though. We would go back again f there were not such long waits. Otherwise, there are many other soup dumplings choices in thar area.

Joe's is a really authentic chain, and I highly recommend it if you ever have a craving for good Chinese food. Yes, it's pretty overhyped, but I don't think you'll be disappointed. This is one of my favourite Chinese restaurants in New York. Their soup dumplings are amazing, specifically the Pork ones. While I have ordered other dishes from this restaurant (all delicious, I'd recommend trying them out), I do tend to only get their soup dumplings now as I pair them with other side dishes from various restaurants in the area for my meal. And the soup dumplings are always, ALWAYS, the highlight. Whenever I try a new Chinese restaurant I compare their soup dumplings to Joe's and nothing has ever beaten their phenomenal taste.

Went on a Saturday night and had to wait for an hour and so we went next-door to the sushi place and had drinks. You give your name at the door and they give you what looks like a raffle ticket and they called us within the hour. The room is very brightly lit so don't expect any kind of ambience. I felt somewhat rushed, and we gave them our orders for appetizers and dinner all at once. The first dish that came out was their famous dumplings and they are just as delicious as everybody makes them out to be. They are hot and inside is a very rich broth that is a little thicker than a typical broth because of the pork fat in the dumpling. We then ordered the scallion pancakes, and they were very big and light and crispy but they did not have a lot of flavor, but the sauce that came with them made up for that. We then ordered our entrÃ©es which included crispy shredded beef, general taos shrimp, and I believe it was general tsaos chicken, as well as a spicy fish dish. The chicken was fresh and crispy and delicious and very flavorful and it came with broccoli. The crispy shredded beef was also very good but honestly, I think I can make it better at home and we also ordered the spicy fish which had an unusual flavor, which I think was an overpowering star anise which made it almost feel like it was in a curry sauce, but it wasn't. That dish went to waste because it was too spicy and the flavor was just too overwhelming. You don't get rice which I found weird and when we asked, they brought small bowls. I also ordered food to go which initially they gave me somebody else's bag but in my food order was sautÃ©ed string beans, and they were out of this world. They had ground pork in them, and they were slightly charred and had a lot of umami. Overall, I thought the place was very good and would definitely go back, but not at dinner time since it's too long of a wait but I would go back there for lunch during the week possibly early on a Saturday or Sunday.

Joe's is old tired and indifferent. This is a place not to go to. The plates are thrown down on the table, one tiny plastic container of sauce for the dumplings. The dumplings were old, cold and tasteless. The staff is indifferent and we could to get out.
No comment
No comment

Came here and we ordered a number of items but I only ate two dishes. Very busy but I find the food wasn't as good as the hype. Â The dumplings were good but nothing extraordinary. The beef noodle soup was a major disappointment with tough beef that's chewy and the noodles were just inedible. Â  Overall, the food is just ok. Nothing to hype about.

This restaurant in Chinatown is to die for! We had two appetizers and a crispy duck. The sesame chicken was the best that I have ever had. The restrooms were super clean and and ambience delightful on an icy day. Â Very attentive staff and great service with a lovely lazy Susan on our table for sharing. This is a photo of the crispy noodles. I'll be back Joe! My only wish: Â please get egg rolls on the menu.

Some of the best dim sum I've ever had we got the steamed veg, scallion pancakes and the cold sesame noodles and it all tasted so fresh
No comment

No comment

Really really loved this place. When a tad early round 5 and no wait which was great. Large venue and cute nice atmosphere (very clean/nice). The star of the show though is the the soup dumplings, they are to die for. Probably my fav soup dumplings in the city and a decent size. Quick service and 100% recommend.
Good food and portion size it good as well. You definitely get what you pay for. Soup dumplings are good and a must get item.

Was in the area so decided to try some noodles from here. I couldn't find parking so I had called and checked to see if they could bring it out for me and they did with no hesitation. The noodles were good and spicy and an abundance of it but I felt like it lacked some flavor - it needed salt or something was just missing. I couldn't seem to put my finger on it. I got veggies with tofu- when I'm eating meat again, can't wait to go back to try the dumplings
No comment
No comment

Delicious spot in China Town. The ambience inside the restaurant is very nice, it's fancier then a lot of the restaurants in the area. The food was incredible, we got the Shanghai Noodles, Frozen Pork Soup Dumplings and General Tso's chicken, all were incredible. I'll definitely be back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of my go-to spots for ordering in Chinese food. Can't go wrong with their fried rice & moo shoo dishes! Also their scallion pancakes are delicious too. However, I've found their dumplings and spring rolls a little inconsistent (occasionally overly greasy / lacking flavor, most time pretty good tho).
No comment
No comment

Very underwhelming. We ordered the shrimp spring roll, pork meat soup dumplings, prawns in chili sauce, and the Shanghai sautÃ©ed flat noodles. For a singular spring roll that cost $5, it wasn't anything special. The pork meat soup dumplings were okay; the dough was very chewy. The sautÃ©ed flat noodles were also alright, it had more vegetables than noodles. But the spicy prawns in chili sauce were the best out of everything. This place wouldn't be my first choice to recommend in NYC for soup dumplings, but it was worth a try.

No comment

we definitely visit joes shanghai every time we are in nyc. but this was our first time visiting the new location since they moved. we remember we thought the place was good everytime we visited in the old location. but when we visited it at the new location, the quality of the food definitely went down and kind of limited. the noodles were very starchy. the pork soup dumplings were not hot. we were actually disappointed with the quality of the food.
Excellence food, excellent service and a cool restaurant. We went on a busy Saturday evening and had a great time - ordered dumpling appetizers and a main course.
I always eat here when visiting NY...even though I live in Cali I always dream about their food when I'm gone.

Thank goodness they deliver on DoorDash because there's always such a long line whenever I pass by / take the trek down to Chinatown. The delivery service takes a very reasonable amount of time and the food is amazing. I love the soup dumplings here, probably one of the best I have found on the East Coast so far.
