column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Food was decent, service was atrocious. We were seated around 8:45pm, didn't get our food until almost 10pm after multiple reminders, and immediately were given To-go boxes and the check. We didn't even finish half the food by the time they were rushing us out. It also took them forever to take our order as I was trying to get there attention, despite there being a bunch of people working on the floor. Organization was just horrible and it didn't seem like a well-established restaurant. I actually rly enjoyed the crab XLB though. Noodles are extremely oily and not special. Green beans were soggy, no crunch, but at least not too oily. Really not impressed by this place.
Overrated. Â Rush service in order to get as many people in as possible. Â Cash only is a negative. Â Entirely too bright. Â Nothing special about menu. Â There are better shanghai places.
Amazing soup dumplings! My husband and I have been on the search for good soup dumplings, and this hit the spot. Will be coming back to New York for more.

Pork soup dumplings were good but quite big and slightly difficult to eat. Pork friend rice was dry and did not have much flavor. Â The crispy beef was well balanced flavor wise. Â Crisp pork chop was great ! Â  General Tso's was just okay. Â Service was attentive. Â Tight quarters with seating. They definitely pack people in there .
I was referred here by a friend and it was amazing! The soup dumplings were incredible and so was the friend rice! I will recommend this place to anyone looking for great Chinese food in NYC!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We tried this place when we were in New York since it was highly rated. Overall, the food here was pretty good but a bit overrated. I would really only recommend the Xiao Long Bao. The stir fry eggplant was good but similar to most Chinese restaurants. We tried several other dishes like the beef noodle soup and the steamed chicken but they were just okay. I especially would not recommend the beef noodle soup. It was really bland. Service was good and attentive. I would come back if I was in the area.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I was so excited to come back here - my last trip was around 4 or 5 years ago. Since then it seems like they moved and must have changed the soup dumpling recipe. I used to rave about these dumplings- they used to be small, delicate, and the soup inside was perfect. Todays dumplings were huge, thick wrappers, and filled with so much fat it started to make my stomach turn. Disappointed.
No comment
Nice place to visit, with good food quality & quantity. Everyone should visit this place.

THE best soup dumplings EVER. I moved from NYC 3 years and every time I go back I have to stop by Joe's Shanghai and get (2) orders of the soup dumplings - one of the Crab Meat and one of the Pork - and the Pan Fried Crispy Noodles with veggies. Always consistent, always delicious. The soup dumpling's broth is perfection, packed with all the flavors you want. It never disappoints. A must if you're in NYC!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment

What a fantastic dining experience here! The interior is beautifully decorated and you have views of the open wood fire grill flaming away. Service was phenomenal and the majority of the dishes we ordered were superb.

The food was very good. This was my first time trying Asian food. The service was very slow and my friend and I had to ask our server a couple of times. But, if you are looking for good Asian food in New York, I would send you here!
No comment
No comment

We got seated fairly quickly! The soup dumplings were delicious and perfectly sized. The broth inside was had so much flavor and perfectly rationed with the dumpling itself. The crispy noodles were pretty good but it could have been crispier.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great food! Love the soup dumplings! We had to wait for a bit but was totally worth it! The service was great and the staff was very helpful.
Classic big Chinese restaurant ambiance with a long menu which is perfect if you come in a group and want to try many dishes!
Food is always amazing - soup dumplings are a must and other dishes are very authentic too! Service is very fast
No comment
No comment
No comment

We were walking through China town on our way back to Times Square from Battery Park. There was this place that had best soup dumplings in New York written on the side and so we had to stop in and try these dumplings. We were seated at a corner table and handed menus. It was SO hot in the restaurant. To the point that we were actually sweating just sitting there. Â The server came over and we ordered 2 beers and an order of soup dumplings. She asked what else and we said that is it. She immediately got upset and was pushing us to order more. We said we weren't really hungry and just stopped in to try these amazing dumplings. She was huffy and walked away. The dumplings came out and honestly they were pretty bad. No flavor. Super bland. The whole experience was just disappointing,
No comment
No comment
No comment

Arrived at 1:30pm on a Saturday, got seated for 5 people by 2pm. Places was crowded but we were well taken care of, the complimentary tea was nice! Had to order the soup dumplings and they did not disappoint. Ordered the fried rice and sesame beef as well but had to change them to to-go orders because the dumplings were so filling! Definitely a place to check out if you have the chance.
Such a fabulous spot! Service is good, food comes quick and the overall vibe is really nice. The food is exceptional and they have such a wide variety of option. Get the soup dumplings!

It's almost impossible to get a table at this place because the lines are so long, so I ordered takeout on Grubhub instead. I ordered the pork meat soup dumplings and the scallion pancakes. The downside of getting them to-go is that they're not steaming hot when you go to eat them. Still, the soup in the soup dumplings is probably the best soup I've ever had in a soup dumpling. I can see the hype behind this place. It's worth it!

While around Chinatown I wanted to try these Pork Dumplings I have kept hearing about!! Well when walking in to get to the table it was pretty busy during lunch hour which just shows that they must be doing something right with all these hungry mouths! The service was very quick, came in ordered the dumpling right away and WOW!!! The flavor was so robust the soup was nice and hot but not mouth scorching, the table had Chili Oil to compliment the Dumplings, which was a nice touch if you are into that kind of thing! Can say I want to go back and try other dumplings and other food they have on their menu, just from seeing other plates that people had around me, I was wanting to try this and that! Thanks for you business!
No comment
Solid restaurant that is great to bring out of town guests. Â Is not the most adventurous menu, but lots of items to please a crowd.
No comment

We love this place. The soup dumplings are amazing. We had bother the crab and pork and the regular pork. Delicious and the soup is hot. We also enjoyed the scallion pancakes and a whole order of duck. Me and my family were filled beyond belief. Great service, great food. Worth the wait. Even though I think they accidentally skipped us on line but we will let that go.
Not really sure how to say not the taste that I like the dumpling top little bit tough the price are ok
No comment
No comment

Good New York Chinese. Soup dumplings are great, as is the American Chinese fare (sesame chicken). Pan fried dumplings were okay, not amazing. Service is typical. Expect a wait to be seated, but grab a drink at the park restaurant/bar next door.

Really good good here! We had the crab and pork dumplings, shredded beef, scallion pancake, and vegetable fried rice. I think the beef was my favorite. Scallion pancake was crunchy. The restaurant moves quickly too. We didn't wait long for all dishes to come out. I used a ton of the chili oil and my water was refilled right on time and frequently. Only note is the fried rice was missing some flavor. I used all the other sauces on the table to make it better. Regardless will definitely come back.

Came when it opened and were seated immediately. We'd heard so much about their famous soup dumplings and they did not disappoint. The dumplings were very plump as far as soup dumplings go. There was so much flavor and soup inside each one of them. We also ordered one of their dim sum appetizers which was super tasty. We wished we'd ordered a second set of soup dumplings instead of the noodles we ordered however since they couldn't compare. Felt the noodles were a bit too saucy and pretty regular, especially following the soup dumplings. Next time will definitely order something else in place of the noodles, but overall would still highly recommend this place!

I always come here to got crab soup dumplings. It's the best Soup dumpling that I ever had in my life. They charge 18% service charge already even I come here alone. I think it's good thing so I don't need to worry about the tip. They also take cash only
No comment

Service was good. Compared to the old flushing queens location, the soup dumplings taste so bad. The broth is so bland and the skin is way too thick. We also had the crispy beef that was recommended in a few other reviews but that too was not great. The strips were so thin you can barely taste any beef.

Love their fried rice, egg drop soup, soup dumplings, bok choy, and lo mein. Can't go wrong with either flavor pork or pork with crab meats. Casual fast service! I would definitely recommend Joe's for a great meal in town! Must try.

The soup dumplings here were super good! We also got noodles and the garlic eggplant. The garlic eggplant was so good and had a nice spice to it. The noodles and the pork in the noodles were a bit dry so one star off. This place is no frills but overall good food!
Great food. Long line no reservation. Soup dumplings are incredible and their rice! CASH ONLY
No comment
No comment

Completely over ordered here because everything here looked soo delicious, but it didn't disappoint! First and foremost, the soup dumplings are a much try. I ordered the classic pork meat XLB, and they were very big and delicious. We also ordered scallion pancakes, eggplant with garlic sauce, bean curd Szechuan style, and the Shanghai sautÃ©ed flat noodles. Everything skews to the oiler end, but I still really enjoyed my meal.

I'm not sure why this place was so packed. Â The food was so so. Â We got the sticky rice, the edamame, crab soup dumplings for lunch. Â The service was rushed. Â They only had two waiters so I suppose that's why they were rushing people in and out. Â There are so many other places to try in this area. Â Provably won't be coming back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The new location is now super clean and new! And the soup dumplings... Great! I always recommend it to my friends! But the new location accepts still cash only so sometimes we give up some orders because of a cash shortage. And the cold noodle was too salty for me.

The dumplings were excellent as we expect it. Â Very juicy with crab meet inside. Â I would order them again in the future. Â Overall i like the foods but service is a different story. Â The waiter was loud and rude. The restaurant takes cash only. Â We had two people but they put 18% tip on the bill automatically. Â I would give Â a 4 stars but zero for service so 2 stars sound about right.
Fun lunch with soup dumplings as the main event! Â A little bit of a wait for this hopping, cash only restaurant. Everything that we read was on point and this place is worth the wait.
No comment
I would literally fly here from North Carolina right now if I could!!! The soup dumplings are absolutely INCREDIBLE and the service is so good!! Love the atmosphere
No comment

The new location that JH has moved into was a great idea. It is incredibly clean and fun atmosphere. The dumplings and Chinese far were spot on. I absolutely love their soup dumplings and they never disappoint. Cannot wait to return.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The best XLB's I've ever had? Maybe. These were humungous. I stopped by for a "snack" and ended up getting stuffed. These are filled with so much soup and the meat and crab were so flavorful. They get pretty busy but we did go on a Saturday. I like that the wrapping isn't too delicate so you can pick it up without worrying about any soup leakage.
No comment
Excellent soup dumpling and noodles. Sizes were very generous. Servers can be absent minded. Forgot to bring rice with stir fry entree.

I was with a party of 12 and while the wait wasn't that long, they require your whole party to be there before they seat you, and they do count! We ordered the Pork Soup Dumplings, Double Cooked Pork, and Peking Duck. The dumplings weren't all they were hyped up to be, but still delicious and larger than expected. The Double Cooked Pork was my favorite dish. It was very spicy but still flavorful. The Peking Duck was surprisingly big! You definitely get what you pay for. Overall the experience a bit of a let down as this location is very hyped up but it was just average in my opinion.
No comment

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Great food with big selection. We got the xiao long bao, beef soup, and my favorite eggplant dish and had a fantastic evening. Be aware that this is cash only. There are ATM's up front but it's better to bring your own because they charge high fees as a smaller bank.

I'm so glad we got to try this restaurant on our quick trip to NYC. Definitely worth it! Service was fast and the food was so delicious. Love the crab and pork soup dumplings! Didn't get to take a picture of the stir fry noodles we ordered because we were too busy devouring everything. Will definitely come back again!
No comment
Still great, but NOTE: Pan-fried noodles are NOT chow mein/lo-mein style. It's the crispy noodles with gravy and veggies on top. Still delicious, but not what we expected

I am obsessed with this place. I have been coming here for the past few years and I always take my family here when they're in town. The soup dumplings are the best I've ever had. Recently, I got the General Tso's Chicken, Beef and Chives, and Egg Noodles with Chicken. All were great choices but the star of the show will always be the pork soup dumplings. The food is very affordable and the service is fast once you're seated. This place is cash only and does not take reservations. If you're a party of 3+, I would recommend coming her at least an hour before you're planning to eat. The wait is sometimes long but very worth it. I usually put my name down and grab some snacks at other places on Canal St while I am waiting for my table to be seated. Overall, this is one of my favorite places and I will continue to come here again and again. If you're ever in New York, I would recommend making the trip to Chinatown for this restaurant.

My group needed comfort food as it's getting colder and soup dumplings were calling out names. We ordered a few other dishes all of which were crowd pleasers.not pictured are panfried dumplings that we ate way to fast to snap a pic. The most important is food comes out incredibly hot and fast! The team knows what they are doing and do it darn well.

Came here late on a Sunday night for dumplings and they were alright. Ordered the pan fried noodles and asked if they were crunchy (I honestly had no clue) and the server said no. Turns out they were definitely crunchy. Server wasn't really friendly but my friend got her dumplings so it was okay. Appreciated finding a table

This place is a tourist trap. The Shanghai food from another block over with the same dishes cost half the price and tastes a lot better. Can't believe we spent over $100 only for four items. We order the pork soup dumplings of course. This was the only decent item on the menu. Then we ordered a cold dish (tofu appetizer), this was really small and can't believe it was $15, totally not worth it for the lack of tofu. Then we ordered a noodle soup with five spiced beef, the beef was r really fresh and tasty but the noodles and the soup was so bland and lack flavor. The amount of noodle was so little it wasn't even enough for a small child to be full. Finally we order the sesame chicken, this was so dry , heavy in sauce but very dry chicken on inside. This was $20 and probably Panda Express would've taste better than this. The only dish that was decent was the soup dumplings and the Rick cakes. But even rice cakes was very greasy like fast food. For the sesame chicken- They probably cooked it overnight and reheated the chicken in the morning. It was pretty disappointing experience because we waited over 30 mins because we saw so many people waiting outside thinking this would be good but boy was I wrong. Never again.

OKAY BEST PORK SOUP DUMPLINGS EVER. Blown away. Could have eaten 20 of them myself. The other food was way good too, but definitely make sure to get the pork soup dumplings. That's a MUST!!! The line is usually long so plan on about a 45-60 min wait. Luckily there's fun little shops and you can walk around China town to kill time.
The food is good. However, the dim sum menu is very limited. The other items are the typical American Chinese food items; they are well made with quality ingredients.. Also cash only FYI.
Food and service was great! It seems like locals even come here to eat as well as tourist!

A tourist or tik tok place at best !! If you're from NYC no reason to go at all food was ok .. great scallion pancakes.. soup dumplings fair at best .. TONs of places that are way better.. Dim Sum Palace much better .. service ok nothing special. bathroom dirty , where you dry yr hands tons of dust and grime.. walking up the steps from Bathroom not a good sight on the steps .. idk what the hype is .. will not ever return

Highkey overrated and can get better Xiao Long Bao elsewhere. The filling inside the XLB literally tasted like a dense meatball, nothing special and the fatty soup could not save it. The Water Spinach was extremely oily and I could barely eat more than a couple bites. Prices aren't cheap either, the Water Spinach was over $15...not worth.
No comment
No comment
Best soup dumplings I've ever had! An NYC staple!

I believe this place is a tourist trap. Â The soup dumplings are fine and I think are middling in almost every way. I appreciate the effect that Joe's Shanghai has had on soup dumplings and New york Chinatown, but I think their quality does not stack up to other NYC dumplings spots

This place was packed when I visited but the line moved pretty fast. The service was decent and food was pretty good. I had Kung pao chicken (tasted different from other places), wonton soup (great), steamed vegetable dumplings (outside shell was kind of hard), cabbage with dried shrimp (great), pork soup dumplings, crab & soup dumplings, young chow fried rice (a bit salty). I highly recommend visiting for soup dumplings! The other dishes were nothing out of ordinary and some items were a bit pricier compared to what's you get.

Be patient as everyone else is waiting. Make sure to check in with the hostess. She will give you a number and will call your group when they have a table. They are checking vaccine cards, and your whole group has to be present. The soup dumplings are so good but huge. Don't order too many!! We ordered 3 orders for 2 people. Definitely don't do 3 orders!! Maybe one order per person if you're really into soup dumplings and if that's all you're eating.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Idk who Joe is but he makes big and juicy xiao long baos. We ordered the pork and crab xiao long bao but didn't really get much of a crab flavor. Nevertheless, the broth inside was a very rich and flavorful. The baos were so massive I was having more trouble gobbling them up than a thanksgiving turkey. Definitely worth a try when you're in the area but prepare to wait out the door as many other customers are lining up for the delicious foods! Service was on par as well!

We stopped in and had the crab meat with pork dumplings after our next door table's ecstatic recommendation. They were okay, but what we really enjoyed was their Scallion Pancake with dipping sauce. We also shared the Seafood Flat Noodle, which was tasty. The joint was packed, which is great for the owners, but we found ourselves too tightly stuffed in, so we got out as soon as we could.

I am a tough critic when it comes to dumplings because I'm Chinese and have some pretty good ones. When I came to nyc I had to check this place out due to the reviews and it did not disappoint. Honestly what makes them so amazing is that they are HUGE with lots of soup. Sooo good! Also got the green onion pancake which was thinner than I usually like them but still enjoyed them. Highly recommend coming here for the XLBs!
No comment

A little over priced but food was great! Lots of seating and a wide selection. Great place to get soup dumplings but also all the local New Yorkers go to flushing for the best soup dumplings. Portion sizes are pretty good and we had no wait on a Wednesday evening with a part of 3

Had seen this restaurant and heard about the good food so decided to try it. The line was out the door but the wait wasn't too long Â and I can see why the staff is very helpful and the food is delicious very good flavor and portions we had the chicken lo mein and Kung pao chicken with a side of scallion fried rice the portions are generous and full of flavor would definitely go back when I'm in my
No comment
Delicious pork dumplings! Service was a little slow, CASH only, table was a little bit sticky, but the food made up for it. It was delicious! Try the fried rice cakes, different and very tasty!
No comment

I can't give five stars because I only tried one item on the menu. But for that sole item, I would give IT five stars in its own! The pork soup dumplings were SO good. You could just see the bits and pieces of pork fat in the soup. I know it may sound and look a bit disgusting but trust me, SO GOOD. The soup flavor was really porky and rich. And you get 8 hefty sized dumplings. Definitely get your money's worth compared to other places that are usually smaller in size. Will be one of my must go to's when I'm in NYC.

Thanks to my fellow helpers I decided to try this place out for dinner. 6k reviews, 4 stars-why not? This place gets pretty busy, we waited close to 30 minutes to be seated when we were told it would be about a 5-10 minute wait. Staff were not so attentive, some waiters were better than others but collectively my party had to keep hounding them down for napkins. The crab meat dumplings were really tasty, my son loved them! Veggie dumplings were also decent. We gad the chicken ask broccoli and shrimp fried rice which was average though I did enjoy the fried rice. We also had the wonton soup which I personally really enjoyed, and the scallion pancake. To drink I had their sake which was OK . I understand the hype around the dumplings but everything else was pretty average. Still I did walk out of there sated :)
No comment

Authentic soup dumplings are the star of the show here! Joe's was recommended to me as one of the best spots in town to get them and I agree. There is no reservation system, first come first serve so expect a wait outside during peak times. Worth it!
The atmosphere here is incredible. Our family gathered here for a birthday party and it was fantastic. The waitress was wonderful, very patient and friendly. The food was excellent.
No comment

Overrated! Joe's Shanghai used to be a great restaurant serving authentic Shanghainese dishes but since it became very popular, the quality of their food noticeably went down in quality. We ordered XLB, crispy noodle and Peking duck. The noodle was okay, my son liked it, the CLB was decent - it was juicy but the wrapper was a little too thick - pls skip the duck it was not worth the price, the portion was small and the meat was dry, the skin was not crispy ( definitely not recommended!)
No comment

We went on Sunday around 2-3pm and the wait was about 25 min for 2 people. They were very busy! The food was so good!!! I highly recommend the crab and pork soup dumplings, I haven't had a soup dumpling like that before! The scallion pancakes were super crunchy and crispy with a great scallion taste, also recommended! The service was quick and the food came out fast.

I never write reviews but this place was amazing. great service and even better food. had pork soup dumplings for the first time in my life, and I don't think I'll ever forget that first bite. a must if you're in China town!

This place was recommended by another visitor to NY and it did not disappoint. The dumplings are bigger than your normal size dumplings and be careful when you bite into them because it's filled with hot soup. Â We came here just for the dumplings, so delicious.... Â The dough is a bit thicker and of course not as delicate as some expensive places but the soup makes up for it. Â This place is a mix of tourist and locals and the decor is fresh and bright. I highly recommend coming just for the dumplings because of it's size and soup. Â Prices are very reasonable too. One order is enough to fill you up. TIP - bring CASH, they don't accept cards.
Food was delish and the service was good. It's kind of a pain that they only accept cash but it's do-able. The beef with string beans was amazing.
I hate this place. It ruined soup dumplings for me. It's never been the same. The texture, the flavor, the filling, even the price. Best soup dumplings I've ever had.
No comment
May take a bit to get seated but great dumplings, sesame chicken, scallion pancakes and more
No comment
No comment

This place was delicious we were in New York and you know how when you're in New York you want to eat at a ton of different restaurants even that being said we still eat here twice because it was so delicious do yourself a favor and eat here twice when you're in New York also there is bubble tea door and it taste good too

Not my first (or last) rodeo at Joe's! With rainy forecast, all I want are their famous soup dumplings. My table ordered the crab and pork soup dumplings and scallion pancake for our appetizer. Then, we tried the Shanghai egg noodles with beef and the glazed crispy jumbo prawns. Everything was DELICIOUS and the portions were huge. Took off one star because my prawns were supposed to come with rice and I asked twice for it and was ignored and it wasn't until I asked a busboy for it was I able to get my rice. Customer service is not their strong suit.

Food was particularly good on the day we visited. Service is always good. Ambiance is very nice at this location. The only thing is that you have to wait for 30 min to 2 hours to get in. But that shows how popular they are.
No comment
Horrible service and food is not good. So overrated never returning. Dumplings were not even fully cooked.
Excellent Chinese food for an affordable price! Xlb soup dumplings were my favorite, Din tai Fung who?

Given the hype around this place and their soup dumplings I was a bit let down. Came on a Thursday later afternoon for an early dinner and there was plenty of seating available. Me and a couple friends split the Crab Meat with Pork Meat Dumplings (A1) and Pork Meat Soup Dumplings (A2). I thought the soup wasn't all that great and the meat was just fine. Nothing necessarily bad about this place, just think it's rather overhyped.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Not sure it's worth the wait, go couple doors down to Joe's Ginger - sister kitchen
Dumplings were delicious. Recommend the crab & pork. Scallion pancakes were my favorite!! Highly recommend
Went to visit China Town today and this place did. it disappoint. These were truly some really tasty soup dumplings and the beef pancakes were amazing. The worker was also super nice. 10/10
Soup dumplings, cold noodles sesame paste. Got here right at opening 11- already hopping. Don't think you can go wrong with anything on menu.
No comment
No comment

Poor service. Rude workers. Went with my family. They gave a 4 seated table. We needed 2 more and they were refusing to accommodate. They left us standing in the middle of the restaurant until we decided to leave because it was awkward and unfair. Nasty people
No comment
No comment
Amazing dumplings. Really enjoyed them - one of the best in town. Solid choice but bring cash (no payment cards accepted)

We arrived at 715pm on a Sunday and the wait was about 30 min for 2 ppl.. it was a packed house with a long wait list. The entrance is very small, so most people are standing outside with a ticket number waiting to be called to be seated. Once inside, it's pretty spacious but a lot going on. There are so many servers and multiple will check on you during your meal and are very quick to take away any trash from your table as well as finished dishes. The food is very fresh! Order their famous meat soup dumplings, but be careful not to burn yourself as the juice inside is very hot! The Scallion Pancakes were really good, would recommend to everyone!
No comment

You can't go wrong the with pork dumplings...or any of the dumplings. The service was amazing, we went in the middle of the afternoon to avoid the wait, it was what everyone had said it would be and if I lived in NY I would be a regular. If there's a wait it's worth it.
No comment
Amazing! One of the best Chinese food I've had in the world, literally. During a trip to NY for 10 days, We decided to come back to joes Shanghai again and again. 10/10
XLBs are well worth the wait. Very good and authentic. Thick homemade dough. Place is still overhyped and can get better Chinese than from this touristy spot.
No comment

My bf and I have had our fair share of XLBs and scallion pancakes back home. We heard about Joe's Shanghai and had to check it out during our trip in NY. The interior is quite nice, clean, and updated. Luckily it wasn't too busy so we were seated immediately. We ordered the crab and pork XLB and the scallion pancakes. The XLB came in a set of 8 and were pretty large. The outer skin was soft and the soup inside was thick, savory, and tasty. There was a good amount of crab/pork filling and surprisingly, I tasted a lot of the crab meat/flavor. The XLB was AMAZING! The scallion pancakes had a thick consistency, crispy on the outside and slightly chewy inside. Perfect scallion flavor and tasted really good with the side of vinegar sauce provided. This place is cash only and there are ATMs right by their front door. Definitely worth the hassle to pull out some cash!!!

SO GOOD 10000000/10 childhood nostalgic favorite dumpling crabmeat joint of all time. So sad they closed the flushing location so whenever I'm in Chinatown I have to make a pit stop. Other dishes like the crunchy noodles are also amazing. Food is quality, and that's all that really matters.

This place always has a wait and there is no wonder why... these are the absolute best pork dumplings I have ever tasted. The way the broth melts in your mouth and the way there just jam packed with flavor is incredible. Try to come on a weekday to beat the lines
No comment
No comment

First of all this is a CASH ONLY restaurant and well worth it! Our entire meal was split between four people and came out to be less than $50 with tip included. I did not have the pork soup dumplings but the rest of the table did and they were WELL enjoyed. Be warned their soup dumplings are big so you might not have room in your stomach for other food. The chicken fried rice and the chicken fried noodles were amazing and well done. The food was excellent and the service was very good. We had a wait but it was WELL worth the wait for this delicious food and the price is unbeatable! Will be coming back for more many times in the future!!!
The soup dumplings are yummy. We had other dishes also it was alright. The fried shrimp with sweet and sour sauce wasn't good. Other than that it's alright. Not worth all the hype.
No comment
No comment

The crab and pork dumplings were fantastic and tasted just like the ones I had in Beijing!!! We also had the sesame chicken, which was also very good. The staff was friendly and the service was very attentive.
No comment
No comment

Honestly, probably not worth the hype. It is a fairly well known spot, so you'll have to wait in a decent line. We went around 6 on a weeknight before the big dinner rush and waited 30min. The food is good, but great by New York City standards. Also Bring cash! They have an atm in the lobby in case you forget.
No comment
No comment
No comment
one of best chinese spots in NYC old location was legendary and better but food and service still amazing 10/10
No comment
Never disappoints. I always stop here when I'm in the city. Very good food. The soup dumplings are a must. I leave happy, full and with left overs to enjoy later.
No comment

The soup dumplings were to DIE for. Visited my best friend and easily want to come back just to go to Joe's Shanghai. They were pretty big in size and had so much flavor. *Sigh* Time to book a trip to NYC
Very good. I recommend crispy noodles, eggplants, mini buns (don't forget the sauce,) and dumplings
Came here for lunch. I highly recommend the pork soup dumplings. Some of the best I've ever had! Will definitely be back here next time I'm in the city.
No comment
Very good food. Cash only, just fyi, but there is ATM available. 35 minute wait to get in for lunch, but service was quick after that.

When you arrive at the restaurant you're probably going to have to wait to be seated, but trust me it is worth it. When you finally make it inside you will notice one thing: soup dumplings on every table. These are some of the best soup dumplings in the city and must be ordered if you decide to dine at Joe's Shanghai. The broth within the soup is so perfectly flavorful and the perfect amount of creamy. The pork is well seasoned and the chives bring it all together. Nothing is better the eating soup dumplings on a cold New York day. Please visit!
Omg the soup dumplings!!!! Love love love! They also have a strictly take out place. That's always great in the run or a lunch run.
The dumplings were amazing! I got the Lo mein and it was okay, very large portion, probably wouldn't order it again. Lots of people waiting but moved quick!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've heard good things about this place but was a little underwhelmed. The soup dumplings were not my favorite-- they were really big but the soup was too fatty. I prefer a cleaner broth, and the skin was too thick for my liking.

I was looking forward to some great Chinese food in NYC. Â This was so disappointing. Â The atmosphere is like an mcl cafeteria. Â The waiter boys are lazy and not particularly friendly. My husbands dish came out a good 15 minutes before mine. Â The sesame chicken was over cooked and dry. Â They only take cash but there is an atm inside the front door. Â They automatically put a surcharge on your tab which explained why the waiters had an attitude.
Good soup dumplings. Dumplings are filled with a lot of soup. Clean and modern restaurant w quick service. I ordered the pork soup dumplings and bill was $13, incl tax.

The food is ALWAYS amazing quality! Everyone can find something here. I was able to select more than 3-4 servings because of the menu's variety. They ALWAYS have great noodles and dumplings. I visited twice last week and still can't get enough of the soup dumplings (made with pork and crab meat, to be exact) and will definitely order the orange beef. It was worth the roughly 20 minutes we spent waiting. I'll see you again soon!
No comment
No comment
Good hand pulled noodles and pan fried dumplings. The potato scallion Â pancakes were good too.

Very good soup dumplings and everything else was on point.Of course this was at the top of my list of places I had to go in Chinatown. Absolutely amazing and how fresh everything was. So good will definitely return when visiting again.
Headed to Chinatown? Joe's is a good place to stop by! Â Soup dumplings are a must here. Â Omg!
No comment
No comment

Didn't take too many photos because we were so hungry. Was a long wait to get in but didn't mind because that usually means it worth the wait. We got the sesame chicken and veggie fried rice which was delicious. The pork soup dumplings were AMAZING. Def must try.
No comment

This place never disappoints! It has effectively ruined all Chinese food from hence forth. We order crispy beef and fried rice. Our kids love the pork dumplings, which is huge since they won't try anything new.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Best Chinese food in NYC if you don't mind waiting and sitting with randos. Delicious food, efficient staff in basic surroundings.

Love this place like crazy. Haven't had better soup dumplings and if they exist I'm not interested . Everything I've had here is excellent, from the shrimp fried rice to the crispy beef. It's cash only so you know it's good. Highly recommend.
I have a coworker who is crazy about the soup dumplings, so I get some once in a while, they are delicious! I need to come back for a full meal!
No comment
The soup dumpling is superb! The shrimp fried rice is really good and fresh. I highly recommended trying something out of the ordinary like jelly fish.
No comment
No comment

The place is always crowded but its worth the wait. Service is prompt and attentive meaning you get your food fast. While the menu is vast the best item Â is the soup Dumplings. The Dumplings are very delicate due to being filled with a rich broth to drink before consuming the rest with complementary black vinegar and chili oil. The next best item in my opinion is the fried rice. Whether it's the chicken, Â beef, pork, or Shanghai style each version has its own unique flavor that when mixed together creates a new depth. All in all a great place to go with a few people and try several dishes. Just make sure to get enough soup Dumplings for everyone.
I've had soups dumplings all Â over the world and these are not very good.

got here around 11:45am and only had to wait 15 minutes for my table. Definitely worth coming on the earlier side of lunch, when we left there were a ton of people waiting outside. Food was amazing and for an amazing price too. Dumplings were great and the sesame chicken was so crispy! They're fast with bringing food as well!
No comment

Yummy yummy goodness in my tummy!! Â This place is the real deal! Â I have been to Shanghai China restaurants and the food here is just as good! Â Highly recommend the soup dumplings with ginger vinegar. Enjoy!! Â Chinatowns best!
No comment

Seeing all the reviews on Yelp plus seeing the huge line outside this restaurant makes you wonder if this place is hyped up. We came around 12:45pm, and was told the wait would be 30 minutes. However, it ended up being about 45 minutes. The inside of the restaurant was pretty nice. Menu had a variety, but nothing seemed extraordinarily special. My boyfriend and I got the pork XLB, crab XLB, the shredded turnip cakes, and the braised duck to share. The pork XLB was surprisingly good. Very large portions and filled with delicious soup. The crab XLB wasn't as good (just wasn't as tasty as the pork), and one piece had something crunchy and hard inside (maybe a shell?). The turnip cake was pretty good. I was expecting the dim sum style turnip cake, but it wasn't what I expected. It also wasn't piping hot when it came out. The appetizers were so filling that we probably didn't need any more food, but it was still nice to have tried the braised duck. The duck was so tender, and the sauce was yummy. Definitely would say the pork XLB and the braised duck would be 5/5 star quality. Note that this place is still cash only. Overall, not sure if the wait is worth it (this place should do the Yelp waitlist to improve customer satisfaction), but I did truly enjoy the pork XLB and the braised duck.

This place is so good. If you want to be seated promptly and avoid waiting in line then arrive prior to 11:30 for lunch. We tried quite a few items on the menu and they did not disappoint. The soup dumplings were good but not my favorite. Definitely worth trying though. The scallion pancake is amazing as is the crispy beef. The service is not the best but I would still go back because the food is so good.
No comment
No comment

These are the best soup dumplings in town! The crab meat and pork ones are my favorite. They're so flavorful and I always eat too many. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves Chinese food and dumplings.
No comment
Delicious and always know what you are getting, we have no dined in since they changed locations but the food is always great! The hot and sour soup is not the same sny more though :[

Easy to miss from the outside, but you definitely don't want to miss this place. The milieu is welcoming to families and the staff is fast paced. Food came out within minutes of ordering and blew us away. The sesame chicken is a must, and is served with the fluffiest rice you can imagine. It dances on your tongue ever so delicately and is no doubt the soulmate to the sesame chicken. The broccoli is average. Also would avoid the crunchy chicken noodles.

If you've ever been to din tai fung, Joe's will disappoint. But I fear din tai fung is the industry standard and everyone else is fighting for second. I can't speak to any of the dishes here other than the xiao long bao which Joe's is known for and the only dish I ordered. Xiao long bao are soup dumplings, one of only a handful of items I can order in Chinese and one of my favorite foods in life that I openly seek when traveling. The line is long; as in 45 minutes to an hour in off hours like 330pm. The soup dumplings are good, but they skin is too thick and the meat filling is under seasoned and the broth while maintaining a tastiness that coats your lips, lacks depth and richness in flavor. Worth a trip for locals, soup dumpling first timers or frequent NYC travelers.
The soup dumplings are to die for. This is one of my top places to come eat and I am never disappointed.
they sell one of the best dumpling! love everything about them

amazing food!! i read reviews saying the soup dumplings aren't anything to rave about, but i thought they were amazing. the portions are family style and perfect for two. the service was excellent! it's well worth the wait.

This is great for groups. They have a giant table that accommodates large number of people. The lazy Susan in the middle allows for sharing. The place is big and food is good. I have only tried the vegetarian options (which were just Okay). But the general tso's chicken I hear is amazing.

Very good soup dumplings! I initially walked by and didn't have cash on me (restaurant is cash only for dine in) but I was able to place an order through yelp and pay with a credit card. It's right next to the Manhattan bridge so it was a nice view to eat outside anyway.
No comment

The wait staff was the rudest I've ever encountered. We had never been before and they sat us after we waited outside (which was fine as there is no room inside) we sat down and the waiter immediately asked us for our order. He knew we had not looked at a menu. I had to tell him to come back three times. I felt so rushed and as if we were an unwelcome guest. We did order in a timely manner and he didn't listen. It was a rough experience and we will not be back. There were two of us and the 18% tip was already included. Â  That's all he got and I'm a generous tipper usually.
No comment
No comment

I was very exacted to try this restaurant since I am from Shanghai. Unfortunately, we ordered 4 stuffs and non of them are real Shanghai food. NOT EVEN CLOSE! Hi guys, if u r from china and looking for authentic Chinese food, trust me, do not go to this restaurant. This is basically an overpriced Panda Express.
No comment
Really good food, I wish I had known before it's cash only. Otherwise, definitely would recommend the soup dumplings. I think it gets really busy after work and on weekends.
No comment

This place is popping! Literally... There were a ton of people waiting to get in and rightfully so. Their dumplings are the absolute best in Chinatown. We had the pork and crab dumplings, pork meat soup dumplings, crispy beef, and pork fried dumplings. All of it was absolutely delicious. Â Note that alot of the times if there are empty seats at a table- Joe's will seat you with strangers lol which happened with us. We really didn't mind. Just another part of the experience we were happy to have left with.
No comment

Joe's Shanghai is a solid soup dumpling spot that I frequent when I am visiting NYC! My sister lives in NYC and I am from out of town so whenever I go visit she always brings me here for a meal. They have good soup dumplings, not the best I have ever had but definitely good and the portion size to price is pretty good as well. They have a good amount of soup inside of them and the meat filling to soup/wrapper ratio is good as well. We also ordered the sweet and sour soup and the beef low mein which were solid choices as well. This is a new location they opened up which is more spacious and updated than their previous locations. Overall I definitely enjoyed this place and would recommend.
Price gouging !! Price went up 30% within 2 years not going here anymore. They illegally add 18% tip for a party of 4 and try to mask it by calling it a service charge.

Maybe it's something about that former location or whatnot but the softness and delicate nature of the bao's skin did not do it justice. Still juicy inside sure, but not complete. So for $15.00 and plus cash only, there are other competitive xiao long baos in the city!

AMAZING soup dumplings! The wait is long, and they don't take reservations (waited about an hour), but it's so worth it! They give you a ticket and time estimate, so we were able to walk around and get bubble tea while we were waiting. The food is amazing, and my friend has been to Shanghai and said it was authentic! I wish I lived closer; I would go back all the time. I can't wait until I can have the soup dumplings again!!!
No comment

Average chinese food, so an average rating, 3 stars. Nothing bad, but nothing special EXCEPT for the tasty soup dumplings. The general tsaos was good. The pan fried dumpling and lo mien were meh. Overall, not a bad meal at all, just not my favorite in the area
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here on a whim at the request of my friends. We tried the pork xiao long bao, and honestly I wasn't expected much but boy was I blown out of the water! We had 2 orders (16 dumplings total) and we finished them in an instant. I've had XLB before at other dimsum restaurant and I had no idea how much difference in quality there could be in one dumpling! These ones were delicious, the meat was so fresh and the soup was so meaty I had no idea it could have so much flavor! Definitely order ahead of time if you can, it can be quite the wait.

I went to Joe's because of the high rating. I ordered a variety of foods including their famous soup dumplings, scallion pancakes, a spicy fried shrimp dish (I don't remember the actual name on the menu), shrimp fried rice to name a few. I personally thought the flavors were bland. The fried shrimp and scallion pancakes were delish! My 11yr old liked the dumplings. I would go back for the pancakes and shrimp though.
No comment
No comment

Foods decent but the wait just makes it not worth it. Lots of people rave about this chinese food so maybe it just set my expectations too high. Price wasn't friendly either but understandable. I've been living in NYC for few years now so I know there are many better options out there.
The xltb's skin were not so thin and the flour were thick and dry! We ordered a steamed fish and it came out overdone and tasted bitter.
No comment
No comment

This place clearly comes highly recommended. Â I didn't love it. Â Yes, there was a 30 min wait on a Thursday Â at 6:30 but that was expected. Â Ordered the pork soup dumplings, which were just average if not bland. Â Tricky to eat, one exploded and shot out on my dress - you've been warned! Â Also had Kung Pao chicken, again not great but to be fair, I don't eat peanuts so it may be better. Â Also had double cooked pork, it was good but very garlicky. Â Personally, I won't be back - too many great restaurants in NYC!
No comment

I always come here for two things: pork/crab dumplings and beef rice cakes! When I'm in town, I often take solo visits here and just enjoy the food. This is their newer location so it's nice and spacious. Waiting times are often not too long and if anything, there's a bunch of boba shops and bakeries nearby you can check out while you wait. The service is fast. They take safety precautions with temperature checks. Would recommend to anyone who comes to Chinatown, you won't regret it.

Food was INCREDIBLE. I chose this place on Yelp because I saw how many reviews it had. I did not know until I told my cousins that everyone knows this place! Â The soup dumpling to me were better than Din Tai Fung. They were big and contained so much soup! Â and the soup tastes fantastic. The shrimp fried rice was so delicious and tasted home cooked. The green onion pancake which I've had many times at other places tasted SO much better than anywhere else. Can't wait to come back here. It gets packed so show up early!! Staff is so efficient and super nice.

By far, the best Chinese food I have ever had in Chinatown. Thanks Yelp reviewers! The only sad part was that we stopped for lunch and not dinner. This is the only bean curd I have enjoyed. It was crispy and served in a rich (just spicy enough) brown sauce, loaded with mushrooms and veggies. The veggie LoMein was chock full of a variety of vegetables, not just noodles. The service is impeccable, and the restaurant clean and nicely decorated. We were greeted with hot cups of jasmine tea. The waiters were on standby so that no cup was left I filled, no request not immediately satisfied. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves here.
Get these dumplings! You will not regret it! Probably one of the best soup dumplings I've ever had. We got pork and they were so delicious!

Soup dumplings are huge!! Could barely even fit in my spoon lol. I've had plenty of XLB dumplings in California and wanted to try this place out after seeing the reviews and I can definitely see why this is their most popular dish. The soup was delicious and the skin was perfectly chewy. Highly recommend this!
No comment

I first ate at Joe's Shanghai (at their OG location) several years ago and recall the xiaolongbao here being just all right. I recently dined at their new location and, I don't know if it was the fact that their new interior decor is just so much better and put me in a more generous mood or if they changed chefs, but the food was fantastic! I had the pork XLB (if you order just one thing, this should be it), which were flavorful, plenty juicy and not overly oily. In my ranking of New York City soup dumplings, the XLBs here might not be #1 but definitely rank within the top 3. We also ordered the vegetable lo mein, which were also very good and much better than I expected. It's also not super greasy, but just really well cooked with great flavors. It's a great option for vegetarians here.
No comment

Ordered A1 and A2 XLBs and a scallion pancake. The pancake was super crispy and traditional. Â The XLBs were for sure different; the wrapper was thicker than usual but surprisingly held a ton of soup inside, which is great! Â Not sure if I liked the crab & pork or the original pork one more, both were delicious!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Love the Shanghai BAO here. The bao are juicy and delicious every time we have to order few more to go. Two thumbs up
Went here specifically for the soup dumplings and they were a solid choice. Do yourself a favor and love yourself a little and enjoy some soup dumplings!
No comment

If you are living or visiting NY, you HAVE to come to Joe's. The soup dumplings are the best best ones I've ever had. Each one is filled with so much flavorful broth. My sister and I ended up going twice on our quick trip. I will definitely be back next time I'm in NY.
Amazing soup dumpling spot . Try both the crab and pork dumplings . Great vibe. The only downside is they accept cash

So good!!! Had read good reviews of this place and wanted to go while we were in NY, it was an hour wait but it's near some cool bars so we just went and got drinks while we waited. Got the soup dumplings and orange chicken-both were amazing! The service was good and the food came surprisingly fast. 10/10 would recommend
This place has the most delicious and authentic Chinese food outside of China. The soup dumplings in particular were amazing and a must order!
No comment
No comment

Expect to wait in line. Good spot. Amazing soup dumplings. Orange chicken was too spicy for me (which means mild for most people) Â noodles were great. Service is fine and tables are close together. Great spot to eat after buying fake purses from Canal Street.
No comment
No comment

We got this to go one morning because we didn't want to wait in the long lines. I tired the Pork Soup Dumplings and Green Beans. The dumplings were really good even after being packed in a box for a little while, so I can imagine that they are 10x better when in person. Definitely one of the better soup dumpling places I've been to. Would love to go in person next time!

This was the second restaurant I ate in, in nyc. I highly recommend!!! The service was really nice and the people were very kind to us. The food was very reasonably priced for very large portions. Â 9/10 would come again :)
Food was great! The servings are pretty large especially the rice. The orange slices at the end of the meal are a nice touch.
No comment

I went with huge expectations but was rather disappointed. The XLB was bland and had almost zero flavour. The Shanghai noodles and stir fried pork were okay but super salty, like a cheap Chinese fast food place. There are much better Chinese options in the area - Joe's is absolutely not worth the hype or the wait.

The soup dumplings are to die for. They are bigger than usual. Be careful if you try to eat the whole dumpling in one bite, I almost choked on the soup! My friend made a huge mess when he bite into the dumpling and the soup gush every where. The crispy chicken is not crispy at all, it's more the Asian style orange chicken (it's mostly sour than sweet, that's what I meant). Friendly service, but they only accept cash!!! The pork fried dumplings are actually pot stickers, and the wrap is thick, but I'm not complaining. I'm definitely eat here again.
Our nephew lives in NY and recommended this place it was sooo good! From their famous pork dumplings and their sesame chicken and their rice it's all great! I would highly recommend it!
Joe's has moved to their Bowery location and this new location is anything but dirty and smelly! It looks amazing inside and there's plenty of space!
No comment

NOT WORTH IT. Definitely tourist trap. We went to a different place for xiao long bao (soup dumplings) and was so glad we did. We came back to Joe's afterwards just to try and it was underwhelming. The XLB was too fatty with not much flavor. The skin was also a little on the thick side - a bad sign. I really didn't even want to finish the rest of the XLB. Cheap? Yes. Get what you pay for? Yes. The wait here is too long and is overhyped.

I am a dumpling lover and man these pork soup dumplings were huge and JUICY! So much flavor in just one bite and delicious. I could eat a whole order myself. I also ordered the shanghai noodles and they were nice and saucy. These two items are my go to's when I eat at a shanghainese restaurant. Would definitely go back!
Best! So good and never been disappoints. The line can be heavy on weekends but most of the time if it's just a table for two you can be in and out fairly quickly. Highly recommend.
No comment
No comment
Food going downhill. Skin of Soup dumplings are thick and not enough soup. Service is rushed and rude. Ambiance is noisy and crowded. This dining experience is not worth the wait
The crab dumplings are amazing. Weird Â to see this place in a new Setting. No more communal tables. But the bathrooms are huge improvement and the service was really a step up.
No comment
Quickly cooked fresh & tasty food that is quickly brought to you. The green onion pancakes are thick & doughy, & need more scallions & salt. Service was excellent. Ambiance was clean & simple.

Loved discovering this place! At the entrance we got asked to show ID and Vaccine Card. The people was very amicable and sat us fast! Food is amazing, very tasty and portions are big enough to share! We tried the pork steamed dumplings, spring rolls and the pork fried rice and everything was delicious! Everything came super fast. The place only accepts cash, but there are two ATMs in the entrance in case you need it. Definitely recommended and coming back!

Come to this fine establishment! Â Good food and fairly priced. I was amazed at how affordable the xlb were here. Â Good service. New location is super clean and food is on point! Â Come check this place out!
No comment
No comment

The XLBs are so juicy and bursting with flavor...a must get for sure! Listened to other Yelp reviewers and ordered the sesame chicken...for $20.95 it was a complete rip off and lacked flavor. My husband said Panda Express's Orange chicken tastes better. Enough said.
No comment

This lived up to the hype. I've been wanting to try for a while and finally made it out. The dumplings and sesame chicken were amazing. There was a slight wait when we got there but the line moved quickly. Well worth the wait.
No comment
No comment
Really great place to eat! I would recommend them for their soup dumplings! The broth was delicious and rich. The service professional and friendly, not too long waiting for food.

Crab Meat with Pork Meat Soup Dumplings, Shanghai Fried Rice, Fresh Calamari with with Spicy Black Bean Sauce, Sauteed String Bean ($78.15): get their soup dumplings!!! This spot was pretty popular with almost every table filled when we arrived. Their soup dumplings were super super good. All the other dishes were okay and portions were on the smaller side, so I would probably just get soup dumplings next time. Dined in person! Cash only!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Quick in and out. Very attentive service, we only had the crab soup dumplings, pork soup dumplings and scallion pancakes, but all three were delicious. We will be back to Chinatown to hit this place and tiger sugar, for boba, just around the corner.
No comment

This place is heaven! The best soup dumplings I have ever had! The West Coast has nothing like them! All the food was delish we! However we as a bit exaggeration we waited for over 3 hours when we where initially told 30 min. We had just landed in NY & our friends treated to this dinner thru told us it was a must try when in the city. We were hungry and tired & did I mention cold! So the wait was ridiculous but the food was the best I had while in NYC.
Amazingggggg some of the best Chinese food of my life! Truly so amazing had an amazing time

Joes Shanghai is a great Asian restaurant if you like American- Chinese food. It's not very authentic and the flavors are not as strong as I am use to with the authentic Chinese take out. But overall it's a good place to start if your wanting to try Chinese cuisine!

Joe's is everything the positive reviews mention. The hour long wait was worth it to have a Saturday night dinner here when visiting from out of town. Happy crowd, bright lights, food prepared to perfection. We had the pork and crab soup dumplings (catch the broth with your spoon) and the General Tso chicken. Tried the scallion pancakes just for fun but wasn't blown away. Great pour of house white wine. Very fun and EXCELLENT service. CASH ONLY and be prepared to take your number and be patient until they call it.
No comment
No comment

Pork soup dumplings are the best. We also ordered the drab ones but prefer the pork ones. We also ordered a variety of food such as scallion pancakes, fried noodles and red bean pancake. They are all very well done. If you are going, try to get there early to avoid the long wait times.
No comment
Amazing. We had the crab and pork soup dumplings as well as the pork soup dumpling. Both were equally amazing, but I liked the crab best of the two. Must visit in Chinatown
No comment

great soup dumplings and they got models as waiters. the duck was nothing special but their crispy chicken was great. the skin on the soup dumpling was pretty thick compared to other places. pancakes and noodles were pretty solid
No comment
No comment

Only complaint is the lighting. TURN DOWN THE LIGHTS!! It would be such a cool spot if the lighting was dimmer. I know the food is what this place is about but it's just simply too bright for a evening meal

I had heard great things about this restaurant so I had to give it a try. The wait was nearly 50 minutes, but this should be expected for dinner service. The staff were prompt, friendly, and helpful. The pork meat soup dumplings were probably the best soup dumplings I've ever ate. There was a good amount of filling as well as a hearty broth inside. We also tried the Shrimp Lo Mein and the Kung Pao Chicken. Both were very large servings and we couldn't finish both dishes. I would highly recommend this place if you want to try solid and authentic Chinese food in the area.

For a place that prides it's entire reputation on soup dumplings, I was a bit surprised to see only two kinds - pork, and pork with shrimp. Come on! If you're going to ride that review train then bring it with a wider variety...! Anyway. Service was great, food was good.

This place gets busyyyyyy. Makes sense since their green bean dish and white fish dish were both deliciously flavorful. I'd recommend putting a name down early on because the wait can go from 0-100 in a matter of minutes, and they don't text/call you when your table is ready; therefore you're waiting in front of the place for a bit.

This is a must visit for a delicious, quick meal in Chinatown. We weren't starving, so all we ordered were the pork soup dumplings. The definition of overrated. I knew something was off when I arrived at the location and the staff told me and my friend 20 minute wait. We walked away for four minutes than all of a sudden our table was ready when nobody left. Very fishy, almost like they said that to dissuade us to not dine here. The soup dumplings were at a inflated price because Joe makes a killing on tourists or people that never had Shanghai food. None of the dishes that were soup dumplings would stand a chance to be sold by themselves. Insider Food did an interview with Joe and he said that his soup dumplings have 30 pleats good and on average chefs have 26 pleats. Well it's clear Joe doesn't work in the Chinatown one because there was 22 pleats when I went. The best surprise of the whole experience is when they charged me for 2 whole orders of crab meat soup dumplings when I ordered one pork, and one order of half pork / crab meat. Pork was $12.95 and Crab is about 3 dollars more but do what you gotta do to keep the lights on I guess. There are local places all throughout Nyc that won't charge an arm for soup dumplings and have better quality.

This place is so much over rated. Food quality is just okay, even for the soup dumplings where they are famous for. There are better quality else where. They also added 18% tips to the bill automatically for a party of 4.

Because they have more four ppl tables than 2.

If it is one place I would recommend authentic Chinese food from in all of NYC, it would be from Joe's Shanghai--hands down. My friend and I were sat on a 4-top table on a considerably busy weekend, and it was better for us so we can order he sample the foods one-by-one as I ordered them for us both to try. The Pork Meat Soup Dumplings, the Scallion Pancakes, and Spring Roll--all from the appetizer menu--was enough to make me full, yet I still ordered the Beef & Broccoli out of curiosity, and must I say... amazing! Their kao fu, sweet tofu with mushroom was also a hit... it's a cold appetizer dish. Everything else that came after was lacking in everything it was either way too sour for the sweet and sour fish, too salty and bland for the chicken, too breaded and salty for the pork chops and the pig feet even though drenched in sauce managed to be dry and salty and the only thing my coworkers thought was decent was the string beans cause it wasn't terrible(it was just bland).. if you do come I recommend sticking with the appetizers and their soup dumplings.

Be ready to wait for a table and possibly even share a table with another party as the restaurant is tight and busy. We ordered two types of Xiao long bao, one pork and one with pork and crabmeat. Â Both had nine pieces each and was packed with great juice and flavor. Wait time wasn't too long for food or for dining. The dough was just the perfect amount not too thick but large enough.

Food was "picked up" and "delivered" within 1 minute. Unless my driver is Nightcrawler from X-men, there's just no way this is possible. Restaurant blamed everything on Doordash and refused to send their own delivery man. What a joke. As long as you still have problematic door dash as one of your delivery options, expect to get horrible reviews.

The shredded beef had 2/3 celery Â and carrots, and barely a 1/3 beef. Â The seafood fried noodles had a Â gooey dark sauce instead the usual light white sauce. Â It was Â disappointing. So, really the only thing I would order here are the soup Â dumplings.

We came upon this place on a whim. We had about 48 hours in New York and one of the locals recommended this place to us for good dumplings. There is usually a line but we (party of 2) were seated in about 30 minutes. The bustling atmosphere and community style seating gives you the full NY experience. We got two orders of dumplings- pork and crab soup dumplings and fried pork dumplings. The food came out hot and fast! I really enjoyed the soup dumplings, the filling is juicy and quite flavorful. Would recommend ducking in here for a taste!

This place is super interesting to me. I waited about 45 minutes outside so I could finally understand the hype and obsession with joes shanghai. The wait process was hectic, but worth it to me because I knew that would probably be the case. Once I got seated it was with another family of four, which I had already knew might happen. I ordered the pork soup dumplings, the wonton soup, low mein, and general tsos. The soup dumpling were 7/10, in comparison to Din Thai Fung they aren't comparable. The wonton soup was a 2/10. I couldn't finish it. The rest of the food was delicious. I would suggest this place because it is great, but I wouldn't spend the time fighting the crowd for a table.

We came on a weekday morning to try their xiao long bao. They were relatively big compared to din tai fung's. Lots of savory soup broth in it. We also tried the shredded turnip cake which seemed different from what I've had before; still tasty! Cash only though but there is an ATM outside. They were a bit pushy trying to get us out so they can have more customers but today wasn't busy and no one was waiting.

The food was not my style, but my family seemed happy enough. I always had a full glass of water, and made sure to use the only bathroom for miles before I left.

It's really not delicious, me and my friend are very disappointed. The wine chicken and the crab meat dumplings no any flavor, this is my first time to leave bad review on public. Luckily no wait! Came on a Friday night and got seated immediately. Ordered the scallion pancake and XLB. The pancake was a bit thick and not a lot of green onions... The soup is flavorful and there's plenty of meat with not too much skin. If you're in the area and there's not a long wait I'd give it a try.
Joe's Shanghai was probably the only place I liked in NYC. Their soup dumplings were excellent. I recommend their eggplant with garlic l, braised duck, general tsos chicken and the sautÃ©ed clams.

We waited about 2 hours standing outside for our party of 3 to be called on. Usually, I would be irate over the insane wait. However, we went during a very busy time of the year AND the food was to die for. Be prepared to be crammed in and share a table with other people. The soup dumplings were amazing--thin, sticky dough filled with a delicious broth and a melt-in-your-mouth pork filling. I've never tasted anything like it! The Spring Rolls were also the best I've ever had. They need a larger location, but I would definitely go matter no matter what.

Gross food and dirty. Quintessential Chinatown: dirty & low quality food. Want some real proper Chinese food dedicated to those with actual tastebuds and standards? Don't come here... unless you are an uncultured foodie with low standards that enjoys oily fatty low quality Xiao long Bao.

I came here specifically just to eat the crab and pork xlbs because they were so good the last time I was here in 2013. I can definitely say that they are worth it. Each xlb is large and the soup inside is very flavorful. I came in the morning at around 11:30 on a Thursday and there was no wait time. Service is quick just like any other Chinese restaurant. Make sure to bring cash cause they don't take credit card.

Didn't expect it but, Joe's Shanghai was actually something else. The value is exceptional. The most flavorsome dish was Lo Mein, me and my friend genuinely loved it. It was so yummy. Team: perfect. Attentive and professional. What an amazing find Joe's Shanghai is.

My personal mission to try as many soup dumpling places as possible. Another one ticked off the list. A friend and I ordered pork soup dumplings, scallion pancake, baby bok choy and fried pork dumplings. Soup dumplings were good but actually not the best that I've had (and this place is pretty hyped up). Scallion pancake was a little bland and slightly too greasy, baby bok choy was cooked well but the flavors weren't my favorite, had a slightly different aftertaste, fried pork dumplings were again good but not the best I've had. Glad I was able to try this place and would def go back but not the first on my list.

Absolutely best soup dumplings I ever had. I some times go to NYC just to have these soup dumplings. The place is kind of small and congested. You will have to share table with others. There is a line to get a seat. I never had to stand in the line. The trick I use is to reach the restaurant at 11 exactly when they opens. Probably soup dumplings is the only things you should have here. I stuff myself with just the dumplings. There is a crab and pork version and a pork only version. Both are almost equally good. I felt the crab and pork version has a slight edge (very slight). The only other food I tried here is the scallion pancake. It was good.

The pork soup dumplings were SO good! We also got the crabmeat dumplings and Shanghai noodle soup. I really liked the Shanghai noodle soup when the chili oil was added, but it was kind of bland. I would rather get another pork dumplings instead of crabmeat dumplings.

Well, we TRIED to do a food crawl of Chinatown. That all failed when we walked into Joe's Shanghai and Tim K. ordered two orders of dumplings, figuring we'd try both the crab and pork and regular pork. I think we could have done half and half one order, but it was too late, the damage had been done. We ate a bunch and still had a bunch left over, but luckily our friend joined us. I think we eventually killed all the soup dumplings, but it was hard. With an egg roll and a drink, the bill came out to $23 with tip, I believe. And now I am ruined for soup dumplings for the rest of my life.

I ordered takeout and it seems the food quality is inconsistent. Â The crab meat in the dumplings was not fresh. Â The Peking style minced pork noodle was bland. Â The fried rice cakes with pork was a soggy oily mess - like they didn't bother frying it. Â They raised the prices (which is understandable) but the quality doesn't justify it.

Awesome soup dumplings. Excellent sesame chicken as well. Generous portions for everything!
Soup dumplings are the best in town. Family style dining makes this a normal occurrence as a solo diner. If there's a wait, grab a drink around the corner at the speakeasy apothke.

Besides the soup dumplings, other must tries: flounder, either pan fried or steamed, both ways are excellent. I'm also a big fan of the wine chicken but this is a bit of an acquired taste. Pour the wine broth over rice and omg, this is best chicken broth rice ever.

My favorite place for pork soup dumplings!! Fair warning - it breaks easy.. so have your soup spoon ready!!! Thank goodness there's ALOT of juice in it!!! We also ordered the egg plant dish, sesame chicken, and Sichuan beef which were all good. Will definitely come back.

Amazing food and friendly service. I couldn't decide what I wanted so I told the server a couple of things and he was kind enough to remind me that their portion is huge and the food might be too much for one person. I ended up with less food that I initially wanted to order but it was just the right amount and I was happy with his suggestions. When I tried to pay the bills, I was shocked to find out that I had embarrassingly forgot my wallet. As a person with social anxiety, I called my boyfriend in panic, didn't know what to do, and he was about to come all the way from Brooklyn and help me with the bill. The waiter came after while and asked if everything is okay. After I disclosed everything to him, he was so kind to let me Venmo him and pay the bill himself.
soup dumplings are a MUST!! absolutely amazing, the room is a bit small so you won't have an amazing amount of space. however, big groups are welcome. a classic!

I had an excellent time dining at the new location since covid. The staff were extremely clean and courteous, wait list must wait outdoors. Indoors the tables were appropriately distanced and the food was excellent. We enjoyed pork soup dumplings, turnip radish cake, scallion pancake, hot and sour soup for 2, eggplant with pork in garlic sauce, Tsing Tao beers, sake, hot tea, & pan fried noodles with fresh shrimp. Â All were delicious. We noticed a nearby table ordered the crispy whole fish in garlic sauce and we will try next! The eggplant in spicy garlic sauce was to die for. The pan fried noodles were tasty and crispy with fresh shrimp. The hot and sour soup was delicious full of vegetables and flavor. I love their scallion pancake and of course, the pork soup dumplings! The portions are huge so expect to share! Tip is included in the bill and oranges for dessert are brought complimentary. There is a reason I have been coming here for 10 years and we still love it!

Amazing Chinese food. Make sure you have some cash Â with you as they don't except any Credit or debit cards. The place is very crowded, but so good. This is THE place to go for xiao long bao (aka soup dumplings). The dumplings are pure palate perfection - the skin lightly translucent, the broth full of warm aroma and the savoriest flavor, with the perfect little meat dumpling on the inside. Â Other dishes I always get because they're too good to resist: seasonal chinese vegetables (if you get watercress or chinese spinach you're in for a real treat), the scallion pancakes, beef lo mein, and the jellyfish. Cannot say enough wonderful things about how ridiculously good and authentic the food is here. Three letters...X L B! The xiao long baos (soup dumplings) here are one of the best I've had ever. My friends and I got the pork soup dumplings and the crab meat and port meat soup dumplings and both of them were equally amazing! It was the prefect soup to meat to dumpling ratio. The soup in the dumpling was very rich and flavorful. We also ordered the spicy salt and pepper prawns and it was delicious, the prawns were juicy and not dry at all and the shell was coated with so much flavor. This dish can get too salty depending on where you order it from but not here! It was just the right amount of salt. Another dish we really enjoyed was the chef's recommended spicy schezuan style fish filet...this dish was sooo amazing. I've tried this same dish at other Cantonese/Chinese restaurants but Joe's Shanghai tops all. The shrimp friend rice was super good as well and paired nicely with the main dishes and was flavorful while not being overpowering. My friends all really loved the spicy chili oil that was given for the soup dumplings! It was so good that they were about to ask for a side of it to take home. I'll definitely be coming back!

Overall it's an experience. The crowded seating, quick serve.

They moved to a new location, which was definitely an upgrade. Clean and spacious. Food was delicious! We make sure to always come here whenever we make it into the city!

Famous. This is the one word that's used to describe this place. There are a countless amount of celebrities that have been here and there's a reason for it. Come with a group for sure. This is the type of place that you order a number of plates and share within your group. You HAVE to get the dumplings. There is no way you cannot come here and not order the dumplings. It's what they are famous for. There's 150+ items on the menu to order so I'll drop se suggestions. On top of the dumplings, the sesame chicken is also good, the crispy duck was amazing, highly recommend it. Pork fried rice is a fantastic side dish to have. The quality of the food is a notch above your typical Chinese take out and it's always a good time to come with friends to Joe's. I will definitely be back.

Love the new space - a very modern and exciting vibe. The wait is intimidating. We were quoted 1h40min and that's almost exactly how long it was. It was certainly worth it. They were still working on getting their liquor license as of 12/25, but it's a pretty basic selection of beers. That's not the reason you're here. The real reason is absolutely the soup dumplings. I had never eaten them before so I popped the first one into my mouth and scalded the entire thing. After I figured it out I was able to enjoy them and found myself wishing I had 24-36 more to eat. This was followed up by the general Tso's chicken which was without a doubt the best I have had. Perfectly crispy on the outside, delicate and flavorful on the inside, and a nice lingering spice of medium intensity. It is cash only and the prices are more than fair. By the end of the meal you will forget all about how long you waited.

*** BUG ON THE WALL OF THE BACK TABLE *** so discomforting to see while eating after waiting over an hour to be seated at a table full of other strangers. Very loud and crowded restaurant with too many tourists and rushed service! The food was incredible but service, atmosphere, and seating is below average. Joes is a favorite but this was so disappointing as they brushed it off and pretended it didn't happen after nearly 5 minutes of us trying to get their attention to remove it.
