This is was one of the most worthy dinning experiences I have had. Â What a place, very secluded, very hole in the wall type of restaurant but totally worth a visit. Â I mean you feel like you are walking the streets in China before you walk up to the door. Â The people, the atmosphere is 100% Chinese so what a cool feeling. Â The food was incredible! Â We tried it all, the best was the pork shank, this will blow your taste buds away! Â I'm serious. Â You will love this dish so go for it. Â We had the dumplings of course. Â Great dinning experience. Â I don't give 5 for Chinese food as most of it tastes the same but this place is an all around journey of pure happiness and I know you will feel the same. Â Be open minded and have fun to be in another country!

Wow totally disappointed. Â After Yelping the best Chinese in Chinatown, this place came highly rated. When we arrived at 4pm there was already an 45 minute wait. Â We thought that was a good sign. Â Found the dumplings bland. Â Pork, flavor non-existant. Â  Crab, only taste crab no subtlety of flavor. Â Ordered the braised pork shoulder, was hoping for Shanghai Pork Chops, did not see them on the menu. Â Before me was placed an uncarved, non trimmed monstrosity on a bed of Spinach and brown sauce. Â After trimming off the inch of fat there was maybe a serving and a half of eatable pork. Â Spinach and brown Sauce were good. Â Orange beef was decent. Â Spicy green beans were bland no seasoning. Â Should have known as the number of Ethnic Chinese eating there were vastly outnumbered by the Tourists (including myself).
Still the best XLB. Â We try to stop here whenever we are in NYC, just for their dumplings. Â Worth the cholesterol spike!

Well, let's just say it's not really worth waiting 30 min to get into. Food was good and relatively inexpensive. Xiao long bao were really soupy so that was satisfying. Not a bad experience by any means, just don't get why Joe's get so much hype when a bunch of other places in Chinatown are pretty much the same deal.
Had some really great lo mein and some doooope soup dumplings here. I wish I could say that we were more adventurous. Next time we will be sure to check out more of the menu.
Of course the dumplings were great, but we were blown away by the whole crispy fish, which was incredibly flavorful.

From a guy who spent 11 months in Southeast China, Joe's Shanghai offered a very authentic experience when it came to Chinese cuisine. The staff was very efficient, and despite the the place being completely packed, our food still arrived within less than 15 minutes. The prices are very reasonable as well. The experience definitely felt like a throwback to my time in China.

Come 'on folks. Â Those jiggly little soup dumplings that this place made press for are available at any Chinese restaurant that serves this region. Â I've been to many a Chinese restaurant in my lifetime and even the little hole-in-the-wall places can execute this dish correctly. Â That said, this place is still yummy, but definitely not original. Â  Don't make yourself crazy waiting in line when you can have your appetite satisfied in many other places in the area.

Great, great, great! Â Loved the Gen. TSO'S, Shrimp and Huan Pork, and Kung Pau chicken too. Â Service was prompt. Â Crowded, but fast ordering and table arrival. Â Order was 100% accurate, and did I mention prompt? Â Atmo is cool vibe with lots of staff, music, and packed with patrons enjoying the best food in Chinatown. Â I'll be back, and I recommend you go too.

This restaurant its a regular stop for us, everytime we go to NY city. We had the crabmeat dumplings. The waiter showed us the proper way to eat dumplings. They were delicious. We will definitely come here again.

Stay away from this place! Dumpling quality is not consistent. Â I got stomachache after eating lunch at their restaurant. Â We asked for two orders of crabmeat soup dumpling but one order came without any soup inside the dumpling. Â Now I can tell those are leftovers!
You won't be disappointed if you want some real Chinese food. Other than the famous pork bun, the other dishes are good as well. Traditional Shanghai food. Recommend for everyone.
The soup dumplings are on par! It's a little expensive, but you won't regret it!

I think this will be my last visit to Joes. The skin of the soup dumplings are thinner and theres a lot of soup... only plus. Do not try the pan fried noodles! The noodles look and taste like styrofoam and the sauce makes it worse.

column3: Budd Lake, Mount Olive Township, NJ
column6: The Â soup dumplings were good, I can go either or..but the beef with broccoli, pork fried rice and fried chicken was delicious. Now they don't have duck sauce, but you don't need it. The chicken could have used a bit of salt, but went well with the tsing tao beer. Note be prepared to sit with strangers, and its cash only.

Read reviews for this place that made my mouth water! Drove all the way from Jersey to this place for the world famous soup dumplings. And oh my God it was delicious. The dumplings were filled with hot soup, the soup was rich and tasty, the skin of the dumplings was thin, the pork was tender, the soup dumplings were just down right succulent. I would def travel all the way back to NYC just for these dumplings, we almost mistaken some other restaurant down the street with a similar name, so make sure it's JOES SHANGHAI! And be careful! They are hot!

Delicious XLB and more. I ordered the crab and the pork xiao long baos, which were very soupy and flavorful. The scallion pancakes were very crunchy and soft at the same time, but I wished they had some soymilk to go along with it or some porridge. The pea sprouts were too salty for my liking, but for $15 I had no choice but to finish them. The shanghai beef noodles were spot on!
No comment
Horrible service, dirty and rude workers. Waited for half hour in the cold just so the front door girl can tell me they skipped my number

Amazing dumplings!! Service was good and enjoyed the food. Went with a group of 4 so we all sat at 1 table and ordered things to share. We had scallion pancakes (awesome), dumpling (my favorite), shredded beef in a sweet sauce, green beans, and a chicken dish :). Good food and quick service!!

Joes Shanghai is a must try when visiting China Town. It's always busy so expect to wait and/or be seated with strangers. The crabmeat soup dumplings are amazing and comes out fresh. The dumpling skin is thin so be sure to pick up the dumplings with the tongs at the top where the skin is pinched together to not break the soup dumpling. Remember to bring cash as they don't accept credit cards or checks. Ill definitely be trying other dishes next time!
Party of 6 had a great time and the food was really good, so I'm not sure what people keep complaining about in the comments! 4 stars b/c it's kind of a hustle and bustle restaurant.
Gotta get three orders of the mini buns to get full but then again I live to eat!
Awesome dumplings! We got the General Tso's and some white rice. Food was fast, fresh, and delicious!

No trip to NYC would be complete without a visit or two to Joes. Â I've had great XLB all over world, including the famous Din Tai Fung in Taipei numerous times but nothing can compare to Joe's in my humble opinion. Â The XLBs here are just...perfection. Â Thin skin, super juicy, and flavorful center. Â Just...amazing! Â  The pork XLBs and the crab XLBs are out of this world. Â  Â I usually don't order anything else besides the XLB, sometimes the green beans when I'm trying to be healthy :p. Â  Oh, and please remember to go to the china town location. Â I've heard of so many people who go to the other location and experienced mediocre XLB, life is too short for mediocre XLB!
sadly Joe's is not what it used to be. Most of my soup dumplings were broken. It seems to be flooded with tourists.

I was told that there was going to be a long wait for it, but there wasn't. We were seated pretty quickly. I was told that the dumplings were really good, and they were yummy. We ate the pork soup dumplings, and it's only the second time I've eaten soup dumplings, so not much to compare it to. The soup was good, but I had more noodles than broth. The beef rice cakes were yummy, we took them home with us. Wish it was a little cleaner, and less crowded for seating.
Went on a Sunday for lunch in the winter and there was no line. The crab soup dumplings is a must, even if you don't like crab get them!! The orange beef was delicious and spicy which I liked.
Totally disappointed on our last visit -- now I think just a tourist trap. Â Last time I was there a year ago sooooo much better quality.

My first experience with soup dumplings and I loooooved them! Apparently this is the place to go. We also had some thick noodles, potstickers, and green beans. All were fabulous. I will DEFINITELY be back.

For the money he food was ok. The portions were a good size and the God was very good quality. However the meals don't come with rice or fortune cookies but they do give you tea. The staff was really nice as well.

Crab dumplings are the best I've ever had. Also ordered the scallion pancakes, Kung Pao chicken and spicy shredded beef. I highly recommend the pancakes and chicken however however next time I go I will make sure to order the crispy shredded beef instead which is not on the regular menu but on the chefs special list. Many people complain about the wait time and make no mistake the restaurant was certainly packed but, being that I went on a Wednesday night and we were only two people I was seated within 5-10 min, if you go on a weekend I would expect the wait to be longer. Fast and friendly service, gratuity is added into your bill which for me made my life easier, note that it is CASH ONLY.
Not impressed. I guess that's why we are spoiled with good Chinese food on the west coast. Â  There are much better Chinese food options in New York Chinatown.
No comment
No comment

What can I say about joes Shanghai. It's definitely and experience. From the round communal tables were you sit with random strangers, to the tinny little street it sits in. The dumplings are to die for. The best Chinese in NYC. So many things on their menu are absolutely delicious. From the fried beef to the noodles. You really can't go wrong with joes. Staff is nice.There attentive. You get your order pretty quick and their always around in case you need something. A must for any foodie or anyone visiting NYC.

Health grade pending for the longest time, now a hidden "C" inside the front door. A C rating equates to some nasty stuff..sad because the food is fantastic. Sorry, can't go back until that grade improves.

Soup Dumplings are on point. Would go there again for that. Sadly, I also got their seafood pan fried noodle and was disappointed to see it made differently than with yellow noodles. It also lacked some flavor. How we we also had the seafood flat noodle and that was delicious!

The soup-dumplings though..... Only complaint about this place is the group seating, which is a little awkward, but the soup dumplings make up for it all!! Overall, this place is a must when in New York!!! Definitely coming here again next time I visit New York!

Pork dumplings made the meal, I could have satisfied myself with these alone. We got here as soon as it opened at 11 to avoid the rush and not even 15 minutes later the place was packed. It is clearly one of the better restaurants in Chinatown, a great choice to experience the area.

Living in Chinatown throughout all my life I'm pretty sure I can identify which restaurants are authentic and which restaurants aren't. Joes Shanghai has been one of the most overrated places ever. Im glad the restaurant is doing well and I hope they continue their success. Many of the local people in Chinatown usually don't eat here because it doesn't taste as good as other Shanghai restaurants and the line here is just long. I can name you 3 other shanghai restaurants in Chinatown that taste 10x better! Sorry Joes, I don't like the restaurant but I don't hate it as well.
No comment
Great Soup Dumplings. New York Staple. Never close.
One of the best soup dumpling (xiao long bao) I try. Orange beef and noodle was also good. Service was good amd fast for whole family of 11 people
The food was good but not excellent and very pricy. The service personel seemed uninspired to say the least. There must other restaurangs in that area of Chinatown where the money is more well spent.

Great authentic Chinese food! Get the soup dumplings!

Great soup dumplings! Didn't really enjoy the fried rice and other entrees we ordered.
Best Chinese food in the city. Really fast, too. You may have to share a table, because they are so packed.

The dumpings were great here but customer service not so much. If they sit you at a big table then you'll have to share the table with other people which i thought was a little odd but I'm from the south so maybe it's just me.
Scallion pancakes and soup dumplings are the best!! The soup dumplings are super juicy. Definitely a loud atmosphere so not a place to go if you're looking for a quiet place.
amazing soup dumplings as everyone knows. Â What everyone doesn't know is that other items on the menu are delicious as well. Â Baby clams in black bean sauce and the crispy orange beef are my faves.

Well - I'm from Queens so I usually go-to the restaurant in Flushing. Â My fav dishes are obviously the soup dumplings, Joe Shanghai Fried Flat Noodles, Sesame Chicken & the shrimp/prawns with chili sauce ( I ask for the shell off ). Â The table situation is for sure different than most restaurants. Â They have giant round tables and you can be seated with complete strangers. Â A tad awkward if you sit down and they get their food first and you are starving, Its torture! Â Don't expect the best service, but expect some delicious eats!

Everytime I hear "Joe" and "Shanghai" in the same sentence I immediately begin to salivate. The soup dumplings are not only delicious, but have the ideal soup-per-dumpling ratio. All noodle dishes here are also fabulous. Shanghai's in Chinatown embraces a family style tradition of eating with other random individuals at one table. If you're into that it can be a very fun experience of getting to know others. However, if you want the same quality meal with your significant other, I recommend going to the one in Midtown. Enjoy!

Overall I would go just for the dumplings, but I don't know NYC so there may be better dumplings out there with a good menu too.

We tried both the pork and crab soup dumplings....i personally liked the crab ones better because they were more flavorful to me, but my friends really liked the pork ones. The dumplings are very large with a lot of soup filled inside and only $5 for each batch.

Whenever I travel to NY, I always make time to dine here. Their soup dumplings are that good! Their service can be a bit rushed, which is good since I know what I want....This place can get so crowded - I appreciate the fast turn over!

For once we got really good Chinese food - soup dumpling was perfection. Other dishes were also very nice. My in laws from Mainland China also enjoyed it.

All you need to eat here are the xiao long bao. Yes, the other food is good. However, I could eat the XLB every single day for the rest of my life! The dough is the perfect thickness and they are loaded with soup. The filling is to die for! We craved them ever since we finished our meal and came home to search Atlanta for the closest thing. Nothing down here compares. We love Joe's!

Yum yum yum! Second time going here. We just ordered pork dumplings! Sooo good! I saw someone say they didn't like sharing a table...that was the best part. It forces community. We sat and had great convo with strangers over great food. Isn't that New York? Side bar: it was nice meeting you Elliot and the gang! Ate until my hearts content will def go back. The wait was not long but probably better here for smaller parties on busy nights.

The service are pretty bad. There are other ppl order after us got dish before ask. And when I ask the waiter he actually shout at me.

The best Chinese food I've ever had. Definitely recommend the scallion pancakes and the soup dumplings. It is also incredibly reasonably priced. However, they only take cash and it is family style seating so be prepared to eat with strangers.

My favorite place in Chinatown. I've gotten off a bus from Boston and ubered straight here. The wait sucks but so so worth it. Get the soup dumplings, Shanghai noodles, Chinese eggplant and really anything! It's all amazing

Soup dumplings, soup dumplings! Yeah I've never ordered anything else there, besides a few bowls of rice. Definitely get the pork soup dumplings. It gets a little crowded, and wait times depend... and you may also have to share your table with other patrons too, but just pretend they're not there.

The best soup dumplings in NYC. Â The food taste is right at all times, not too salty, not too spicy and not bland at all. Â I highly recommend it, also try the braised pork shoulder, fried seabass and fried chicken. Â The servers are very attentive to customers needs.

This was what I was craving for! Yummy, delicious dumplings! The place was packed and super busy but our wait was not long. We were seated with other parties at a big table. The food came out pretty quickly and totally satisfied my appetite. The dumplings were very good and definitely second to no other. The only downside is this was a cash only restaurant. Secondly there is another place that have a very similar name so make sure you visit the right one.
good pork steamed buns and snow pea leaves.

This place has great food, fast service and good prices. The only problem was our server couldn't answer any questions and told us to call him only when we knew what we wanted, I don't think many of the waiters spoke or understood English. Other than that Good Food.

Came here because of the great YELP reviews. However, I was very disappointed. They do not take credit cards and the food was very bland. The service was not great, nor friendly. With all the other restaurants nearby, I would definitely NOT recommend this one.
Dumplings where amazing & service was fast. Will go back for sure when I'm in the city

The soup dumplings are a must!!! I also love the fried rice, being from the West Coast it is difficult to find the right flavor for fried rice in NYC and this place nailed it!

Soup dumplings were good but not worth the terrible service we received. Didn't ask if we needed water or anything! They know the service sucks so they add a 15% tip to your bill regardless of your party size.

Service was terrible and after that the food quality takes second place. The focus was on getting you in and out as soon as possible to maximize the turns on the tables - while the food is tasty it is not that much better than other restaurants - Vanessa's fried dumplings in Williamsburg are just as good and at less than half the price

came here when i was 10 with my family and fell in love with the soup dumplings. fast forward 10 years later.. it wasnt the same. really hoped for the same taste but was definitely lost throughout those 10 years.

I've been to many soup dumplings restaurants but this one, I have to say, is overrated. The crab dumplings are ok I mean but u can find them with better quality and cheaper at Nanxiang Restaurant in Flushing. Plus, this place charged u 15% service fee for basically no service.

These soup dumplings are it. They are so good. The best soup dumplings I ever had were in Hong Kong and when I ate Joe's, I was brought back and these are almost up to par with HK ones. Kind of pricy, but definitely some legit soup dumplings.

Came in the middle of the afternoon on a weekday just for the soup dumplings. Had to wait about 10 minutes but it was so worth it. All the food coming out around us looked amazing-- I will definietly be back.

A great place to get a cheap family-style meal, I usually go with a big group of friends and we all order like crazy and end up paying about $10 each, it's great. My favorites include the pork soup dumplings, scallion pancakes and the sesame cold noodles (sounded weird the first time I heard it, but I LOVE them)! The wait can be long, and chances are you'll be seated a table with strangers, but it's always a good time! And you do have to get the waiters attention if you need anything, they are not the doting kind, but they are FAST!

I am confused why this establishment has such great reviews the food was bland, mediocre, and forgettable. Â The service was okay and the waiter surprisingly told our group not to order a dish because it was frozen. Â The dumplings were just okay. Stay away and do not be fooled.

Ok so the food is freaking good...prepare to wait at least 15 mins for this place and DO NOT expect five star service. This place is constantly flooded with people so the waitstaff are focused on getting people in and out. I don't think that's a bad thing at all tbh. Probably some of the best Chinese food I have had. We kept it quite simple with our orders and got the sesame chicken and Kung Pao chicken (we don't eat pork and the vast majority of items have pork). The food is darn good though! Fast service and straight to the point.

Best soup dumplings in New York, or so they say. Â They are definitely among the best I've had. Â For the bite sized awesomeness these piping hot soup bags deliver to your taste buds, the rest of the menu could go unnoticed, but actually most of the dishes here are also very good. Â Try the pork belly or a vegetable dish as a side.

Very interesting restaurant. I was a little skeptical at first because it was a bit cramped and had a very no frills feel to it, with a big crowd seated at the same table as me and my date. But then the soup dumplings came out and they were amazing. I'd definitely go back again just for that.
Great soup dumplings!!! Come here all the time with large groups. If the wait is too long, try Joe's Ginger down the street.

We had the pork dumplings and it was delicious. We were struggling with the dumplings exploding when we take a bite and only noticed the how to eat them posters on the wall later. You have to put the dumpling on the spoon they provide when you eat so that the soup falls on to the spoon.
Soup dumplings are really big and oily. 456 Shanghai in Chinatown is better.

The food was excellent. I enjoyed how they grouped multiple parties at one table. It didn't feel awkward at all. It was really packed. And the service wasn't as good as I hoped it would be. It felt rushed. And a waiter spilled some hot tea on my friends leg. Again, the food was great. I would have preferred better service though.

Their soup dumplings are amazing . However they had a C rating last time i went. My understanding of C means roaches rodents and food left out in improper temperatures. If they would just keep their place clean then maybe the food will be trust worthy enough to enjoy. I do like their pan fried noodles . But i will not go bAck until that letter is A

The complete finest Shanghai dumplings (xiao long bao) outside of China (perhaps even better than Hong Kong). The crab ones are really so tasty they melt in your mouth. Do not expect excellent service or cozy atmosphere. It is a restaurant in Chinatown, which means you go there for the food, not the setting. as soon as I lived in Hong Kong, this place was a must once I visited NYC to get my xiao long bao repair!
No comment
If you want to try the real things, I sincerely suggest you got to Philadelphia. The dumplings in Dim Sum Garden is million times better.
No comment

This place is so delicious!! Amazing! My first time eating here and it went above expectations. The soup dumplings were so tasty and the noodles are amazing too. Definitely cannot go wrong with anything you order here.

I don't get the hype for this place. Went at 9:30-10pm and there was a long line, had to wait about 30 mins. The food wasn't good and def not worth waiting for. There's way better Shanghainese food elsewhere....

checked three traditional Shanghai dishes and I'm not disappointed. Best service I've ever found in Chinese restaurants here.

Came here with my gf for dinner around 8pm on a thursday. It's about 1/2 hour wait they said but I'm sure we waited for at least 45 mins. It is super packed and crowded. Â We had to share a table with a party of four that was finishing their meal. Ordered the scallion pancake, shanghai flat noodle, pork soup dumplings and crab soup dumplings. The food was ok but the soup dumplings were warm at best when it came out. I kept on getting hit by the waiters when they walk by because I sat on the edge and it was so packed. When the party of 4 left, the waiters were cleaning/wiping down the table shaking the whole table while we were eating. I thought that was pretty inconsiderate. Then they seated 2 more parties of 2. Yes, that's 3 different parties of 2 in one table. Awkward. In conclusion, nothing spectacular and there are other shanghai places in CT that ain't as crowded.
No comment

Joe's is famous for the soup dumplings. They are absolutely delicious. It's popular with tourists and they seat you family style with strangers. You're looking at a solid meal and you'll have a great time if you're social.
No comment

It's good if you don't have to wait long for a table. Â We came when they first opened, and ended up having to share a table with 2 other parties. Â Always find that awkward -- and not sure the food hype really justified the compromised experience of having to sit with a bunch of strangers. Â Cash only (of course, it's Chinatown) so be prepared.

Always a long wait. You know the place by the crowd gathered around the door rain or shine. They truly have the best dumplings in all of NY. That's the only reason to come. And that's the only reason you need! Â They are tangy, and with very light dough. Not overpowering. Â Truly excellent. Â I also like that they sit you at tables with other parties. It's nice sometimes to strike up conversations with random New Yorkers for a change, usually everyone is in their own world. This is a must try.

All time classic dumpling shop in Chinatown. I would say if it wasn't for the lines (tourists) I would give it a higher rating....I find it inconvenient because while it is good, it is not din tai fung good...and as such the line jockeying is not warranted.

i come here everytime i have craving for some soup dumpling...if you come here around 3:30-4, u won't have to wait too long, lunch crowd is gone and its not dinner time. Their soup dumpling is awesome and their beef noodle soup is pretty good as well, it hits the spot in chilly day. The best part of this place is how cheap the food is..probably the cheapest dinner u will have in the city. The only downside is having to share the table with random people.
If I were to rate the soup dumplings, I'd give four stars. They are reliably decent, especially if you come really hungry. Unfortunately, I find the other food really salty and greasy.
Nice cheap fun place to go with a large group, or even on a date. It won't be the best meal of your lives, but for twenty bucks it's sure as hell worth the trip down to chinatown.

Soup dumpling was very good. Fast service! We really like the food and the portions. It was my husband first time to eat dumpling soup and he was impressed. We also ordered pan fried noodle with beef. It was good and lots of meat.

The workers there were so rude. I ordered take-out and when my food was ready, the lady continued to watch her TV on her phone. I ordered the pork soup dumplings because of the hype for them. They were mediocre, nothing to brag about.

We've Â lived in the east coast for 25 yrs and moved to texas 6 months ago. And at those Â time we ate here almost once a wk. were back for vacation and went to joe's shanghai for their specialty soup dumpling. They served us 5 pcs mini dumplings , warm not hot . Since we have not been here long time we thought that they made it smaller. We didn't complain. We ordered Â take out 2 orders of dumplings. We reached home and my daughter opened the package to find Â out that theyre bigger and same size as before. Apparently they served us a substandard food. Its a Â shame . When i checked the pictures i've taken i found out that they served us collapsed dumplings the reason why it was small and dry.
No comment

This used to be my favorite place for soup dumplings until I found Nan Xiang in Flushing (so now every weekend I'm conflicted over making the trek out to Flushing, and my desire for delicious soup dumplings). Joe's soup dumplings are still really good, the skin is really thin, the soup is flavorful. However, everything else on the menu is a wash. This place has turned into a tourist destination and the waiters/menu now caters more to western taste (and prices). Every time I go, there's always a line out the door, and you're inevitably going to have to share a table with strangers.

Service was slow and terrible. We ordered our food and waited 45 min for it. Everyone who came in at the same time and after us all received their food before us. Soup dumplings were bland and the spicy Szechuan beef dish we ordered was nothing but a dish of oil and string beans. Total disappointment. Not even worth one star.
No comment
Super yummy food! Definitely recommend if you're looking for a good spot to eat in Chinatown. The soup dumplings are amazing, as is the shrimp and scallop dinner plate.
It's a hidden gem in Chinatown! Whoever likes Shanghai food should come here and have a bite. Very authentic flavor! Based on my 4 years living experiences in Shanghai.
Super awful service. If I can, I'll give zero star. Also, even for lunch, they force you to give 15% service fee. Avoid it if u can!!!!!!!
Food was good but service not so much. Â Be prepared to share seating with strangers at the same table.

Awesome soup dumplings, but the experience here isn't that great. The restaurant is cramped and the service is nonexistent. You're rushed to finish your food when they drop the bill at your table while you're still eating. Don't even get me started on the wait time. Depending on what time you go, you might be able to score a seat in 10 minutes, or wait a century.

A hidden gem in Chinatown. It's in a small alley like location. Â Expecting a wait during the evening. I did a Togo order and it took 20min. Â Food was good but a bit pricey. Small place and if more than 10people it will be hard and annoying.
No comment
No comment

The servers are rude, mandatory 15% service charge is added, and the worst part was that the soup dumplings had no soup inside them. They were over cooked.. I saw another tray go to a different table and theirs looked fine. It would have been better if they apologized and cooked us a new batch.. But that didn't happen. Very disappointed!
the soup dumplings very well may be the best in city. been going here for several years in a row for a friends birthday and the staff is always wonderful and food consistently terrific.

This place is everything it's hyped up to be and more. The food is excellent and most likely the tastiest Chinese food I have had. This is a must stop for all you folks visiting NYC. You will not be disappointed. We went back a second time on our last night in NYC. One last note...cash only so please make a note of that.

Food was really good however service not so good at all. They also add automatic 15% tip to your bill, so to them they don't really care how your experience is. Amazing food though just maybe next time I do take our instead.
No comment
Yummy food!! Pork dumplings was amazing... fried and steam. Whole fish for $21 very good option
Used to be a fan, but no longer. Quality has gone way down, unfortunately. Better Xia Long Lao at Emerald Kitchen and Xia Kin To.
No comment
I tried this place on the way home from work- it didn't disappoint! The pork soup dumplings were fresh and flavorful and the scallion pancakes were delicious! I'll definitely be back!

Came here for the xiao long bao like everyone else. They are pretty good. Definitely the juiciest XLB's I've ever had. There's so much soup in that dumpling, I don't even know how it doesn't pop! I also tried one of their noodle dishes, it was whatever. If you want some juicy, soupy, xlb's come here.

Like everyone says, you can't beat the soup dumplings. Had both kinds (pork and crab-pork), and they were delicious. Should have stopped there. Also ordered the Crispy Pepper Skin Duckling (influenced by a 20-year-old daily news review in the window), which was not that great. dry, flavorless. win some, lose some!
No comment

Haven't had this for 10+ years. Â And I thought Asian manor is good but this place is still the best. Â  Not just the xiaolongbao. But everything else on the menu. Â Just make sure you come to this Joe's shanghai and not the other one in midtown.
Great soup dumplings to have on a cold winters day to warm you up and fill you up. Cheap prices and quick fast service.

Decent food served up quick and priced right! Went here based on friends recommendation that they're known for great xiaolongbao and those didn't disappoint - good flavor and full of soup. The spicy eggplant and rice cake and fried rice cake with chicken were ok - little skimpy on the chicken and both a bit oily. Overall, good value for money but nothing that will have me craving to come back to next time i'm in NYC.

We were craving good Chinese food, so we came here, based on "word of mouth." It was OK, but it needed to be better. Food was plentiful, yet bland. No particular difference between the dishes that were marked spicy and the ones that were not. I was looking for flavor, and I didn't get it.

This place is in china town, it was full , but the staff have an amazing way of directing traffic. Â They sat all five of us in a table for 7 and then they sat two strangers next to us. Â It was weird at first, but then we got used to it. Â The food was good, a solid 4 stars. Â Servers were not that good , they don't really communicate the menu that well, I felt a little rushed.

I first heard of Joe's Shanghai from friends (who are not new yorkers or foodiea) and the yelp review convinced me to try it out. I normally go to Nang,x k Xiang in Flushing Queens. I waited in line for 45min and Joe's Shanghai was not worth it at all. The dough was tough and not delicate. The texture was all wrong. The dumpling inside was a bit mushy although the flavor was okay. People who think Joe's Shanghai is worth standing in line for have never had authentic dumpling soup or juicy bow. There were a lot of white people in line and hipsters which is the first hint that this was going to be bad. I will never go back. Please try Nang Xiang if you haven't.

The soup dumplings OMG. So good. You share tables which is a good way to get to know some random strangers. We also had the general tso's chicken. Big chunks of white meat chicken, fresh broccoli and awesome sauce. Hit the ATM bc this joint is cash only.

It was my first time visiting nyc & I was mad excited to try this place. Â Heard all the hype a couple years ago & a bunch of my friends recommended me to try this place during my trip. Â Soooo that being said, I decided to make this my 1st stop & get the anticipation over with. Â I was also super hungry after having been on the plane for 7 hrs & in the car for another 2 hrs. Â Me & my friend get there & are told there is a 25 min wait (as expected) & are given a ticket with the number 24 on it. Â Me being the starving marvin I am, I'm watching the host like a hawk as she is calling out the numbers... "20...21..22...23...25" I'm like wait, hold up she skipped us! Â And my friend says, no she's prolly just looking for bigger parties, they prolly don't have 2 seaters available. Â By this time we've already waited 30 minutes. Â I wanna say something but my friend keeps telling me not to, that our turn will come. Â After 50 minutes I'm like fawk that, I go up to the host & ask her how much longer for #24, she says "oh I called it a long time ago, u missed it." Â WHAAAAAT?!?!!! Â by this time I wanna friggin strangle her cuz HAIL to the no we did not miss nothin, me and friend were watching her like a hawk the whole time! Â Ughhhj!!! Â So anyways, she seats us within 10 min & we order the crab soup dumplings & scallion pancake. Â Luckily they came out pretty fast... Unluckily they both tasted fricken WUTEVAS! Â I'm dead serious.. and the bullshit wait had nothing to do with it... The wait actually should've made it taste even better. Â First off, scallion pancake is wayyyy overly greasy & not Enuff scallion... My mamas Korean scallion pancakes takes a huge shit on these. Â And the soup dumplings were seriously NOTHING SPECIAL. Â The flavors did not explode in my mouth... The soup did yes, which i understand can blow a persons mind away (-__-) but I'm talking about taste & flavor here! Â Smh.. I agree with most of the people that rated 1 or 2 stars.. it's totally overrated & a tourist trap

I've been here twice in the last few months and they are great!!! Best soup dumplings outside of Shanghai. The price is also really good. You will often have to sit with others and they don't take reservations so that might be a drawback for some folks. Overall if you want great food, cheap prices, check this place out
The dumplings really are as good as they say. The rest of the food is average good chinese food. Eat the dumplings!

I love the food in this place! If it weren't for me having to sit with 8 more people on the same table, I'd come here every week (note: I live in NJ. It takes an hour to get here with traffic!)! We usually order crab soup dumplings, shanghai flat noodles, and beef with string beans. Everything is sooo good! Long wait and servers who kinda rush you are the only downside to this place.
No comment
Best in Manhattan. Hands down, I make the trip every time I'm here from FL! Pork soup dumplings are muy BuenoÂ¡

Expect a long line. Grab a number and wait for your number to be called. It might seem like a long wait but will be totally worth it. And they go through the numbers pretty quick. Make sure everyone is there when they call your number otherwise they won't seat you. Know what you want to order so that you can order as soon as they seat you. We were a group of 6 but two of us ran out to get boba and they called our number but couldn't get seated until the entire group was present. Anyway! We ordered as soon as we got seated: xiao long bao (steamed buns), Shanghai noodle, scallion pancake, chicken fried rice, and dumpling soups. The xiao long baos are amazing. Be careful when you grab it from the steam basket! There's soup inside so grab the buns from the top to avoid poking a hole and loose all the soup inside. The Shanghai noodle was okay. My friend loved the scallion pancake. She thought it had a good amount of scallion flavor in it. I thought it tasted okay. Very mild in flavor. The chicken fried rice was really good. The flavor was just right. I felt like I didn't need to add any more sauce to it. It was a little too greasy though, making the rice look kinda mushy. Dumpling soup was good. Their portions are good. We weren't sure how much to order and ended up to-going half of our food.
No comment

The first went to here is Christmas break on 2013 when I was in college. This year I moved to New York, and came back again. The scallions cake is still taste good like old shanghai. The steamed buns is good.
Best soup dumpling I've ever had! Soup is so flavorful and filling is delicious. Get crab pork soup dumpling and you are in heaven.

Wow those steamed pork dumplings for real good!! The real charm of the place is the quality of the food for the price. My friends and I were full to the brim and content and only for $10 each! Will definitely be coming back even though that wait is killer.

Great service...good food...hoppin' spot on. a Wednesday night...ordered the spicy calamari with jalapeÃ±os, pork buns, spring roll, scallion pancake, and mixed vegetables...all were tasty...we received our appetizers and entrees fast and the staff quickly cleared away our plates when we were done with them and replenished our water....they even charged my cell phone as we ate our meal
This is my favorite chinese anywhere. People are pricks, service sucks, but food is amazing. Especially the garlic sauce. And beef with black mushrooms and bamboo shoots.

Two words: soup dumplings. How they could possibly taste any better, i do not know. Was here for valentine's day dinner and sat family style with other customers. One thing we all agreed on, the food at joe shanghai's is as good as it gets!

Food was pretty decent. Not any better than my local Chinese food places. I'm shocked it has so many high reviews and maybe a lot of the yelpers are from parts of the country/world where food Chinese food doesn't exist. It's good but not great. The wait staff is rude and wouldn't refill our waters after our first glass. They seemed like they were rushing us out. Which isn't a great feeling when you're trying to eat and enjoy conversation. Go when it's dead and over it'll be a better experience.
No comment
Really great soup dumplings!! Try the crab and pork dumplings - will warm you up and fill your soul with love! Definitely recommend!
Their soup dumplings are incredible!!! Their service is terrible! Still worth the trip if your going for just the food and not the ambiance.
Curt and efficient service, but you aren't going to Chinatown to be wow'd by friendly waiters. Hit up Joe's for soup dumplings. So good. SO Good. Do not miss them whatever you do.

Pretty good but not exceptionally better than other soup dumplings we have tried in other cities. Their service is fast but the wait is long even in between meals so be sure to take a number as soon as you get there!

The service was now good. However, it is a place to go to try their Xiao Long Bao. The wrapping is thin but strong enough to hold the soup inside without breaking. I personally think that the crab and pork is better than just the pork dumpling. It's actually creamy and not too seafood tasting like Nian Xiang Xiao Long Bao which I enjoyed more. Their scallion pancake is crispy like Serbian plain burek. I would not order anything else since it seems like a tourist trap where everything was over $20 for a dish. I believe it is cash only here.

The best soup dumplings in the world. I don't think their other dishes are as good, like the shredded pork and vegetables. I would only come here for their soup dumplings. And I think this is the only place that makes fried buns with condensed milk like restaurants in China - so good.

Tourist trap! It's overpriced, with a terrible atmosphere and the food is mediocre. The soup dumplings were okay, but that could be because I don't have anything to compare them to. And to top off the whole experience, our waiter was picking his nose while taking our order! I really don't understand the hype. I get better food from my local Chinese take out.

Been here multiple times. The quality of the pork dumplings never falters. They are consistently delicious, and are presented to you pretty much as soon as you sit down. It is assumed you want them. I have been exploring the menu over the course of my visits and have some favorites: the fried rice cake with seafood is classic and delicious. Fried crispy whole sea bass, though a task to eat, is very yummy. The sauteed winter vegetables are delicate and refreshing. Try to get here between 5-6:30 so you have only a 10-20 minute wait. Service is quick and there is only about a 5 minute wait for your food.

Worth the wait. Worth the wait. Worth the wait. It's so delish. You may end up sharing a table, but who cares when the food is so good! Â The pea shoots are so delicious and garlicy. Yes, that's a good thing. AND it's cheap! The pork dumplings are scrumptious. Be prepared to eat your heart out!
Soup dumpling and scallion pancake is the best. If there is a long line just go joe's ginger next door it is owned by same people so they have same dumplings there and no wait!
Dinkier location but it doesn't matter. The Xiao long bao are great and I always get them. Other good options are any seafood dishes, and some of the noodle dishes as well.

XLB is so good. Worth the wait and worth making the walk to Chase near me. Came all the way from Queens for this first XLB experience and will definitely come back for it again. Bringing all my friends BUT DON'T FORGET CASH ONLY***
this is a worst restaurant . the food very very salty and the server so bad. I never come here again

Absolutely no complaints about this place.. walked in about 7pm with a party of 5 and was seated immediately . Staff was GREAT, very attentive . Food was delicious ..all of it.! You must try these soup dumplings!

After many tries I finally had the opportunity to devour the famous soup dumplings from this well known Chinatown staple. I was really hungry so I ordered the young chow fried rice to start; it wasn't what I expected but hey it hit the spot. I then had the Soup dumplings and I must say that it was the best dumplings I've ever had!! A must try if you ask me.
I like their steam crab meat bun and rice cake. It is always crowded with people. I wish it is less crowded or larger seating place. Not a good atmosphere for eating, it make me feel rushing.

CASH ONLY! Â  flushing location. Â The soup dumplings were better than average here. Â Service was really nice. Â Workers were very polite and always kept our glasses full. Â Other food we ordered were pretty good. Â Music was great.
No comment

Terrible digs, sub-par and overpriced XLB, and lackluster dishes. The fried flounder is the only seriously tasty thing I've had here. I'd rather get a foot massage across the street and then go Shanghai Cafe deluxe, 456, or flushing.

Amazing. Take the subway, super quick walk from there. Spent 4 days in New York, went to joes twice! Lol We had the soup dumplings, (a must have) shrimp fried rice, shrimp lo mein, eggplant and pork, and crispy beef! (Bomb). Fast service, and you sit at a communal table with other people which was really cool. Â Best dumplings I have ever had, hands down! Thanks joe!!!!
You can't visit New York without eating soup dumplings! Esp in the winter. All dishes are pretty well rounded good.

finally i got to take my wife to her first authentic chinese restaurant ! Â im glad we came here. Â  obviously we chose this place because of the amount of good reviews on yelp. Â  when you walk in, you are placed at a seat in a big circular table, Â dont get too cozy because other patrons will be dining at the same table as you! if you have social anxiety this place isnt for you. Â this may some type of chinese tradition,, or just a smart way to get all the customers in and seated quickly. Â  regardless Â  its a cool atmosphere,,, watching the guys peel the green beans on the table behind us. Â  our servers were quick and efficient. we met some nice people from new york and los angeles. they gave us the low down on the MUST order of this place. i believe it was called dim sum soup dumpings? Â we chose pork. Â  delicious !!! i have never had this type of dumpling, similar but not this way. Â i thank our other table members for recommending that. Â  we went the traditional and safe route and ordered kung pao chicken and pork fried rice. Â giant portions for a good price. Â  we got to take the leftovers home and enjoy a whole meal extra. Â they include a service charge of 15 percent on your bill so heads up there. but dont fret. the service is great. i never once had to ask for a refill. they were always on top of it . Â cash only

Love me some xiaolongbao. Especially on a chilly fall night. A party of 3 of us went for dinner on a Saturday evening so we already knew that we should be expecting a wait to be seated. We saw the massive crowd of people outside the shop on the otherwise empty-looking street and knew we had reached our destination. We got a number and were told the wait would be 30 minutes. I'm really not sure what the system is for seating here, a lot of people waiting seemed confused. A few times the girl would come outside and basically roll call everyone's numbers to see who was still waiting. For this reason, it's probably not a good idea to take a walk around the block while waiting for your number- they are not called in order or anything close to that. After about an hour and a half we finally got seated at a round table with 2 other parties. We ordered the crab and pork soup dumplings with some beers right off the bat. Beers weren't super cheap, but dumpling price was on point. As others have noted, tip is included in your bill. Decided we would try another dish while we were there, so we also got the mapo tofu. The guy asked us if we also wanted to order rice with our mapo tofu, which was confusing since mapo tofu always comes with rice. It's not a dish you just eat straight by itself. OK, so we order some individual bowls of rice so we can eat the mapo tofu. Dumplings came first. They were very tasty and hit the spot. Slurp your heart out. No complaints with the side vinegar and ginger dipping sauce either. We finished these pretty quickly and then our mapo tofu and rice came out. The dish looked okay, but seriously lacked in any flavor (big flavor bang and numbing Szechuan peppercorn feeling is what defines mapo tofu). So this was a fail. We had to ask for the hot chili sauce and vinegar dipping sauce to mix with the tofu to even make it palatable enough to eat. We probably should have just stuck with what this restaurant specialized in- soup dumplings. We weren't a big fan of the host/waiter that kept hawking around the table, trying to pull dishes out from under you before you were even finished. It felt very uncomfortable, like he was just waiting to shove you out even though you were ordering multiple rounds of drinks and dishes and hadn't even been sitting down for a half hour yet. I understand there's a line outside, but come on, I just came from that line....after waiting for an hour and a half. Let me at least enjoy my meal in peace. Front of house staff was very friendly as we were leaving though.

Love the Soup Dumplings (Pork or Crab with Pork), The Duck with The Pancakes and their Kung Pao Shrimp or Chicken. Can Have Enough of them, They're so Well Rounded on Flavor, Presentation and Price. Always Make an Excuse to go and visit.

You have to wait approximately an hour before you are seated. Once you are seated, they will bring you water and ask if you want to order the xiao long bao first. Don't be surprised if they seat you next to strangers and spill water on you. Also you may not really hear what your friends are saying because it's extremely loud there. The pork and crab xiao long bao are really yummy. It has more soup than other restaurants that serves xiao long bao, but the meat is smaller. The scallion pancake is really good and wasn't that oily. The duck was really flavorful and delicious. However the vegetable wasn't that good. Overall, if you are willing to wait an hour and want xiao long bao with more soup, then you should come here. But, if you are in a rush and rather have more meat in your dumpings, then this place isn't the place to go.
SOUP DUMPLINGS (and if you don't know how to eat them it's cool--they'll gladly give you the tutorial) lazy Susan round table with strangers is so communal I dig it

Love their shao Lim bao, Shangai pan fried noodles and sauteyed string bean dish. Â Been a happy patron for 7 years and I keep coming back. Â Check out their ginger ale film Brooklyn. Â It's memorable!

This is definitely one of my top 5 favorite restaurants in NYC. This is not the place if you want a cozy spot or a fancy atmosphere, but it's exactly what food should be--solely about the food and nothing else. My top favorites here are: pork soup dumplings, PORK SHOULDER, and Shanghai fried rice. Be sure to bring large appetite as the portions are large!
Had a great lunch there today. The soup dumplings are like nothing else you've had. The food comes fast, and the tables change quickly. Very efficient place.

When I go to NYC I have to drop by here to get my filling of the soup dumplings. Its pretty cheap and super yummy to me. One of my favorite place to have some Asian food. Only thing is its a bit small and most of the time I have to shared table with other people, which I don't mind only if the table were bigger.
Totally legit. Just go and get the soup dumplings. I've never had anything else there not sure why anyone would.

When you come here don't expect special treatment there always packed to the brim they have the best soup dumplings you'll get in the states and there other dishes are fantastic the general toah (forgive my spelling) chicken is the best I've had and you can even see how they use fresh chicken cutlets unlike smaller Chinese restaurants the dumplings are also cheap alot of people come just for that also they do have a bathroom and if your in the city you'll regret not visiting this place.

Gets a little used to the vinegar smell from their dipping sauce that invades the whole restaurant but the food is definitely worth it. This is definitely a must try. I had both of their dumplings shrimp and pork. This is such an amazing type of food. Lol. I did my research on how to eat it properly before I went and I'm glad I did as I did not make a fool of myself. I took one star away for the service. It seems like they dislike anyone who is not Asian, the server and manger really seemed to be acting like jerks but I gotta admit the food made up for it. The other highlight was their orange beef. This is not your ordinary thin dry beef, it's actually crispy outside and juicy inside....We ended up going a second time before we left NY. Had to have the dumplings again, it's true what they say you will feel happy and in piece while you eat them.

This was the only restaurant that had a line outside so I thought we were in for some great dim sum. You tell the hostess how many in your party and she gives you a number. However, the order in which she calls your number seems completely random (there were people with the same sized party as us, who had an earlier number but we were seated before them). The prices were low but I was not impressed with their food--especially the highly reviewed soup dumplings. Perhaps it's because we're from San Francisco and live on a street with much better dumplings, put stickers, noodles, etc. My boyfriend wanted to eat here so I'm happy to have gone once but it's not a place i would return too.

The skins of the dumplings looks thick but when you actually eat it, the skins are not thick at all. They are thin and chewy. The filling inside is tasty and there is a good amount of soup in each one.

We got their pork soup dumplings first. OMG! They are so good and sooo cheap. I could not believe how inexpensive they were! I enjoyed the community style seating, too.

The best juicy bun place in town!!! They have quite a few authentic Shanghai style dishes you can order. That said, you have to know what to order! Juicy buns, Wuxi spare ribs, shanghai style fish, pan fried Chinese pancake etc. I can't give 5 stars because the environment is only so so. And it is always crazy packed at busy hour. You have to be prepared for a long line unless you go there at 11:30am or 3pm in the weekdays.

FIVE STARS FOR THE XLB. Seriously. Juicy and delicious.... Best XLB I've had hands down. Yes, I've been to shanghai and la. Yes this place is great! Service is not that great, but who cares - food is cheap and delicious!
Underwhelmed by this place. Â There is much better Chinese available without the wait time and the take it or leave it staff. Â This is a tourist trap.
No comment

One of my favorite restaurants! Â The crab soup dumplings are to die for! Â I make a point to go there once a month just to get them! Â They are absolutely amazing and the only place I know that has them! Â The food was also good but those dumplings are definitely memorable!
Soup dumplings. Crispy shredded beef. Yum. Service not as good but good is pretty on point
Big portions and food came quick, had about 4 different waiters serving and as a realist got 2 checks for 4 meals. Overall good food and I can trust the food at this place.

Not only the best dim sum and Chinese food I have had in NYC but anywhere. The crab meat and pork meat steamed buns and the Shanghai chives and shrimp w meat wonton in broth were AMAZING. My wife is a fried rice connoisseur and she loved the fresh made fried rice. Only warning would be the family style seating, but we thought it made it more fun. Thanks Joe's!!!
No comment
Fantastic soup dumplings, good prices, and crazy busy atmosphere. If you have time (usually long wait times), and are looking for a fun and tasty experience Joe's Shanghai is the place to be!
Beautiful and delicious soup dumplings! So delicious! They spill onto your shirt, but it is worth it. I am going to go back.
No comment

I have been to all 3 NYC locations and this one is my favorite. I am absolutely obsessed with the soup dumplings. I like to get one order of pork dumplings and one order of crab dumplings and share them. The fried rice is also really great and different than most places. The only drawback is that you might be seated with random strangers (not the case at the other 2 locations), but in a way it adds to the charm. This place is not fancy, and it can be a bit chaotic, but you will not regret eating here.

All the appetizers I've tried here are terrific, especially the soup dumplings, the BBQ Peking duck egg rolls, the fried pork dumplings, the steamed pork buns, and the scallion pancakes. The eggplant and broccoli dishes are also excellent, while the noodle and rice dishes are somewhat less exciting. Potential downsides include the no-frills service, closely gathered tables, and cash-only payment, but those aren't enough to keep me from making repeat visits.
No comment

Love!! Make sure to get the soup dumplings... Almost didn't my first time there and then the waiter forced us to order them, but I'm so glad he did. Super super packed and you'll probably get seated with randos, but that's always fun. Shrimp fried rice is so delicious. So is the shrimp and scallop in garlic sauce. Â Only downside is cash only.

One of my favorite chinese dishes is dumpling soup. Â The portk dumpling soup was really good and the soup was hot and good flavor. Â The service was typical rush rush chinese semi rude. Â You have to get use to it. Â As long as the food is good, so what. There was a bit of a wait but worth it. Â My friends ordered some of their pork fried rice and they loved it.

Came for the soup dumplings, made the mistake of ordering other things from the menu as well. I'm not saying the scallion pancake, lo mein, and noodle soup weren't good - it's just that Â once you have one starchy dish, the rest kind of taste the same. Sure, it was cheap, but that's because you're just filling up on noodles. Stick with the soup dumplings (we got the pork) - you can't find those everywhere but lo mein is a dime a dozen. We liked how the meal ended with the orange slices, was a nice flavor contrast. I got a kick out of the communal table - wish I had the nerve to talk to the strangers sitting next to me. Maybe next time!

Joe's Shanghai has gotten worse and worse over the years. I would've given this place a 4.5 star rating 7 years ago. The soup dumplings and shanghai noodles are pretty decent, but everything is alright. Service is also terrible. Can't expect much from a NYC chinese joint.
No comment
Xiao long bao (soup dumpling) is very awesome. I'm just a tourist but i been there 2 days in a roll.
The worst service I have ever seen. Soup dumpling was the only one I ordered bz it is a specialty of the restaurant. Never come back!
No comment

Had the dumplings cuz that's what they are known for but I will be back for more. The food was great, good service, waiters are attentive. I've been away from NYC for 3 yrs but it still has its distinct taste that you can't get enough of no matter the food.

Forget the soup dumplings and get the Shanghai Chives & Shrimp with Meat Wonton in Broth. Don't get me wrong, soup dumplings were good, but we thought the wontons were so much better. Even the server said wontons have better flavor.

Came for the soup noodles and was not disappointed. Â I will say, I did not like the ones with the crab, they tasted fishy to me. Â Next time, I would only order the ones with pork only. Â My husband agreed with me. Â We also ordered the Singapore Chow Mei Fun and loved it. Â I have not been to the two other locations, but I loved traveling down to Pell St location, it feels like going to a secret hideaway.
The soup dumplings were gamey. Â They serve the same food that's at a joint with a lit up menu over the counter.
SOUP DUMPLINGS ARE THE BEST! Get this. Plan on waiting and plan on reservations and such.. Just make sure you get these.

This is a typical overrated restaurant. The only dish that was worth eating was the soup dumplings. Four other dishes that we tried were lame and salty. Also they obviously were evading tax for the waiter accepted the next table White customers' credit card payment, but demanded cash only from us. I hope IRS would pay attention to this restaurant for the discrepancy between the amount of business they are getting and the earnings they file. I would suspect they only report half of their earnings to the IRS. Remember the more tax they evade, the more tax everyone else has to pay and it is illegal. Next time, refuse to pay tips unless they take your CC.

I was a bit of disappointed. I went there because of good review. The restaurant is so crowded. I ordered the famous crab dumpling; however, the dumpling filling has crab shell. Some dishes just put too much of soy source and oil. I was so embarrassed since I brought a guess there with me. If you had good Chinese food before, you won't consider to go there again.

best chinese food in the whole usa !!! the pork soup dumplings are a must and are better than any other place i've had. and i've had a LOT of chinese food and dumplings in my life. i will always return to joes whenever i go to NYC. the place is always busy but the move pretty fast so the wait isn't super long
Overstated and underwhelming. Soup dumplings yummy, soup ok, service pathetic and rude.
Waaaaay overrated. Â  Poor service, greasy food, and always a crowd of people. Â One of the dishes we ordered looked like it was reheated in the microwave. Â I prefer Asia Manor on Mott Street.

The dishes we order were tasty. It always crowd and long waiting time. The restaurant is cozy. Bad customer service. I didn't enjoy the food since I felt I have to rush to eat and get out from the restaurant.
I love this place. The service is fast and the soup dumplings are to die for. I make sure to visit at least once every time I'm in NYC
Best soup dumplings in the city. Â Touristy but worth it. Â (Crab dumplings so-so, pork dumplings are amazing).

Crab or pork steam dumplings are the best, other items are so_so. Cash only. Everyday during lunchtime there's a line. Share table with strangers. Service is bad, rushing everything and everyone. 4 stars is for dumplings only.

Joe knows Chinese. Great spot -- crowded , fast pace and great food . Community seating when it's busy --- delicious dumplings to your table within minutes . Start with hot tea and dive into a very complete menu if chinese favorites . Bring cash --- but the prices are more than reasonable .

Great soup dumplings and I would go back again. My first time eating Joe's Shanghai was the one in flushing so coming back here for a treat! It's very busy and crowded so if you don't like people, this place isn't for you. Also, you will have to share table with strangers so if you are not comfortable about that then I wouldn't want to go there. A wait is always necessary so don't go if you hungry. Great food and definitely cheap. It was three of us and we had 4 soup dumplings order and a bowl of beef noodle soup to share.
I think the food is really authentic, we ate a lot! Xiao long bao, fried rice cake, noodles, spring rolls, are all very juicy and delicious! But pls don't expect any service at all.
No comment
Never fails to impress me each time. I recommend going right when they open.. no wait =)

Finally ate in Chinatown and picked a place based on Yelp reviews, (like usual) and was impressed by Shanghai Joe's having so many reviews and accolades from mainstream media. Cold sesame noodles, braised duck and Szechuan tofu were my favorites. Other dishes were not as flavorful. Next time I'll look for a top-rated option that has fewer reviews, less well known.

I've been here twice. Both decent experiences but the second time the line was way too long. We waited probably 45 mins for seating and I'm not quite sure it's worth. The food was good and the service was fast. I had the pork dumplings which is what they are famous for. It was Delicious but be careful not to burn your tongue!! We shared some scallion pancakes which were really good. My boyfriend had the Singapore chow mei fun dish which was massive. Beware that the serving sizes are for at the least two people maybe even three. The chow fun was not my favorite but it's more because I'm not a fan of the dish in general. We also tried the fried mini buns for dessert. It was just okay. I thought the Dough had a weird after taste. It also came with a side of condensed milk to dip it in. It's a crowded space but it was kinda nice sitting next to other people cause we ended up striking lots of conversation. It also seemed very authentic because there were a lot of locals there even though there were tons of tourists. The prices are VERY good. I was shocked when we got the bill because we were stuffed and tried so much food. I would recommend if your in the area but not sure if I would wait for over 15/20 mins for seating.
Service was OK.Place is super busy. Food is Ok. Another place that is built on word of mouth rather than the quality of its food. It's like eating food cooked in 10-w30.

Great food. Some of the best dumplings I've ever tasted. Â After reading all the reviews how could I not try this place. Service is what you would typically expect at a China town restaurant so don't expect to be dazzled or even checked up on. But the food is great so that did not bother me at all. After the dumpling we ordered a house lo mein and beef with brocili, both excellent dishes. Ethan Hawke even walked in when we were there. Lol
Best soup dumplings I've ever had outside of Shanghai! Hot, large, savoury, steaming. Service is quick, make reservations so you don't have to stand and wait in line. Will not disappoint.
Don't expect good service but the food is unbelievable. Order the soup dumplings...don't hesitate.
No comment

This place is a total TOURIST TRAP... The food is average and the service is lacking. They automatically charge a 15% gratuity, no matter how many are in your party. They obviously don't work for it, and it is reflected in the service you get. I walked out of there missing my Din Tai Fung.
Really good food and very quick. Hole in the wall kind of place but amazing food. Gets crowded so plan to wait outside for sometime
No comment
Don't take cash. Delicious å°ç¬¼åï¼ great for a cold weather! Cozy atmosphere! Very packed tho! Will come back again!
Had a great experience! I was escorted right away to my table! Clean and the waiters were very attentive. I tried the dumpling soup, which was delicious! I highly recommend it!

Excellent food. You must get soup dumplings, and its the first thing the waiters will ask you. The service SUCKS, and the tip is already included in the bill so they don't seem to care if they don't treat customers well. That aside, beef brisket noodle soup was excellent as well, spicy szheuan beef was also excellent. Make sure you get there early, because it is packed and lines get long. It is a popular place and many of the people in the area recommend it.

It doesn't Â even deserve an one star. Worst place I ever been to. They charge you a 15% service for being mean and rude. I heard everyone said this is a must go place when you visit NY Chinatown for dumplings "Xiao long bao". The dumplings is just average. I had better. It's not worth it unless you want to be treated like dirt. Talked to the manager and she said oh cash only. WTH.

You will wait an extremely long time for good food. I did, in fact, say "good food." It's not incredible, and it's far from disappointing. You tell the hostess how many people in your party, then she gives you a number and you wait until your number is called. In my case, we were told 45 minutes for the wait. 1 hour and 35 minutes later we were finally seated. The soup dumplings were good, but no better than others I've had. We got a stir fried noodle and seafood dish that was extremely good. I have no problem waiting a long time for food - it just didn't quite live up to the expectation.

A friend recommended the dumplings here when we visited Chinatown. I am glad we stopped in. We ordered the crab and pork dumplings to start. They were delicious and have a warm soup broth inside. We order 4 meals to share amongst 8 and it was more than enough.
Everything(including other food, service, and the environment) besides the Xiao Long Bao is horrible.

Never had soup dumplings before this place, and im in love. Theres always a line everytime ive gone for good reason. Food is amazing, cheap, and i like the communal round table seating. Dont order the bean curd, looked and tasted like. The spicy cabbage is great and the 2 soup dumpling orders are enough for two people.
Service was great, cash only, food was delicious but not necessarily something to go out of your way for.

I hate waiting for anything, I really do. But Joe's Shanghai always suckers me in. Soup dumplings are always hot/fresh and it's just so good. I've never had a problem with the staff rushing my groups out, even when it's slammed. Servers do often need some repetitive reminders that I ordered this dish, or that dish, but I've never had a problem otherwise.
My go to place for Shanghainese in NYC. Always packed but worth the wait.

Went here during jury duty last week. Got sat at a group table and had a very good meals. All i ordered was the crab and pork dumplings and they were out of this world. They are the dumplings that have broth inside them. They just had an incredible flavor to them. Got there at 1pm, had my food by 1:15 and back to the jury room at 1:45. Great break from a day of sitting around waiting to be picked for service.

Can't go wrong with the food here, all around amazing food. Keep spoon feeding me that MSG please. Your service is going to be awful but small price to pay for great food.

Absolutely love. However my last visit left me wondering if I was really eating beef b/c of the meat's texture so I didn't eat it I must say.) deducting 2 stars for that )The dumplings are awesome though!!

This place was the shit, good as fuck. The Zsechuan beef cacerole was Â really good, big, and flavory. I also liked the shrimp and chicken in plum sauce. Every time when I am in NYC I must come to this restaurant for best dumplings and pancake, I never have problem to add 15% tips for even one person , Â downside the service is very bad and waiter staff is rude. if Anyone come for a best dumplings don't expect any good service !!
Dumplings are delightful and this is a religious foodie experience every New Yorker and tourist alike should partake in.

Damn good soup dumplings, but you're on Yelp so you already knew that. Â Everything else is pretty typical - pickled veg, beef pan fried noodles, decent service. Â Only other thing worth noting is it's cash only.

I only tried a few things but everything was fantastic. Grab a seat where one is available, this joint is family style. The soup dumplings are absolutely amazing. If nothing else, stop by for a quick snack, it'll be well worth it. FYI they are cash only.

Food is great but wait for table can be long. If you can manage take out, you can get yourself some beverage and have a great time! Wonderful dumplings!!!!!

Xiao long bao is a must! Check out menu online knowledge is power. It's okay to point out yummy meals to waiter. How else would you know what to get. Lol
I haven't had anything but the soup dumplings, but man, are they good. Â Worth the trip.
Noteworthy xiaolong bao that compare favorably to many I've had in Shanghai, China. Clean and classic decor. Would recommend as an introduction to xiaolong (soup dumplings)
Best soup dumplings I've ever had. It's hard to walk past Joe's without getting an order. Good quality chicken in the General Tso's as well. A little pricey but well worth it.
The waiters are very unfriendly, they just want to done their job. We have to share table with others. The food was good but I was been unhappy by them. Won't go back
I really don't see how you can give less then 5 stars. Â The place doesn't look the best but the food is. Â Unreal pork dumplings

I use to love this place because it was such a tourist destination. It's been years since I've been here and the service still sucks. For sure I'm not here for their service. I'm here for the famous xiao long bao...so good! Since my family came to visit we decided to go to Joe, the famous xiao long bao is not as good as it use to!! I'm sure in NYC there are plenty of awesome hole in the wall places. Definitely wouldn't recommend this place. But of course they have set their name as a tourist attraction place. "Must go!" There service is still awesomely suck!!! What restaurant have a service charge of 15% for just three people?!? If we didn't look carefully to that we would of double tip them a suck ass service. NOW THAT IS SOMETHING I DONT CARE FOR RESTAURANT TO DO! Service charge should be included if the party if greater than 6 people.

Fast service, excellent food (try the soul dumplings!), but occasionally it's hard to grab a waiter. This is likely because of the high volume in some of the locations (the one in Flushing is always great, but the one in Manhattan is quite busy at times), but it's always reasonably priced and tasty.
Great soup dumplings and I just love the sesame chicken and vinegar sauce. The staff was even nice enough to give recommendations. 5/5

First visit to the Chinatown location. Very authentic dim sum experience as they give each group a number when they 'sign in' and pair different parties together at large round tables. While the wait may take a bit, the service once seated is very quick. Scallion pancakes and dumplings are a must! Â Beef and broccoli and shrimp fried rice were also better than most. We will be back!
Holy dumplings, Batman! Â This place was so legit. Â Yum. Â Amazing.

$5 Soup dumplings all day! So good, it will be worth the wait. Just avoid the busy times where everyone and their tourist mother also wants to go. It's an experience. Great to take out of towners to as well.

Shanghai dumplings are great here, so are the other menu items. Don't order too much if you're walking around after dinner, and don't feel like carrying leftovers. Get here early for dinner to avoid the long lines. 5:00 pm on Friday and we got right in with a table of six.
This place is definitely paying for fake reviews. I get that it's always packed with tourists, but 2000+ reviews and 4 stars for unspectacular Shanghainese food?! You must be kidding me.

Save your money & appetite. Â The ambiance was okay, the food was mediocre, but the service was awful. Â These people were not only unpleasant, but "out of there way" rude. Delicious soup dumplings, average dishes. I found the pork soup dumplings to be more tasty than the crab-pork soup dumplings.

Joe's Shanghai is all about one thing - 'Xiao Long Bao', also known as 'Soup Dumpling', and they have 1 main pork based version, and 1 crab (seafoody) version! The particular thing about this particular outlet is that its always tooooo crowded, very touristy and you have to always-always wait in the line to get in! I like the other mid-town location for my own reasons..but definitely you gotta come here!
My signicant other- who is from Shanghai- says this is one of the most authentic in NY. Â I guess I will believe her.

Great New York Noddletown doesn't make Fried dumplings. So my gal and I picked up our panfried noodles and yelped fried dumplings. Joe's Shanghai was recommended on the top the list. As you well know they have four stores with nearly 3000 reviews. So we ordered The fried dumplings and we know we will back later.
